story:
YOUR DOG SPEAKS TO YOU is designed as a story book. It is proven that children learn and retain more from a storybook.

With more than 4.5 million dog bites in North America each year it became clear to us that we needed to write a book to educate the children on canine behavior. Most dog bites occur with the family dog.

After reading YOUR DOG SPEAKS TO YOU children will be more aware of how to stay safe with their dogs. Released in 2015, this book rapidly became a best seller.

And now we need your help to get this wonderful book translated into English so more children around the world can learn about canine language. Please help us educate everyone on canine behavior and keep everyone safe!

Thank you for your help!

To get our book known and to better evaluate the demand for the English version, we are choosing to do a funding campaign and thus gather enough funds for publicity as well as the English market launch.

Crowdfunding is very simple: thanks to your donations, we can launch HOOT Watches ! Do not worry, the project will succeed even if the campaign does not reach its goal. This means that if you help us today, the production will be faster. In any case, you will get the contribution you have chosen !


AGE: From age 4
GENRE: Educational book
THEME: The safely of children and dogs, bite prevention
NUMBER OF PAGES: 32 PAGES,
FORMAT: 5X7 inches, COLOUR
GERMAN BINDING
ISBN : 978-2-9814968-1-2
PRINCIPAL CHARACTER: Sumo the dog
SECONDARY CHARACTER: Joany, Gabrielle and Samuel as well as their dogs Dex and Kyra
VOCABULARY: Everyday language
PRINTED IN CANADA


My name is Kathleen Desrosiers, for more than 20 years I have been working in the animal field as an veterinary technician as well as a consultant in canine behaviour.

Each year, too many animals are abandoned because of behaviour problems or aggression. In 2008, I founded the Aïkiou Company whose goal is to invent and produce innovative products which help prevent eating problems and boredom with household pets.

After many years, my husband Alexandre joined me at the head of the company in order to continue our mission which is to provide stimulating activities for household pets in order to fulfill their natural needs to reduce the number of abandoned animals.

While Alexandre assumed the head of the company, I decided to go for my dream which was to write a children’s book about how to better understand the language of dogs.

Like a lot of families we have animals and we were looking for educational tools to help our daughters learn how to be safer around our dogs.

Keeping in mind that most dog bites are caused by the family dog, we needed a tool to help our children learn to identify the different signals dogs use to communicate with us.

We decided to create our first story book which facilitates teaching in a playful way how to behave around dogs and therefore prevent bites.

That is how Fondation Humanimo was born in 2014 with an educational mission towards children and their families. We invite you to share this book with your children and the people around you to help us attain our goal.

Together we will succeed to reduce the risk of animal bites and abandonment.

A very big thank you to all of you for your help!



Humanimo Foundation is a non-profit organization with a mission to promote a healthy relationship between humans and animals while sensitizing children to the animals’ needs; this would permit the establishment of safety prevention strategies. With our multidisciplinary team, we wish to promote the knowledge and awareness of animal language and behaviour through the creation of this book, the educational materials and workshops for youths, all through real and professional information. We also want to extoll the virtues of zootherapy as well as children interaction activities with animals.
story_txt:
YOUR DOG SPEAKS TO YOU is designed as a story book. It is proven that children learn and retain more from a storybook.With more than 4.5 million dog bites in North America each year it became clear to us that we needed to write a book to educate the children on canine behavior. Most dog bites occur with the family dog.After reading YOUR DOG SPEAKS TO YOU children will be more aware of how to stay safe with their dogs. Released in 2015, this book rapidly became a best seller.
And now we need your help to get this wonderful book translated into English so more children around the world can learn about canine language. Please help us educate everyone on canine behavior and keep everyone safe!
Thank you for your help!

To get our
book known and to better evaluate the demand for the English version, we are
choosing to do a funding campaign and thus gather enough funds for publicity as
well as the English market launch.
Crowdfunding
is very simple: thanks to your donations, we can launch HOOT Watches ! Do
not worry, the project will succeed even if the campaign does not reach its
goal. This means that if you help us today, the production will be faster. In
any case, you will get the contribution you have chosen !

Each year, too many animals are abandoned
because of behaviour problems or aggression. In 2008, I founded the Aïkiou

prevent eating problems and boredom with household pets.

story:
"Most people do not listen with the intent to understand; they listen with the intent to reply.” - Stephen R. Covey

From an early age I have been passionate about developing the skills to help others resolve conflict. Initially this was through the teachings of a martial art that focuses more on understanding the psychology of conflict, than just the physical aspect. Over the past 25 years I have evolved this art way beyond the boundaries of physical conflict to where it is today. I believe that through the teachings of understanding perception and effective communication styles, most day-to-day conflicts can be resolved peacefully.

Being so passionate and experienced at resolving conflict, I now want to spread this knowledge to helping others to become more confident in themselves. My goal is to help others resolve conflicts within them selves, personal relationships, bringing harmony to the workplace and also supporting schools with a variety of anti-bullying and self-esteem programs.

By supporting this campaign you will help to bring essential life skills to many people and help to build understanding and confidence in others; because "Confidence is Beautiful!"

What We Need & What You Get

By supporting this campaign it demonstrates how passionate you also feel about helping others to resolve conflict. Your funding will allow for the programs already started to become reality and the birth of others.

The funding will specifically go to these areas:
• Development and implementation of various Conflict Resolution Workshops
• Financial support to offering anti-bullying programs to schools
• Youth programs for teenagers to understand and develop inner beauty
• Low-Income community programs to encourage young adults to inspire others
• Assisting children with challenging behaviours

What do you get out of donating to this campaign?
• Should you choose; you could be listed on handout materials helping to promote yourself or business.
• You get to become part of a bigger picture towards helping others to resolve conflict.
• Various perks based upon campaign contribution (See perks!)

Our goal is to reach the $10,000 at this time. This will provide the valuable resources and programs needed to reach those that cannot afford them. Even if you are unable to financially contribute but are able to assist in making important connections, you have our deepest appreciations.

We are committed to "Inspiring Other to Resolve Conflict".

    The Impact

    The impact you can make by donating to this campaign is huge. As we know bullying remains in our schools. Children have to deal with confidence issues on a daily bases. Sure! There is much support available through help lines etc. but the true impact comes from what youth do on a daily bases in the school environment. The same applies to teenage girls for example. They are constantly trying to fit in to societies standards while managing their own personal development. The peer pressure to be slim, to wear certain clothing or to simply "fit in" is unbearable at times. Add the forever changing hormonal aspects and you start to develop a much bigger picture. Educating teenage girls on how boys perceive them and that "True self confidence comes from with and not from what others make think say or do", could make a huge difference in their lives. Can you imagine being in a position where you are able to help just one person to feel beautiful?

    I can assure you "It feels incredible!"

    Our goal is to provide people with the understanding and skills to resolve conflict. To inspire them to become great role models; not only to others but more importantly to themselves.

    Risks & Challenges

    Our biggest challenge has been cutting through the red tape in attempting to get into schools. This is mainly due to funding. We simply don't have the funding to support the programs we have developed and taught on a smaller scale.

    As we know the public school system specifically is low on funding and cannot afford specialized programs. They therefore rely on many free hand outs inclusive of motivational talks. As great as these talks are at the time; as much as they inspire at the time; children forget most of it the second they step out of the door and back into the reality of their daily routine.

    With your donations we can start to realistically approach the schools knowing that one of the biggest hurdles has been removed. The same applies to low-income communities that also rely on hand outs. Our passion and commitment to making things happen is unwavering and I'm hoping you will join the cause.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We fully appreciate and can relate to the fact that there are many that simply cannot afford to contribute. When you know you have programs that can make a big impact in the lives of others, there is nothing more frustrating than knowing you can't afford to do it.

    So how can you help in other ways?

    • Spread the word of our conflict resolution workshops in any way you can!
    • Help connect us with those that may be willing to contribute.
    • Help connect us with corporate entities that could benefit from our workshops.
    • The greater success we get with these, the more funding becomes available to run the lesser funded programs.

    In anticipation of your support, I would like to say Thank You!

story:
Help us bring play-based, nature inspired education to the kids in our community!

 

Located in a small, coastal town on the Pacific, Boggy Boots Play School hopes to provide families and children with a new educational experience. Our motto is, ‘creative learning through play and discovery,’ and we hope to provide children and families with a new, enriching educational environment to help their children thrive.

 

We no longer feel that the traditional education model is working for preschool age students. There needs to be a return to ‘play as children’s work,’ and our goal is to foster a stronger connection to nature and our community. With over ten years of combined early childhood education experience, Emily and Allison are prepared to offer a new learning experience for preschoolers in the community.

 

We are halfway to our funding goal, but we need YOU to help us get to the finish line. Any donated funds will be used towards classroom materials and supplies; this includes everything from crayons and paint, to tables and chairs. Our biggest cost will be quality outdoor gear for every child. We believe that there’s no such thing as bad weather and we can’t wait to get outside!

Our biggest cost will be quality outdoor gear for every child. We believe that there’s no such thing as bad weather and we can’t wait to get outside!

story:
Automation, artificial intelligence (AI), and robotics are increasingly common factors in each of our lives. We may not realize it, but we encounter this technology in some way almost every day.

These technological revolutions have made our lives more efficient and productive. There is a consequence that has developed from them as well: the elimination of jobs.

As work becomes more redundant, our professional activities become increasingly unnecessary.

AI has the ability to perform simple tasks faster and cheaper than humans. In time, we will see more than chatbots and automated customer service. Robotics and automation could replace physicians, engineers, attorneys, and manufacturing professionals in the near future.

This is the problem we face.

Thankfully, there is a solution available that is accessible to all of us. Aatos by Nexeraa will empower future generations to take advantage of the technological evolution of AI.

 

Why We Must Face the Threat of AI Right Now

AI automation could create $14 trillion in disruptive impacts within the manufacturing sector. Some of these impacts, such as lower wages, fewer jobs, and efficiency gains, are already being experienced.

These are benefits that help the corporation instead of the worker.

Famed scientist Stephen Hawking told the BBC in 2014 and in 2017 that the rise of AI would be “either the best or the worst thing ever to happen to humanity – we do not yet know which.”

AI has the potential to eradicate disease. It can eliminate poverty.

It could also lead to full-scale unemployment.

In a worst-case scenario, autonomous systems could even view humanity as a threat and work to remove us from our planet.

We believe that a positive future, full of potential, is within our reach.

Nexeraa is a socially-conscious software company that acknowledges there are challenges with AI on the horizon. We also know that when it is used to benefit humanity, AI can be a life-changing solution.

We can empower ourselves to create a brighter future.

 

We Program for People, Not Profits

Aatos is a concept that has generated large-scale interest. It is also something that we feel belongs with everyone. It should not be something that is exclusive to the brand, business, or individual that can pay the most for it.

That is why our motto is, “Programming for people, not for profit.” What kind of future would we create for ourselves if we helped corporations push people toward an economic dead-end?

Our commitment with Aatos is to create a free, open-source, drag-and-drop platform which enables any person with a computer and basic internet knowledge to use the advantages of automation.

There are 5 key benefits that Aatos provides each person who uses it.

  1. Aatos provides a free and more efficient manner of accessing high-quality training.
  2. Users can take advantage of automation’s amazing features with current knowledge.
  3. Automation-enhanced services allow everyone to stay professionally relevant.
  4. Users can focus on specific automation uses that allow for specific skill enhancements.
  5. Everyone benefits from AI in the same way, eliminating the competitive advantage of large corporations.

As programmers, we’re inviting other programmers and those with expertise to join our development community. We want Aatos to be the next evolution of what automation could be. That way, everyone benefits from the value-added services it provides.

In doing so, everyone gets the opportunity to prosper.

 

How We Value Individuality at Nexeraa

One of the most exciting elements of Aatos is the fact that it provides individual experiences, even while it treats each user in the same way. It doesn’t matter who you are, where you live, or what you do for a living.

Everyone benefits from Aatos.

Diversity shouldn’t be feared. It should be celebrated. That’s what Aatos offers. It empowers each user because it can be understood by virtually everyone. If you know how to use a mouse, then you know how to use Aatos.

We’re not the first to bring this idea to the market. We are leading the way in providing open-source robotic process automation resources to the general public.

That is how endless possibilities are created.

We could succumb to greed. We could allow governments and corporations to dictate our culture.

Or we could embrace an alternative. By offering complete access to one and all, everyone gains the opportunity to carve out their own future in a way that suits them best.

That is why Aatos is more than a platform – it is also a community.

Together, we are a community that is working together to ensure we will all have a relevant, welcoming position in a world with AI and automation. Our diversity will help us to leverage new ideas and combine talents to give ourselves an advantage that we individually use to find success.

Machines are only tools. They are fun. They are useful. We are the people who use them.

 

Now the Decision is Up to You

You could allow yourself to be crushed by evolving technological trends. You can decide to let your employment opportunities fade away as AI influences increase.
Or you can choose to support a platform that will take new opportunities to the next level.

Our goal is raise $10,000 to begin the development process for this platform. Here’s how you can help.

 

#1. Make a donation. Every amount counts. You can help turn Aatos by Nexeraa into a precious resource that we can all access to maximize our productivity.

#2. Share this campaign. Join with us on your preferred social media platform and let others know about this initiative.

#3. Stay involved. Discuss the issues of AI, robotics, and automation. Develop a plan that will help you and your family counter future issues that could impact your way of life if automation takes over your employment opportunity.

#4. Offer suggestions. We invite all suggestions and technical contributions from our community.

We are honored by your interest in Aatos by Nexeraa. Join our community and let’s make history together.

Campaign FAQs

Can I help with coding in lieu of a donation?

Yes. Aatos by Nexeraa is an open-source platform. Stay tuned while we prepare our community for our official launch. We’re excited to welcome you aboard in the near future.

How can I help if I cannot make a donation?

Sharing our campaign is one of the best ways you can help. Leveraging your networks and helping us spread the word about this important issue will help Aatos grow. Whatever you can do to help will always be greatly appreciated by the Nexeraa team and our growing community.

Do you develop other software platforms?

We are currently looking at several specific options. Contact our team if you are interested in targeted concepts.

What does Aatos do specifically?

Aatos offers numerous applications that users can apply personally. The goal of this platform is to automate processes through a simple, easy-to-use interface, allowing everyone to become more productive.

story:
Tổng quan thực trạng "giỏi" nhưng "chưa phù hợp"

Nhìn vào thực trạng hiện nay, rất nhiều ứng viên dù mang đủ tố chất hay đã đạt được thành tích xuất sắc xứng đáng nhận được học bổng nhưng vẫn không được lựa chọn, bởi lẽ họ thiếu “một vài yếu tố” và bị đánh giá là “chưa phù hợp” đối với các chương trình học bổng lớn. Lẽ tất nhiên, việc chưa phù hợp với các chương trình học bổng mang tính cạnh tranh cao đồng nghĩa với việc ứng viên đó sẽ mất đi cơ hội được nhận học bổng.

 

Ví dụ điển hình cho những sự "chưa phù hợp" lại vô tình gây bất công cho những người giỏi thường xuất hiện trong các chương trình học bổng lớn và có tính cạnh tranh cao như Chevening và Fulbright.

 

Giả sử một sinh viên A vừa mới tốt nghiệp loại xuất sắc quyết định ứng tuyển chương trình học bổng Chevening. Sinh viên này cũng đã có kinh nghiệm làm việc bán thời gian ở vị trí quản lý những dự án có tính chất ảnh hưởng lớn và tích cực tới cộng đồng. Ta có thể nhận xét ứng viên A có đủ những phẩm chất lãnh đạo và năng lực học thuật mà học bổng Chevening yêu cầu, nhưng tiếc thay vì mới tốt nghiệp, ứng viên này lại không có "hai năm kinh nghiệm làm việc sau khi tốt nghiệp". Như vậy, nếu hội đồng học bổng Chevening xét tuyển một cách cứng nhắc, ứng viên này sẽ bị loại dù cho những ảnh hưởng tích cực và tiềm năng của ứng viên này có tốt đi chăng nữa.

 

Hoặc lấy ví dụ một trường hợp khác, bạn B là một sinh viên xuất sắc có khả năng đại diện Việt Nam tham dự một chương trình giao lưu văn hoá quốc tế ở nước ngoài. Thế nhưng, chương trình mà sinh viên B này tham dự không có quỹ đài thọ chi phí đi lại, sinh hoạt cho đại biểu. Bạn B  muốn tìm một quỹ hỗ trợ để có thể đại diện Việt Nam tham gia chương trình giao lưu quốc tế nhưng hiện nay các quỹ học bổng ở Việt Nam đều chỉ nhắm tới cung cấp các học bổng dài hạn chứ không tài trợ cho các chương trình giao lưu ngắn hạn như đã đề cập.

 

Ngoài ra cũng phải kể đến sự bất công về phân bổ tài trợ học bổng cho các ngành học. Bạn sinh viên C dù được nhận vào học tại một trường đại học danh tiếng, thế nhưng ngành học đã chọn của bạn C lại là một ngành được cộp mác “con nhà giàu" (ví dụ như Mỹ thuật, Âm nhạc, Kinh doanh, v.v.) với mức học phí cao và chi phí phát sinh nhiều trong quá trình học nên bị rất nhiều quỹ học bổng làm ngơ. Tình trạng này trái ngược với những ngành học được đầu tư và cho nhiều học bổng như Khoa học cơ bản, Giáo dục, Môi trường và Phát triển để khuyến khích người học.

 

Các ví dụ nêu trên đại diện cho rất nhiều trường hợp những cá nhân tài năng nhưng chỉ vì thiếu một vài tiêu chí nhất định (hay nói đúng hơn là vì các quỹ học bổng khác vẫn chưa quan tâm họ đúng mức) mà đành ngậm ngùi từ bỏ ước mơ.

 

Chương trình học bổng Limitless, đúng như tên gọi tiếng Việt là “Không Giới Hạn", đặt mục tiêu sẽ chắp cánh cho giấc mơ của những bạn trẻ tài năng đã bị các chương trình khác “bỏ sót". Học bổng Limitless không đặt giới hạn bằng các bộ tiêu chí chung như: tuổi tác, ngành học, nghề nghiệp, hay kinh nghiệm mà sẽ xem xét rất kỹ liệu ứng viên có xứng đáng nhận được nguồn tài trợ hay không theo từng trường hợp riêng biệt (on a case-by-case basis). Chúng tôi hy vọng những bạn trẻ tài năng sẽ tìm đến chúng tôi khi cần hỗ trợ.

 

Các gói hỗ trợ của học bổng Limitless

Chương trình học bổng Limitless được phân thành ba học bổng phụ (với các nguồn funding riêng biệt) nhằm phục vụ cho ba nhóm đối tượng khác nhau.

 
  • Học bổng Limitless dành cho sinh viên trao đổi văn hoá

Học bổng này sẽ cung cấp gói hỗ trợ tài chính cho các bạn sinh viên Việt Nam tham gia các chương trình giao lưu văn hoá ngắn hạn như: các Diễn đàn, Hội nghị dành cho sinh viên, các chương trình biểu diễn văn hoá nghệ thuật của sinh viên tại nước ngoài…

Số lượng học bổng dự kiến năm 2018: 20 suất

 
  • Học bổng Limitless dành cho sinh viên thực tập ngắn hạn

Học bổng này sẽ cung cấp gói hỗ trợ tài chính cho các bạn sinh viên Việt Nam tham gia các chương trình thực tập, tình nguyện ở nước ngoài hoặc các chương trình trao đổi sinh viên ngắn hạn (có tổng thời gian dưới 4 tháng).

Số lượng học bổng dự kiến năm 2018: 5 suất

 
  • Học bổng Limitless dành cho sinh viên xuất sắc

Học bổng này hướng tới đối tượng là các sinh viên xuất sắc đã được nhận vào một trường đại học thuộc top 20 trong bảng xếp hạng các trường đại học trên thế giới nhưng vẫn còn thiếu chi phí để theo học. Học bổng này sẽ cung cấp gói hỗ trợ tài chính toàn phần hoặc bán phần cho một năm học.

Số lượng học bổng dự kiến năm 2018: 1-2 suất

 

Chúng tôi cần bạn hỗ trợ điều gì?

Hiện tại, nhóm chúng tôi đang tiến hành gây quỹ đợt một cho 3 gói học bổng riêng biệt của Chương trình Học bổng Limitless. Học bổng đang trong giai đoạn được xây dựng và còn nhiều hạng mục như website, hội đồng tuyển chọn cho học bổng và thông tin các đối tác học bổng sẽ sớm được hoàn thiện và cập nhật trong thời gian tới.

Đối với gói học bổng Limitless dành cho sinh viên trao đổi văn hoá, chúng tôi đang tiến hành thử nghiệm gây quỹ theo hình thức crowdfunding trong thời gian từ 20/11 đến 30/11/2017, mục tiêu là đạt được ít nhất 10,000 USD để có thể hỗ trợ 20 suất học bổng trao đổi văn hoá ngắn hạn cho các bạn sinh viên.  

Nhóm chúng tôi mong muốn nhận được sự ủng hộ của các bạn trong chiến dịch gây quỹ cộng đồng trên trang indiegogo này. Với mỗi phần tài chính đóng góp của các bạn, nhóm chúng tôi sẽ gửi tặng lại các phần quà và quyền lợi tương xứng.

Mọi thông tin thêm liên quan đến vấn đề tài trợ, xin vui lòng liên hệ chúng tôi qua email sponsors@hocbonglimitless.org để được biết thêm chi tiết.

Bạn được gì khi đóng góp cho quỹ học bổng của chúng tôi?

  

Gói tài trợ 1: 10 USD

  • Thư cảm ơn từ Ban sáng lập học bổng Limitless
  • Sách cẩm nang chi tiết các bước tìm học bổng: từ cách tạo hồ sơ đến trả lời phỏng vấn
  • Truy cập vào mạng lưới database hơn 500 học bổng mà sinh viên Việt Nam có thể apply

Gói tài trợ 2: 20 USD

  • Toàn bộ các phần thưởng trong gói tài trợ 1
  • Tổng hợp bộ tài liệu luyện thi IELTS và GRE/GMAT/SAT
  • Được sửa miễn phí 1 CV và 1 bài luận học bổng với chuyên gia là thành viên trong hội đồng học bổng Limitless

Gói tài trợ 3: 30 USD

  • Toàn bộ các phần thưởng ở gói tài trợ 2
  • Được tham dự mock interview 1-on-1 online với chuyên gia là thành viên trong hội đồng học bổng Limitless

Gói tài trợ 4: 50 USD

  • Toàn bộ các phần thưởng trong gói tài trợ 3
  • Được tham dự khoá intensive training "Starter pack" về 8 kỹ năng cần thiết cho công việc và học tập, 8 kỹ năng đó là:  
  1. Critical thinking
  2. Communication & Basic Diplomacy
  3. Job application
  4. Networking
  5. Project Management
  6. Public Speaking
  7. Secretarial skills
  8. Research skills

Khoá intensive training "Starter pack" sẽ được hướng dẫn bởi Mr. Vũ Đỗ Khanh (Thạc sĩ Chính sách Công ĐH Oxford, Người Việt Nam đầu tiên làm việc cho Bộ Số hoá, Văn hoá, Truyền thông và Thể thao Anh Quốc). Khoá học gần nhất sẽ được tổ chức trong hai ngày 2 và 3 tháng 12. Thông tin về thời gian tổ chức các khoá học tiếp theo sẽ được gửi tới người tài trợ.

Gói tài trợ 5: 50 USD

  • Toàn bộ các phần thưởng ở gói tài trợ  3
  • Được tham dự khoá intensive training về Kỹ năng giao lưu quốc tế (Tổ chức kết hợp với CLB Giao lưu Quốc tế ĐH KHXH&NV TP.HCM)

Khoá intensive training "International Exchange" sẽ được hướng dẫn bởi Mr. Vũ Đỗ Khanh (Thạc sĩ Chính sách Công ĐH Oxford, Người Việt Nam đầu tiên làm việc cho Bộ Số hoá, Văn hoá, Truyền thông và Thể thao Anh Quốc). Khoá học gần nhất sẽ được tổ chức trong hai ngày 16 và 17 tháng 12. Thông tin về thời gian tổ chức các khoá học tiếp theo sẽ được gửi tới người tài trợ.

Gói tài trợ 6: 500 USD

  • Toàn bộ phần thưởng trong gói tài trợ 4 và 5
  • Được tư vấn chi tiết (mentorship 1-on-1) về tất cả vấn đề liên quan đến du học (đặc biệt là cách đạt được học bổng các trường top 20 trên thế giới) với chuyên gia là thành viên trong hội đồng học bổng Limitless

Về chúng tôi 

Chương trình Học bổng Limitless là ý tưởng được xây dựng sau quá trình quan sát thực trạng nhiều bạn ứng viên dù rất giỏi nhưng chỉ vì không đáp ứng được một vài tiêu chí nhỏ mà mất đi cơ hội được trao những suất học bổng tốt. 

Nhóm thành viên sáng lập của học bổng bao gồm:

Vũ Đỗ Khanh - Thạc sĩ Chính sách Công ĐH Oxford, Vương Quốc Anh

Nhận học bổng toàn phần từ ĐH Oxford năm 2016, Vũ Đỗ Khanh là sinh viên Việt Nam đầu tiên theo học tại Trường Quản lý Nhà nước Blavatnik, Đại Học Oxford. Trong thời gian học tập tại Oxford, Khanh là thành viên Ban Chủ tịch Hội sinh viên Blavatnik School of Government và là gương mặt đại diện trường tham dự nhiều chương trình giao lưu và các cuộc thi dành cho sinh viên. Khanh là thành viên sáng lập và Trưởng Ban Điều phối Chương trình học bổng Limitless.

Email liên hệ: khanh.vudo@hocbonglimitless.org 

Thông tin thêm: 

http://kenh14.vn/bang-thanh-tich-sieu-khung-cua...

http://duhoc.dantri.com.vn/du-hoc/chang-trai-th...

Mạc Trang Anh - Nghiên cứu sinh Tiến sĩ Luật, ĐH Lille 2, Cộng Hòa Pháp

Sau khi nhận học bổng thạc sĩ luật của ĐH Lille 2 và đạt được nhiều thành tích xuất sắc trong học tập và nghiên cứu, Trang Anh tiếp tục được nhận thẳng vào chương trình Nghiên cứu sinh Tiến sĩ Luật tại trường. Với kinh nghiệm làm việc cho các hãng luật tại Việt Nam, Trang Anh hiện là Cố vấn Pháp lý và Phó Ban điều phối của Chương trình Học bổng Limitless.

Email liên hệ: tranganh.mac@hocbonglimitless.org
story_txt:
Tổng quan thực trạng "giỏi" nhưng "chưa phù hợp"
Nhìn vào thực trạng hiện nay, rất nhiều ứng viên dù mang đủ tố chất hay đã đạt được thành tích xuất sắc xứng đáng nhận được học bổng nhưng vẫn không được lựa chọn, bởi lẽ họ thiếu “một vài yếu tố” và bị đánh giá là “chưa phù hợp” đối với các chương trình học bổng lớn. Lẽ tất nhiên, việc chưa phù hợp với các chương trình học bổng mang tính cạnh tranh cao đồng nghĩa với việc ứng viên đó sẽ mất đi cơ hội được nhận học bổng. Ví dụ điển hình cho những sự "chưa phù hợp" lại vô tình gây bất công cho những người giỏi thường xuất hiện trong các chương trình học bổng lớn và có tính cạnh tranh cao như Chevening và Fulbright. Giả sử một sinh viên A vừa mới tốt nghiệp loại xuất sắc quyết định ứng tuyển chương trình học bổng Chevening. Sinh viên này cũng đã có kinh nghiệm làm việc bán thời gian ở vị trí quản lý những dự án có tính chất ảnh hưởng lớn và tích cực tới cộng đồng. Ta có thể nhận xét ứng viên A có đủ những phẩm chất lãnh đạo và năng lực học thuật mà học bổng Chevening yêu cầu, nhưng tiếc thay vì mới tốt nghiệp, ứng viên này lại không có "hai năm kinh nghiệm làm việc sau khi tốt nghiệp". Như vậy, nếu hội đồng học bổng Chevening xét tuyển một cách cứng nhắc, ứng viên này sẽ bị loại dù cho những ảnh hưởng tích cực và tiềm năng của ứng viên này có tốt đi chăng nữa. Hoặc lấy ví dụ một trường hợp khác, bạn B là một sinh viên xuất sắc có khả năng đại diện Việt Nam tham dự một chương trình giao lưu văn hoá quốc tế ở nước ngoài. Chúng tôi cần bạn hỗ trợ điều gì?
Hiện tại, nhóm chúng tôi đang tiến hành gây quỹ đợt một cho 3 gói học bổng riêng biệt của Chương trình Học bổng Limitless. Học bổng đang trong giai đoạn được xây dựng và còn nhiều hạng mục như website, hội đồng tuyển chọn cho học bổng và thông tin các đối tác học bổng sẽ sớm được hoàn thiện và cập nhật trong thời gian tới.
Đối với gói học bổng Limitless dành cho sinh viên trao đổi văn hoá, chúng tôi đang tiến hành thử nghiệm gây quỹ theo hình thức crowdfunding trong thời gian từ 20/11 đến 30/11/2017, mục tiêu là đạt được ít nhất 10,000 USD để có thể hỗ trợ 20 suất học bổng trao đổi văn hoá ngắn hạn cho các bạn sinh viên.  
Nhóm chúng tôi mong muốn nhận được sự ủng hộ của các bạn trong chiến dịch gây quỹ cộng đồng trên trang indiegogo này. Với mỗi phần tài chính đóng góp của các bạn, nhóm chúng tôi sẽ gửi tặng lại các phần quà và quyền lợi tương xứng.
Mọi thông tin thêm liên quan đến vấn đề tài trợ, xin vui lòng liên hệ chúng tôi qua email sponsors@hocbonglimitless.org để được biết thêm chi tiết.

Bạn được gì khi đóng góp cho quỹ học bổng của chúng tôi?
  
Gói tài trợ 1: 10 USD

Thư cảm ơn từ Ban sáng lập học bổng Limitless
Sách cẩm nang chi tiết các bước tìm học bổng: từ cách tạo hồ sơ đến trả lời phỏng vấn
Truy cập vào mạng lưới database hơn 500 học bổng mà sinh viên Việt Nam có thể apply

Gói tài trợ 2: 20 USD

Toàn bộ các phần thưởng trong gói tài trợ 1
Tổng hợp bộ tài liệu luyện thi IELTS và GRE/GMAT/SAT
Được sửa miễn phí 1 CV và 1 bài luận học bổng với chuyên gia là thành viên trong hội đồng học bổng Limitless

Gói tài trợ 3: 30 USD

Toàn bộ các phần thưởng ở gói tài trợ 2
Được tham dự mock interview 1-on-1 online với chuyên gia là thành viên trong hội đồng học bổng Limitless

Gói tài trợ 4: 50 USD

Toàn bộ các phần thưởng trong gói tài trợ 3
Được tham dự khoá intensive training "Starter pack" về 8 kỹ năng cần thiết cho công việc và học tập, 8 kỹ năng đó là:  


Critical thinking
Communication & Basic Diplomacy
Job application
Networking
Project Management
Public Speaking
Secretarial skills
Research skills

Khoá intensive training "Starter pack" sẽ được hướng dẫn bởi Mr. Vũ Đỗ Khanh (Thạc sĩ Chính sách Công ĐH Oxford, Người Việt Nam đầu tiên làm việc cho Bộ Số hoá, Văn hoá, Truyền thông và Thể thao Anh Quốc). Khoá học gần nhất sẽ được tổ chức trong hai ngày 2 và 3 tháng 12. Thông tin về thời gian tổ chức các khoá học tiếp theo sẽ được gửi tới người tài trợ.
Gói tài trợ 5: 50 USD

Toàn bộ các phần thưởng ở gói tài trợ  3
Được tham dự khoá intensive training về Kỹ năng giao lưu quốc tế (Tổ chức kết hợp với CLB Giao lưu Quốc tế ĐH KHXH&NV TP.HCM)

Khoá intensive training "International Exchange" sẽ được hướng dẫn bởi Mr. Vũ Đỗ Khanh (Thạc sĩ Chính sách Công ĐH Oxford, Người Việt Nam đầu tiên làm việc cho Bộ Số hoá, Văn hoá, Truyền thông và Thể thao Anh Quốc). Khoá học gần nhất sẽ được tổ chức trong hai ngày 16 và 17 tháng 12. Thông tin về thời gian tổ chức các khoá học tiếp theo sẽ được gửi tới người tài trợ.
Gói tài trợ 6: 500 USD

Toàn bộ phần thưởng trong gói tài trợ 4 và 5
Được tư vấn chi tiết (mentorship 1-on-1) về tất cả vấn đề liên quan đến du học (đặc biệt là cách đạt được học bổng các trường top 20 trên thế giới) với chuyên gia là thành viên trong hội đồng học bổng Limitless


Về chúng tôi 
Chương trình Học bổng Limitless là ý tưởng được xây dựng sau quá trình quan sát thực trạng nhiều bạn ứng viên dù rất giỏi nhưng chỉ vì không đáp ứng được một vài tiêu chí nhỏ mà mất đi cơ hội được trao những suất học bổng tốt. 
Nhóm thành viên sáng lập của học bổng bao gồm:
Vũ Đỗ Khanh - Thạc sĩ Chính sách Công ĐH Oxford, Vương Quốc Anh
Nhận học bổng toàn phần từ ĐH Oxford năm 2016, Vũ Đỗ Khanh là sinh viên Việt Nam đầu tiên theo học tại Trường Quản lý Nhà nước Blavatnik, Đại Học Oxford. Trong thời gian học tập tại Oxford, Khanh là thành viên Ban Chủ tịch Hội sinh viên Blavatnik School of Government và là gương mặt đại diện trường tham dự nhiều chương trình giao lưu và các cuộc thi dành cho sinh viên. Khanh là thành viên sáng lập và Trưởng Ban Điều phối Chương trình học bổng Limitless.
Email liên hệ: khanh.vudo@hocbonglimitless.org 
Thông tin thêm: 
http://kenh14.vn/bang-thanh-tich-sieu-khung-cua...
http://duhoc.dantri.com.vn/du-hoc/chang-trai-th...
Mạc Trang Anh - Nghiên cứu sinh Tiến sĩ Luật, ĐH Lille 2, Cộng Hòa Pháp
Sau khi nhận học bổng thạc sĩ luật của ĐH Lille 2 và đạt được nhiều thành tích xuất sắc trong học tập và nghiên cứu, Trang Anh tiếp tục được nhận thẳng vào chương trình Nghiên cứu sinh Tiến sĩ Luật tại trường. Với kinh nghiệm làm việc cho các hãng luật tại Việt Nam, Trang Anh hiện là Cố vấn Pháp lý và Phó Ban điều phối của Chương trình Học bổng Limitless.
Email liên hệ: tranganh.mac@hocbonglimitless.org

story:
WHO WE ARE

Liezer-Legacy Productions is dedicated to creating and producing quality theatrical works of comedy and comedic works that explore and celebrate our sense of humanity and history as Ghanaians. Since 2014, we have produced high quality contemporary works of art that has inspired and shaped many lives. Driven by the commitment to inspire, entertain and shape lives, our works paint a picture of life as it should be and thus engage audiences in an exchange of ideas that makes them think harder, laugh louder and become more objective. Aside producing stage plays, we organize an annual 4-week Acting Training School and also run weekly comedy shows live on two radio stations in Kumasi; The PM Show on Luv 99.5 FM and Agorommre Nhyira 104.3 FM.

Ahead of Ghana’s 2016 general elections, we are adding on 2 new projects; Street Theatre and Students Drama Festival, in our quest to train and employ more youthful talents as well as preach and promote peace, tolerance, unity and democracy. Though we are not in the financial position to pay the required minimum wages for services, we have in our own small way offered training and employment in the arts to many youths over the years. We are committed to ensuring Ghana comes out of the 2016 polls even stronger. We are also eager to continue in our efforts to reduce the unemployment rate in the country.

WHY WE ARE HERE

We believe society can flourish only when its members learn to accept and respect one another as well as embrace our responsibility to make the world a better place. Ghana’s 2016 general elections may mar the country’s reputation as one of the most relatively peaceful countries in Africa. The 2008 and 2012 general elections proved turbulent but if the violence, assassinations, abuse, intimidation, seizure of large quantity of arms and ammunitions in some parts of the country as well as the use of vigilante groups by both the ruling NDC and the opposition NPP are anything to go by then one can only assume and quite justifiably too that this year’s polls is likely to prove particularly volatile.

As Christians and citizens desirous of the best for our country, we are conscious of this looming danger and are committed to using our talents and platforms to educate, admonish and promote peace ahead of the polls. Our Street Theatre will complement the efforts of our stage plays and radio shows in creatively addressing issues. The Street Theatre will see us mount stages in our streets, lorry parks and market squares across the country to put up educative and entertaining drama pieces as well as have resource persons address the people gathered on the need for peace, tolerance and democracy during and after the elections.

Since politicians usually induce the youth to start riots, we intend to not only train many youths but also employ and pay more youthful talents thus giving them purpose and a more profitable use for their talents. We are thus here to humbly request your assistance to help us transform our creative ideas into impactful approaches and job creating opportunities. Your investment will not only help in shaping the lives of many talented arts-enthusiastic youth but will also contribute immensely to Ghana’s stability and economic rebuilding.


WHAT WE NEED

As a young Theatre company operating in an environment where theatre is not so  lucrative, our dream to make a difference in the lives of many youths as well as help to promote peace during the 2016 Elections seems almost an impossible one. Our current financial standing can only take us through 2 successful Street Theatre projects. Going for a loan like we usually do will be a big set back since we intend to make the Street Theatre a free-for-all project so as to be able to reach the masses with our campaign for peace.

We need funds to take care of production costs such as transportation, welfare, accommodation, renting fee for the stage, fees for sound system, remuneration, facilitation for resource persons, among others. We believe with support from donors like you, we will not only help in shaping the lives of many talented arts-enthusiastic youth but will also contribute immensely to Ghana’s stability and economic rebuilding.

This campaign is very important to us because it will help us stay true to our vision of traveling across the country to preach and promote peace, tolerance, democracy and unity ahead of Ghana's 2016 polls. It will also help us contribute immensely to strengthening of the arts industry by undertaking projects that will seek to train and employ more youth.

OUR FUTURE

The future of our company is full of risks and possibilities. We will continue to build relationships, provide job opportunities and offer cultural education to create and sustain a vibrant Theatre hub in Kumasi. We hope that you will support our vision by donating to this campaign.

story:
Hi! I'm Angela. I'm 36 years old, the single mother of an incredibly smart and curious 8 year old, and I'm a nursing student at Parkland College. I'm an active member of the Phi Theta Kappa international honor society as well as the Student Nurses' Association at Parkland, and I work very hard to keep my grades up. As such, I've been invited to participate in the International Scholar Laureate Program's student delegation to the Republic of South Africa in May (visit scholarlaureate.org for more information about my trip) where I will be learning about pandemic nursing for HIV/AIDS, TB, etc. This is a once in a lifetime opportunity for me and I'm very excited to be offered this chance to further my education and learn about nursing for pandemics first hand in a country that suffers so intensely from them.  
                                        Here are some facts and figures:
6.3 million South Africans & 1.2 million Americans are living with HIV
19.1% of South African adults and 0.4% of American adults are infected with HIV
340,000  South Africans & 47,352 Americans were newly diagnosed with HIV
200,000 South Africans & 13,700 Americans died of AIDS-related causes in 2013
only 42% of South Africans & 37% of Americans infected with HIV are receiving antiretroviral treatment
     A staggering 58% of HIV+ South Africans and 63% of HIV+ Americans are NOT receiving adequate treatment! Education is key. Will you help me do something about this?
     My goal is large. I have applied for general as well as honor society scholarships, but I will not know whether I've been awarded one (or how much) until the middle of March- after the deadline to commit. The cost of the trip is roughly $5000, plus the cost of travel insurance, transcript fees for college credit, passport renewal fees, and a host of immunizations that will not be covered by my insurance, etc. I need to raise as much as I can toward the total cost. Scholarship funds are limited and I'm competing against other top-notch scholars from across the world, so there are no guarantees that I will receive one.
UPDATE: I just got word that I've been given a $500 scholarship from ISLP. I've still got quite a ways to go, but this is awesome news!
     This opportunity means a lot to me. I've worked extremely hard to get to where I am, and my will to become a nurse is intense. I firmly believe that this is what I am meant to be doing, and this trip will give me a leg up on current trends in nursing which can only help me in my schooling and on my career path.
     I thank you all for reading this, and for those who are willing and able to donate, I thank you from the bottom of my heart for helping make my dream a reality!

story:
Brief Review

The first Center for Early Innovation in Colombia's goal is to promote social development through advances in science and technology, so we need to create an environment that enables creative thinking and be able to sustain and develop entrepreneurs. The initiative was born in Don Diego, Sierra Nevada, Colombia.

Don Diego is a small community of farmers and indigenous people who had to bear the full force of violence and war; still they maintain their hope and want to move on.  It is essential that they rebuild their school, this is a symbol of unity, hope and strength. Currently the school is completely abandoned. When this school is revived it will benefit more than 100 families living in this area by becoming the community center.

Location 


What we need and what you get

The entire proceeds will go to support the reconstruction and upgrade of the infrastructure where the Early Innovation Center Altos de Don Diego work. $2,000 US is needed to paint the facade and interior of the place, to improve the health system, build a straw roof playground, revive the garden where children learn the importance of loving the land and  restock tools for teaching such as interactive board, strips, wooden geometric shapes, saltasoga, software pack, math and, reading books, crayons/colored pencils and container boxes.

Would you like to come to Colombian caribbean and meet our initiative? We would love to have many friends, the grand award of this campaign is an invitation to the opening of the Center for Early Innovation in Colombia (all expenses paid).

After completing the repairs, you can follow our progress and growth on the web site we want to make for the school.



Budget


Impact

The only real element that has to be transformed in society is the education of its citizens. It is true that we live in a painfully unequal world where the birthplace often determines the fate of people. However, it is always possible to make use of the power of solidarity to turn the tide of those destinations marked by exclusion, war and indifference.

If we can revive this school for a healthy space to provide quality education to children and youth, we can bring advances in science, art, technique and technology to a section of the rural sector.

With the help of committed people symbols of hope and unity can spread across the world. Please contribute to train competent citizens able to manage worthy meeting spaces that encourage meaningful learning; in this way we will be sure to deliver to the world generations of respectful subjects of their environment and their peers, away from crime, prostitution and war.

I've worked in impoverished areas and know closely the pain of poverty. More so, I've seen the ability of regeneration and transformation that we human beings are capable of.

The earth responds to care, human and social fabric respond to partnerships.

This Innovation Center will provide more than 100 families the opportunity to have access to technological tools, advances in science and also a fun and healthy learning environment.


Risks and Challenges

Although we do not condone it, the reality is that some armed groups still operating in the area; This situation is a challenge to any social development initiative. However, we are confident in the strength of the arguments in favor of youth away from violence, that when put in a neutral space that promotes education, art and culture there will be change.

Accompaniment and support of the community and civic associations are also our great shield. They are the people in the population who will ensure the safety and success of this initiative. For the past two years the political and party neutrality has supported what we do.


Other ways you can help

We are not alone in this, we know it will be successful with your help.

Dare to share our campaign and become our Partner. 

Tell a friend about this idea and plan through social networks.

Thank you,

Center for Early Innovation in Colombia's Team


Jennifer Del Toro
Soy psicóloga y especialista en psicología social; amante de las expresiones estéticas, de las letras y la música. Un buen día el velo que cubría mi existencia se cayó y empecé a cuestionar mi noción de "libertad" de "bienestar" de "éxito"... Y entendí que "Nadie es una isla, completo en sí mismo". Entendí también que mi existencia está condicionada por lo que me rodea y que puedo decidir qué hacer con esos condicionantes. Decidí entonces transformarlos. Bienvenidos todas y todos a este espacio que es de ustedes. 

Javier Lozano

Soy Ingeniero Comercial, estudié en Santiago de Chile. Hace más de 10 años que trabajo acelerando el emprendimiento de empresas comerciales y sociales, a través del uso de herramientas tecnológicas, para las comunicaciones y la colaboración en línea.

Estoy convencido de que la vía del emprendimiento eco-social, es el camino que nos queda para desarrollar una sociedad sostenible, y ser capaces de adaptarnos y mitigar los grandes cambios que estamos viviendo.

However, we are confident in the strength of the arguments in favor of youth away from violence, that when put in a neutral space that promotes education, art and culture there will be change.
Accompaniment and support of the community and civic associations are also our great shield. They are the people in the population who will ensure the safety and success of this initiative. For the past two years the political and party neutrality has supported what we do.


Other ways you can help

We are not alone in this, we know it will be successful with your help. Dare to share our campaign and become our Partner. Tell a friend about this idea and plan through social networks.Thank you,Center for Early Innovation in Colombia's Team





Jennifer Del ToroSoy psicóloga y especialista en psicología social; amante de las expresiones estéticas, de las letras y la música. Un buen día el velo que cubría mi existencia se cayó y empecé a cuestionar mi noción de "libertad" de "bienestar" de "éxito"... Y entendí que "Nadie es una isla, completo en sí mismo". Entendí también que mi existencia está condicionada por lo que me rodea y que puedo decidir qué hacer con esos condicionantes. Decidí entonces transformarlos. Bienvenidos todas y todos a este espacio que es de ustedes. 







Javier Lozano
Soy Ingeniero Comercial, estudié en Santiago de Chile. Hace más de 10 años que trabajo acelerando el emprendimiento de empresas comerciales y sociales, a través del uso de herramientas tecnológicas, para las comunicaciones y la colaboración en línea.
Estoy convencido de que la vía del emprendimiento eco-social, es el camino que nos queda para desarrollar una sociedad sostenible, y ser capaces de adaptarnos y mitigar los grandes cambios que estamos viviendo.

story:
Hello Wonderful People ! 

Thank you so much for taking the time to read about my dream! 

I didn't want to create a video for my campaign as most people do and have an emotionally appealing music in the background to draw an illusion and get to people feelings .. I want it to be real, and  whoever going to support me to read my story and if they will have faith and believe in me, I'd be very proud of their support and will never let them down. I don't give promises I can't keep, because I don't have to at the first place. And you can always watch me either live on Periscope or Watch my videos on Katch.me links are below.

My name is Saed, a young man with big dreams. I am 23 years old. 1st scoper at Periscope  from Gaza, I scope about love, unity, positiveness, music, food and more. I currently live in the far east of Gaza city ( Shuja'iyya neighborhood, you may need to Google that ) in Palestine. Our house were partly destroyed during the last conflict in June 2014, and I have worked hard and spent all my money on rebuilding it. I have been through many hard times and never asked people to help me out even back in the days when I survived on $2 only for almost a week and lived in schools while I had no home to stay, Because I believe what doesn't kill you, makes you stronger ... 

I have a dream that I've been chasing for over 5 years now hopefully its time to come true, My dream to study abroad started back in 2010, when I finished my high school. I applied for several international scholarships, with no luck but yet this didn't put me down. I picked myself up and 5 years later, proudly achieved my Bachelors degree in Information Technology - Multimedia and Web Development -

Living in Gaza can be tough but every day is a new adventure. As an I.T. student I had to manage my time of work and study with only 6-8 hours of electricity everyday. This was made harder as most of my books were electronic copies, plus my homework was a software deliverable. So trying to learn and live in such circumstances teaches you a lot, and makes you appreciate simple things even more!  

The moment I received my degree I started applying for scholarships again to further my education and meanwhile I was also taking a Deutsche ( German ) course, as my Plan A was to study in UK or USA and my  plan B was to go to Germany. Unfortunately once again, my attempts to gain a scholarship were unsuccessful,  but that didn't put me down and I kept on going. I know I can wait for next years and apply once again, But do I have to spend too many years on waiting? One of my friends was very lucky to gain a scholarship but this was after SEVEN years of trying! So I thought I should find another way, and here comes my campaign. 

My Bachelor Degree:


My German language Certificate:

A photo from my graduation party in June 2015 - I was also one of the best 10 students among my colleagues I got 91% in one of the semesters, and my overall GPA was 80.58%.

Scholarships I applied for but no luck:
Said Foundation Scholarship:


The Chevening Scholarship:

and many more ..

What I want to study and Why?

I want to study Entrepreneurship and innovation; to combine it with my I.T. knowledge, skills and experience and create things that will help unemployed people, refugees and hopefully the underprivileged to have a better life! 

Unfortunately at this moment, nowhere in Gaza is offering any Entrepreneurship/innovation courses nor are there enough resources in Gaza to innovate. That means when I return home I will be the 1st Gazan ever to hold such a degree!

Why you should support me and How can I help unemployed and refugees? 

Whilst studying my bachelors degree, I worked with an international organization  Mercy Corps  in Gaza as a Freelancers' mentor and my main role was to help, mentor and train other students to become successful freelancers and build up their freelancing career. I mentored 15 graduates while I was studying myself and helped them make it! So I hope after pursuing my master from Germany I will be able to help more and more people, not only in Gaza but worldwide!

Recommendation I received from my previous employer at Mercy Corps - Gaza office. ( It was used for a scholarship I applied for ) 

In Oct 2015, I was selected by World Health Organization HQ in Geneva to do an internship with the Surge and Crisis Support Unit, and I gained a greater experience and skills. I want to volunteer with my free time, to work with humanitarian organizations in Germany as I'm able to speak Arabic, English and German. I love volunteering and I hope with the additional knowledge I learn in a masters degree I can help even more.

Recommendation I received on Linkedin from my supervisor at WHO HQ.


One more thing, I love volunteering! I have spent over 5 years of my life doing voluntary work, because it bought me what money will never do! Feel free to read more about my voluntary work at Linkedin Profile 

This photo was taken in 1st of Oct 2013, I was back then a voluntary English Language Trainer at ElWedad Society for Community Rehabilitation, I volunteered there for over 5 months, doing 2 meetings every week, 2-3 hours per meeting.

I helped a group of university students, English language teachers, translators and other interested people to practice their English language to empower and improve their speaking and listening skills as well as enhancing their abilities to make presentations in English. 

I wasn't only helping them with their English, but was also how to be good for themselves, families, and communities. 

Watch these videos of me:

1. This video I made to uplift people and to remind people that everyone you meet is facing a battle we know nothing about. >> https://ktch.tv/6HQj 

2. This video I made 1 day before Valentine Day, It was my message for the people to celebrate it with their mothers. >> https://ktch.tv/7cgF

3. I also teach Arabic on Periscope for Free. Find them at  >> https://katch.me/Saed_Habib


How much I need and Why?

Education in Germany is free, BUT! As a foreigner, you need to spend at least 1 year in Germany to study the language more in depth in order to study at any German Universities, Plus, you're not allowed to work by law in your first year and a visa requirement is to have a ' Blocked bank account ' Learn more about the Blocked Bank account here' in Germany with about $10,000 so that the government know you will survive the first year with no financial problems. The Blocked bank account can let you withdraw about $850 per month. So I need help survive the first year, and I will legally be able to work in Germany after my first year and I will support myself for the next two years of studies. 

  I need a total of  $12,900 for the following:

  • $10,000 for the Blocked bank account, money will be used for monthly rents which is about $850 ( all electric, internet, heating ..etc included ) Food, health insurance, transportation, ...etc 
  • $1,000 for a 12-months German language course at a German Language institution.
  • $1,000 flight tickets, transportation, permissions, visas. 
  • $900 transaction fees + %5 indiegogo fees.
I am passionate to continue my learning in the hope that one day I will be able to give back to other people who are in a worse situation than me. This crowd funding page is there to give me the lift onto the first rung on the ladder, and once there I will be able to keep climbing higher.

How can you help? 

1. It'd be best if you can contribute whatever you can, as little as $1, everything counts! Or order any of the perks! And remember that $1 from you won't break you down, but surely can hold someone up!

2. Share among your friends and family, get the word out that's the least you can do, share on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram even the word of mouth is helpful! Plus it's FREE! and It'd mean the world to me ..  #SharingIsCaring 

3. Pray for me  <3 

Being supported by the people, will always remind me and inspire me to help and support others.

I will also be updating my campaign eventually on here, Twitter and Periscope @Saed_Habib  - www.periscope.tv/saed_habib 

P.S: If you'd like an inspirational video on why to help people, Please watch this: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ufQpgYSDRdU, I will also keep everyone updated on how I go whilst in Germany! :^) Thanks so much for reading, sharing, and donating! 

-----------

ِExtras:

University I dream to study at in Germany: http://bit.ly/uniger


Check out the Gallery for more photos and information 

Facts you might not know about Gaza:

1. Over 43% of Gaza's population of 1.9M are Unemployed, according to World Bank Statistics. 

2. Gaza lives on about 6-8 hours of Electricity every day since 2006 until this moment. 

3. Most people in Gaza live on $300 - $500 per month, which is the average wage.

story:
Summary

I've been teaching English for the past 9 years. I taught English from an early age and now I am trying to make a difference by teaching other people to increase their opportunities to succeed. As I didn't plan on becoming a teacher when I was younger, I never really considered pursuing a degree in teaching. Now, I want to work for the Ministry of Education but it's impossible to do if you haven't taken the ICELT course and or didn't major in ESL.

I strongly believe that everyone has a right to succeed. Here, in my country, in spite of its geographical location - right below the USA - only 5% of the people who speak English use it effectively and have more opportunities to find a well paid job.


If I reach the goal and I take the ICELT course

  • I'll give back to the community by offering free ESL tutoring to those who need it.
  • Offer guidance to people who already speak English effectively in order for them to become teachers.
If I don't reach the goal.
  • I will pay to get a website where I can upload and share the materials I have developed so others will benefit from them, not only from my country but from other countries, too.
This is the first time I find myself trying one of these campaigns and I don't really know how people would react, but I am confident that I can make  difference here and I thank you in advance for taking the time to stop and dedicate your time to reading about this campaign.

More information about the Course.

It will take place in Ciudad Victoria, Tamaulipas, Mexico and It'll be conducted by The Anglo at Ateneo Victoria facilities. 
For more information about The Anglo, please visit: http://anglo.mx/index.php
Best regards!

story:
Why the campaign?

On the evening of January the 20th the I2B Skatepark in Somerset West, South Africa, caught fire.  We rushed to the skatepark after receiving the news only to find that our attempts to kill this raging fire would not nearly be good enough. Minutes later the Fire Department arrived – unfortunately not in time to save the parts of the large ramp and shading net that were damaged.

The I2B Skatepark is one of the main projects of our Non-Profit Organisation (NGO), Inspired2Become. One of the aims of the I2B Skatepark project is to motivate youth to live a positive, active lifestyle. We run a weekly club at the skatepark for local Helderberg youth and another club for children from the Brightlights safe house. We also partner with the NGO, Pebbles Project, where we run a club for the children from the surrounding farms.

It saddened our hearts to see all the hard work that went into the project burn to the ground. We want to raise funds in order to rebuild the I2B Skatepark, expand the park to make it more family friendly and raise additional funds for our NGO, Inspired2Become (I2B).

What is Inspired2Become (I2B)?

I2B was founded in 2010 by two small town brothers, Chris and Fanie van der Merwe. Chris is a qualified professional rollerblader and has competed in competitions around the world, including the Asian x Games and the Dubai X Games. Fanie, was a gold medalist at the 2008 and 2012 Paralympic games. These two brothers saw the need of South African youth to rise from the challenges their communities and their disabilities hold. 


I2B Action Sports

Chris focuses on alternative action sport clubs in different areas of the Western Cape. He runs skateboarding, rollerblading and skimboarding clubs in the following areas: Cloetesville, Strand, Gordon’s Bay, Somerset West, Kleinvlei, Macassar, Bonteheuwel and Belhar.

Chris also builds skateparks as part of the organization’s projects. He is currently focusing on rebuilding/upgrading the I2B Skatepark in Somerset West. 

He also gave plans to the municipality of Stellenbosch to rebuild the I2B Cloetesville Skatepark. The previous skatepark that Chris built in this developing area has been targeted and vandalized to the point that the only thing left of the park is a metal rail. Chris now wants to build a cement park once the plans have been approved.

I2B Athletics for youth with disabilities

Fanie coaches youth with disabilities from the Alta du Toit School as well as from the Pioneer School for the Blind. Both Fanie and Chris also do life skills lesson with the youth.

I2B Educational Therapy

During 2016 the I2B focus areas have shifted from developing youth through sport to developing youth in general. Jami van der Merwe, a speech therapist (and Chris’s wife!), joined the I2B team. She worked at a special school in Mitchell’s Plain for 6 years. Jami will function as the administrative officer of the organization as well as a project manager. Her aim is to start therapeutic groups at Raithby Primary school with learners from developing areas. She will focus mainly on literacy and language therapy.

How can you help?

Here’s how you can get involved:

1.  Donate on this Indiegogo Campaign and help us reach our funding goal of $55,000.

2.  Like and share this campaign! You can find us at:

·  https://www.facebook.com/Inspired2Become-youth-development-through-sport-160594607297146/?ref=bookmarks

·  www.inspired2become.org

3.  Get involved as a volunteer and form part of the rebuilding process. We would love it if you want to join the I2B Building team!


The fire might have destroyed parts of our park but it can never destroy our hope and our faith! We look forward to share the outcome of our story with you!

story:
Light Celebrates Peace! 

After close to sixty years in the dark due to power shortages and a reduced ability to light the city, Havana is stirring again and showing signs of new life in its public realm and private initiatives. Cuba is opening up its arms to the United States. Americans are visiting in droves and making friends with Cubans in unprecedented ways. This project will help consolidate the City of Havana's re-entry into the world stage. This is an example of public culture providing the visual clues that will create a vibrant private sector, create jobs and make Cubans see progress and make all residents and visitors to the City of Havana experience its historic past.

Después de cerca de sesenta años en la oscuridad debido a la escasez de energía y una disminución de la capacidad para iluminar la ciudad, La Habana se agita de nuevo y mostrar signos de vida nueva en su ámbito público y la iniciativa privada. Cuba se está abriendo sus brazos a los Estados Unidos. Los estadounidenses asisten en masa y hacer amigos con los cubanos de una manera sin precedentes. Este proyecto ayudará a consolidar la Ciudad de reingreso de La Habana en el escenario mundial. Este es un ejemplo de la cultura pública que proporciona las pistas visuales que va a crear un sector privado dinámico, generen empleos y cubanos ven el progreso y hacer todos los residentes y visitantes de la Ciudad de La Habana experimentar su pasado histórico.


Havana was once graced by thousands of electric signs on theaters, stores, hotels and nightclubs. It was a city of lights that rivaled even Paris in the 1950s. Neon and incandescent signs heralded the urban chic of the city before the practice fell into disfavor in the early 1960s and they slowly evaporated from the city’s skyline. The politically incorrect implications of the fabulous signage, as well as the maintenance required in the harsh, tropical climate propelled the signs into decay. Today, Havana is a city with a new vigor and energy that is quickly reclaiming old traditions and breathing new life into the electric signs that are the architectural equivalent of the rolling stock of antique American cars the city’s streets.

La Habana  una vez fue agraciado por miles de señales eléctricas en teatros, tiendas, hoteles y discotecas. Era una ciudad de las luces que rivalizaban incluso París en la década de 1950. Neón y signos incandescentes anunciaron la elegancia urbana de la ciudad antes de la práctica cayó en desuso a principios de 1960 y se evapora lentamente del horizonte de la ciudad. Las implicaciones políticamente incorrectos de la señalización fabulosa, así como el mantenimiento requerido en el duro clima, tropical propulsaron los signos en decadencia. Hoy en día, La Habana es una ciudad con un nuevo vigor y energía que está recuperando rápidamente las viejas tradiciones y dar nueva vida a las señales eléctricas que son el equivalente arquitectónico del material rodante de los coches americanos antiguos calles de la ciudad.

On a road to lasting friendship and peace!  

On December 17, 2014 the US and Cuba announced dynamic new changes that will pave the way for a new peaceful relationship between the peoples of Cuba and the United States. This includes full diplomatic relations, a banking relationship, and other reforms related to making it easier to work in Cuba. Although we are under no illusions that change will happen for both our countries easily and quickly we are committed to enhancing the relationships between our countries with this project.

En un camino a la amistad y la paz duradera!                                                            El 17 de diciembre 2014 los EE.UU. y Cuba anunció nuevos cambios dinámicos que prepararán el camino para una nueva relación pacífica entre los pueblos de Cuba y Estados Unidos. Esto incluye las relaciones diplomáticas completas, una relación bancaria, y otras reformas relacionadas con lo que es más fácil trabajar en Cuba. A pesar de que estamos bajo ninguna ilusión de que el cambio será efectivo para nuestros dos países fácil y rápidamente estamos comprometidos con la mejora de las relaciones entre nuestros países con este proyecto.


Este proyecto cumple plenamente con todas las regulaciones existentes en los EE.UU. con respecto a las sanciones cubanas.

This project fully complies with all existing regulations in the USA regarding Cuban Sanctions. For detailed information on US Laws concerning Cuba please open this link: Cuba Sanctions.

Alumbrando el Barrio! Lighting up the Neighborhood! That's our motto! We are a group of artists and neon sign lovers that are intent in restoring the historic neon signs of Havana, Cuba.

Ese es nuestro lema! Somos un grupo de artistas y amantes de la señal de neón que tienen la intención de restaurar las señales de neón históricos de La Habana, Cuba.


You can help us do this! Your help in adopting a sign will make this happen!  Not only do we need your funding but your interest and encouragement will propel us forward! We are searching for people just like you, who like art, love neon and want to see a vibrant city skyline restored to its former glory! No mater what category of funding you select it will be a very important show of support for the citizens of Havana.
Usted puede ayudarnos a hacer esto! Su ayuda en la adopción de un letrero de neon hará que esto suceda! No sólo necesitamos su financiación, pero su interés y estímulo nos impulsa hacia delante! Estamos buscando a personas como usted, que les gusta el arte, el amor de neón y quieren ver un horizonte de la vibrante ciudad restaurado a su antigua gloria! Sin importar en qué categoría de fondos que seleccione será un espectáculo muy importante de apoyo para los habitantes de La Habana.

We are already set up and ready to go with the first full service neon shop in private hands in Havana in many years, we have all the tubes, glass, torches and ladders to get this job done. We have the best young neon benders on the island and we are already doing it! We have already restored ten+ signs! With your help we will light us the whole city! This project is conducted by a private citizen artist and it aims at improving the private sector, increase civil society and benefit the Cuban people directly with an improved public realm. We have already created a small independent business and four private sector jobs. Your help will allow us to expand this work

Ya estamos trabajando y listos con el primer taller de neón en servicio completo en manos privadas en La Habana en muchos años, hemos todos los tubos, vidrio, antorchas y escaleras que hacer este trabajo. Tenemos los mejores dobladores de neón jóvenes de la isla y que ya estamos haciendo! Ya hemos restaurado diez luminicos+! Con su ayuda, nosotros encenderemos toda la ciudad! Este proyecto se lleva a cabo por un artista ciudadano privado y que tiene por objeto mejorar el sector privado, la sociedad civil y aumentar beneficiar directamente al pueblo cubano con una mejora de dominio público. Ya hemos creado una pequeña empresa independiente y cuatro puestos de trabajo del sector privado. Su ayuda nos permitirá ampliar este trabajo

We need your support! Although it is a lot easier to work in Cuba because of the  lifting of some restrictions for Americans to connect with the island, it is still very difficult to carry out a project of this magnitude there. But we are experienced entrepreneurs and artists. We are a  unique group of partners who posses all of the necessary skills and experience in working in the USA and Cuba.  We are experts in sign creation, historic neon sign restoration, government relations, civic processes, planning, distribution, marketing, sales, business administration, tourism planning and public relations to address the needs of our project. 
¡Necesitamos su apoyo! A pesar de que es mucho más fácil trabajar en Cuba debido a la retirada de algunas restricciones para los estadounidenses a conectar con la isla, todavía es muy difícil de llevar a cabo un proyecto de esta magnitud . Pero somos empresarios y artistas experimentados. Somos un grupo único de socios que poseen todos los conocimientos y la experiencia necesaria para trabajar en los EE.UU. y Cuba. Somos expertos en la creación de signos, restauración histórica señal de neón, relaciones gubernamentales, procesos cívicos, planificación, distribución, comercialización, ventas, administración de empresas, la planificación del turismo y las relaciones públicas para hacer frente a las necesidades de nuestro proyecto.

Read more about our founder. Kadir Lopez Nieves is one of Havana's most interesting and successful artists. After many years of working in his studio with signs and neon he decided to move out into the community to provide the benefits of his work to the everyday people of Havana. Fascinated by the city's stock of rusting and aging public signage created a new public practice to start restoring these beauties for all the residents of the City.
This is a perfect example of how art can change the world for the better. One sign at a time!
Read more about Kadir Lopez Nieves here

Lea más arriba acerca de nuestro fundador. Kadir López Nieves es uno de los artistas más interesantes y exitosos de La Habana. Después de muchos años de trabajo en su estudio con signos de neón y decide trasladarse a la comunidad para proporcionar los beneficios de su trabajo a la gente de todos los días de La Habana. Fascinado por la oxidación social de la ciudad y el envejecimiento de señalización pública creó una nueva práctica pública para iniciar la restauración de estas bellezas para todos los residentes de la ciudad.

Este es un ejemplo perfecto de cómo el arte puede cambiar el mundo para mejor. Una luminico a la vez!


Please help us get the word out.  Please use the Indiegogo share tools!
story_txt:
Light Celebrates Peace! 
After close to sixty years in the dark due to power shortages and a reduced ability to light the city, Havana is stirring again and showing signs of new life in its public realm and private initiatives. Cuba is opening up its arms to the United States. Americans are visiting in droves and making friends with Cubans in unprecedented ways. This project will help consolidate the City of Havana's re-entry into the world stage. This is an example of public culture providing the visual clues that will create a vibrant private sector, create jobs and make Cubans see progress and make all residents and visitors to the City of Havana experience its historic past.
Después de cerca de sesenta años en la oscuridad debido a la escasez de energía y una disminución de la capacidad para iluminar la ciudad, La Habana se agita de nuevo y mostrar signos de vida nueva en su ámbito público y la iniciativa privada. Cuba se está abriendo sus brazos a los Estados Unidos. Los estadounidenses asisten en masa y hacer amigos con los cubanos de una manera sin precedentes. Este proyecto ayudará a consolidar la Ciudad de reingreso de La Habana en el escenario mundial. Este es un ejemplo de la cultura pública que proporciona las pistas visuales que va a crear un sector privado dinámico, generen empleos y cubanos ven el progreso y hacer todos los residentes y visitantes de la Ciudad de La Habana experimentar su pasado histórico.

Havana was once graced by thousands of electric signs on theaters, stores, hotels and nightclubs. It was a city of lights that rivaled even Paris in the 1950s. Neon and incandescent signs heralded the urban chic of the city before the practice fell into disfavor in the early 1960s and they slowly evaporated from the city’s skyline. The politically incorrect implications of the fabulous signage, as well as the maintenance required in the harsh, tropical climate propelled the signs into decay. Today, Havana is a city with a new vigor and energy that is quickly reclaiming old traditions and breathing new life into the electric signs that are the architectural equivalent of the rolling stock of antique American cars the city’s streets.

Neón y signos incandescentes anunciaron la elegancia urbana de la ciudad antes de la práctica cayó en desuso a principios de 1960 y se evapora lentamente del horizonte de la ciudad. Las implicaciones políticamente incorrectos de la señalización fabulosa, así como el mantenimiento requerido en el duro clima, tropical propulsaron los signos en decadencia. Hoy en día, La Habana es una ciudad con un nuevo vigor y energía que está recuperando rápidamente las viejas tradiciones y dar nueva vida a las señales eléctricas que son el equivalente arquitectónico del material rodante de los coches americanos antiguos calles de la ciudad.
