ensuring we have a solid foundation for world wide distribution.Now we need to raise the money to hire a professional film crew to start filming here in the UK and in America.Thankfully, we have access to an award winning director and a team of professional cameramen and editors who resonate with our cause- but they have families to feed too, and the more we can support the teams who are supporting us, the more we can achieve together!The target covers:Hire of Cameras, lighting equipment, sound equipment, cameramen, sound person, lighting person, travel, accommodation when required, editor and editing suite, and marketing materials.Currently, we are budgeting for the minimum amount we can get away with to produce this DocuFilm. If we exceed our goal, every penny raised will go back into the production and distribution of this important film - enabling us to make it even better, and get it seen by even more people.  A Short Message From Warren Inspire Ryan:"Through my life experiences thus far, I have learnt that nothing can hit you as hard as life itself.Through all of my pain, my faith in God has kept me believing through the good and the bad; I’ve found and stayed on a straight and narrow path. I’ve had to make sacrifices from things I can live without to the people I love and mean everything to me.I was born a leader, and to lead by example and show that no matter how bad your start in life may have been, there’s a way out.Its all about your attitude.Some people use their pain mountains and get into a cycle of self pity. To dream small is to be unrealistic; conditioning your mindset will allow you to leave a legacy one day. I found the cure to my depression in helping others. Making someone else’s life better gave my life meaning.I would never want to change my past because it made me who I am today. I wish and plan to reach out to as many people as possible and impart the belief that THEY can truly change their circumstances.Thank you."Thank you for supporting this cause, you are changing lives.If you would like to know more, please contact us directly and we'll be happy to talk to you!

story:
Short Summary

Health-conscious people today are confused and frustrated by the hype, misinformation and conflicting theories that have made the natural health arena a swamp of confusion. The Healthy Skeptics™ was created to guide people to accurate and relevant information. The show is presented in two parts. The first segment focuses on debunking health myths, scams and dead ends; things you should IGNORE. Segment two presents evidence-based breakthroughs that offer true health benefits; products, technologies and treatments that you should EXPLORE.

 

Healthy Skeptics YouTube Channel. To maximize availability and impact of this vital information, Stephen and Natalie will launch a YouTube channel, posting short and insightful videos roughly every other day. Each will be accompanied by a paragraph explaining the evidence used. Those wanting to drill down further can click to TheHeathySkeptics.com, where they will find a wealth of information derived from Stephen’s 48 years of academic, clinical and research experience. This exists in a searchable database containing articles, white papers, book chapters, videos and audio files. We intend to make TheHealthySkeptics.com the go-to site for reliable, up to the minute information on all things related to health and wellness.

 

 

NOTE: YouTube subscription is free, as is access to the archived information on the Healthy Skeptics website. In addition, individuals can become Healthy Skeptics members, for a monthly fee of $9.95. Members have personal access to Stephen, Natalie and the other Healthy Skeptics experts via a monitored interactive forum. In addition, members receive “first-view” access to monthly shows and discounts on products researched and developed by Foxtrail Farms.™

Foxtrail Farms™ is a two-acre experimental farm and processing facility that focuses on permaculture and superfood research. The core Healthy Skeptic principle is that true health starts with the soil and our relationship with plants. Stephen’s research in New Guinea identified 75 species of plants that hunters and gatherers consumed on a daily basis. In contrast, the average American consumes 11 species of plants in a week, and most of these are highly processed. Foxtrail Farms conducts community awareness seminars on food security and is scheduled to launch a line of superfoods in mid-2017.

See video interview with Daniel Cherniske, and his TED talk below:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZK3S2rCHmPA

What We Need & What You Get

We have many assets and resources in place, including books, websites, two completed shows, Dr. Kather’s clinic and Foxtrail Farms. We need video and editing equipment, research instruments, additional metabolic testing equipment, food processing equipment, money for staff and legal fees.  If we do not reach 100% our fundraising  goals, we  will apply the funds to the most pressing need: making Healthy Skeptics membership an exciting value.

The reward program includes signed books, Healthy Skeptics memberships, advanced health screening tests with consultations, as well as product discounts.

$10 backers receive one month Healthy Skeptics membership (Value $10)

$25 backers receive one month Healthy Skeptics membership plus one signed book (The Metabolic Plan)

$50 backers receive two books: The Metabolic Makeover and The Metabolic Plan, plus 3-month free membership (total value: $65)

$100 backers receive two books plus 8 months’ free membership (Total value $120)

$500 backers: receive two books, 2 years’ membership, plus one of the following: ANSHA test with consultation at Advanced Family Wellness in Olympia WA. Or (if travel to WA is inconvenient) advanced blood testing in a lab near you, with consultation by phone. (total value: approximately $750)

Description: ANSHA stands for Autonomic Nervous System Health Assessment. All functions of the human body are controlled or influenced by the nervous system. Some movement and sensory functions (vision, touch) are voluntary. Everything else is regulated by the autonomic nervous system (ANS), including circulation (heart and blood vessels) temperature regulation, digestion and metabolism. The ANS is divided into the sympathetic and parasympathetic branches.

As Stephen explained in The Metabolic Plan, the sympathetic nervous system drives catabolic activity associated with the fight or flight response.Sympathetic output increases heart rate, breathing, liver functions related to energy needs as well as glucose release. Parasympathetic activity is generally anabolic, associated with repair and restore functions. As you can imagine, optimum health requires a balanced coordination of these activities and that can now be measured with a sophisticated technology known as ANSHA. Importantly, ANSHA is FDA-approved and insurance reimbursable. Insurance companies cover this test because it predicts disease and degeneration, which saves them money, and reduces health risks for you.

You will be instructed to avoid stimulants like caffeine on the day of the test. In our clinic, you will be fitted with EEG leads to evaluate cardiovascular function, a blood pressure cuff and a pulse wave analyzer. All three technologies simultaneously feed information to the ANSHA device which analyzes the interaction (cross talk) between your nervous system, your heart, and blood vessels. At the end of this 20 minute assessment, you will receive a full report, including EEG, blood vessel elasticity, heart rate variability and a calculated biological age associated with the balance of sympathetic and parasympathetic activity. 

$1,000 backers: receive all the above plus one additional test, lifetime membership and 25% product discount for three years (additional tests include Cardio Coach™ cardiopulmonary testing).

Description:  This level of metabolic testing was once reserved for elite athletes looking to create the ultimate strategy for training and competition. But in 2009, Dr. Kather became one of the first Family Practice physicians to understand the critical value of metabolic testing for any health conscious man or woman. In this test, you will obtain baseline oxygen utilization while wearing the CardioCoach mask. This advanced technology measures the exchange rate of oxygen and carbon dioxide in the resting state.

Then comes the fun part. You are placed on a bicycle ergometer and asked to pedal against increasing resistance. As your muscles demand more oxygen to fuel this effort, the Cardio Coach measures how well your lungs and blood vessels provide the required oxygen, and precisely when your metabolism shifts from aerobic (using oxygen) to anaerobic (using a different fuel delivery known as glycolysis / pyruvate). This information can help athletes to fine-tune training to optimize muscle fiber conditioning. Runners will have a remarkably different focus compared to weight-lifters.

This information, however, can be life-changing for anyone who understands the core truth that “muscle is magic.” The information derived from Cardio Coach testing will help us design an exercise program specific to your current metabolic state, so that you get the most benefit from the least effort. At Advanced Family Wellness, we understand that most people do not want to work out in a gym for 2 hours, three days a week. Our goal is to generate a personalized exercise routine which provides maximum benefit from 10 to 15 minutes of targeted exercise. This performance test provides valuable data on the following metabolic biomarkers:

* VO2 MAX (also maximal oxygen consumption, maximal oxygen uptake or maximal aerobic capacity)

* Anaerobic Threshold (AT) There is tremendous benefit in increasing AT, especially if fat-loss is your goal. Our trainers will help you design an exercise program that promotes fat-burning.

For athletes, increasing AT enhances both endurance and cardiovascular performance.

* Calories burned and Resting Metabolic Rate (RMR)

This is a scientific measurement of how many calories a person is burning during a day, a vital piece of information when designing a weight loss regimen.

$5,000 backers: receive… all the above, lifetime membership, and 30% product discount for 5 years

$10,000 backers: receive the Platinum reward package called the Comprehensive Evaluation. Prior to your visit, you will have blood drawn at a facility convenient to you for testing. When results are in, you will fly First Class to Seattle, travel by limo to Dr. Kather’s clinic, where you will have additional tests to evaluate cardiopulmonary and metabolic fitness, followed by consultation with Stephen and Natalie to create a treatment plan for you to discuss with your primary care physician. Limo will take you to your hotel, and drive you to the airport the following day. Thereafter, you will enjoy lifetime Healthy  Skeptics membership and a 50% product discount for 5 years.

Risks & Challenges

The Challenge of Change. In addition to the avalanche of information, of course, there is the blinding pace of change in the world in which we live. Every week, there is a new app or technology that claims to make us more efficient, more informed or at least better entertained. Who could have predicted the astounding way in which technology has changed every aspect of our lives, including the thousand distractions that steal our time and attention. At the same time, the human operating system known as your genome, has not changed significantly in more than 20,000 years.

  • This paradox is rarely understood because we are too busy to consider how our technology has outstripped our biology; how we are in a very real sense, out of synch with our genes.  The Healthy Skeptics approach is not to harken back to some pre-agricultural paleo panacea, but to look at ways to harmonize this 21st century experience with our ancient genetic programming. Thus, attention to diet, lifestyle, exercise, sleep and stress management are all based on a deep understanding of evolutionary biology, as explained in The Metabolic Makeover and discussed in The Healthy Skeptics interactive forum.
  • The Healthy Skeptics YouTube Channel is free and when you subscribe and click on notify so you get an email or text every time a new video is posted. These videos are exciting and inspiring. We call it INFOtainment:  1 to 5 minutes long with hard-hitting reviews of trending health topics

TheHealthySkeptics.com is the community where all that unfolds, and where you have access to our staff of leading experts. What's more, you have access to archived materials dealing with just about every health fad, product and program that has come along in the last 30 years.

Foxtrail Farms: Advances in permaculture include developing superfoods and launching community gardens to advance LOCAL and ORGANIC food production. For example, we're researching how culturing plant proteins increases the digestibility and amino acid score. This is the frontier of natural products R&D.

A Critical Need. The time is NOW

When people are confused, they become paralyzed. And if you think the health care environment today is confusing, wait a few months, during which:

* A hundred new labs will offer a dizzying array of medical tests.

* A thousand new websites will be launched offering advice that ranges from somewhat useful to utterly absurd.

* A million new tweets, emails, videos and FaceBook posts will make confident statements, most of which are false and all of which add to the confusion.

The Healthy Skeptics team, led by Dr. Natalie Kather, a double board-certified Family Practice physician and her biochemist husband, will be the go-to authority for accurate, up to the minute health information. Their no-holds barred approach is delivered with courage (they name names) humor (infotainment) and panache.

The Healthy Skeptics approach is powered by two engines: Biomedical research and clinical application. This is the perfect strategy to guide you through the world of 21st century heath care.   

Our Background

Stephen Cherniske taught Clinical Nutrition for the UCLA Department of Continuing Education in Health Science. He served on the faculty of the American College of Sports Medicine and directed the nation’s first FDA-licensed clinical lab specializing in nutrition and immunology. He is a patent holder in biotechnology, and also a best-selling author, with over a million copies in print. 

His wife, Natalie Kather, is a double board-certified Family Medicine physician who has served as principal investigator for clinical trials in both the pharmaceutical and natural products arena. They have assembled a team of experts for this important endeavor, including individuals with advanced degrees in molecular biology, genetics, bioinformatics and organic chemistry

We have the training, experience and passion to create this important endeavor. Stephen’s training in health science started in 1968, with a course in dietetics for VISTA volunteer service. In the 1970’s he helped to create Integral Health Services in Putnam, Connecticut; considered the first truly integrative medical clinic in North America. Moving to Los Angeles in 1980, he taught university clinical nutrition and directed the nation’s first federally licensed clinical lab specializing in nutrition and immunology. With a passion for sports nutrition, Stephen served on the faculty of the American College of Sports Medicine, and was nutritional consultant to members of the 1984 US Track and Field team.

Three years later, he moved to Santa Barbara to write. His first book, The DHEA Breakthrough (Random House, 1996) became an international best seller in 90 days. That was followed by Caffeine Blues (Warner, 1998) The Metabolic Plan (Random House 2003) and The Metabolic Makeover (Altea Media, 2014).  With more than one million copies in print, Stephen is one of the most widely read authors in the Health and Wellness category.  In 1998, Stephen co-founded Oasis Wellness Network / Univera. Over the next 19 years, serving first as President and then Chief Scientific Officer, his research team published 72 studies in peer-reviewed biomedical journals, created the world’s largest functional medicinal plant library and filed for more than 180 patents.

Dr. Natalie Kather took a less eclectic and more demanding path. Graduating with honors at every stage of her education, she received her Medical Degree in 1996. Natalie was disappointed at the “drugs first” training that she received in Medical School, and hoped that internship and residency would be more prevention oriented. That was not to be the case; nor was there much attention to the inherent ability of the human body to self-repair. “I kept waiting for the unit on how to optimize our regenerative capacity,” she writes, “but it never came. 95% of my training was about dealing with the symptoms of DEgeneration.”

Ultimately, Natalie took it upon herself to explore every facet of preventive care. Believing that was most likely to be found in Family Medicine (the most comprehensive specialty, covering everything from pediatrics to gerontology) she became board certified in 1999 and has maintained that prestigious position.

Even that, however, turned out to be disappointing. So she dove into the emerging science of anti-aging, and after more than 200 hours of research, became board certified in that specialty as well. 

Still, she was not fulfilled. It was only by creating her own clinic in 2007 that she was able to finally practice the kind of medicine that she knew was possible. Advanced Family Wellness provides the full scope of primary medical care, with emphasis on prevention and anti-aging.  

Other Ways You Can Help

  1. LIKE and SHARE The Healthy Skeptics on FaceBook and YouTube
  2. Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word about our campaign
  3. Refer to TheHealthySkeptics.com whenever you need reliable information about the latest health fad or miracle product.

story:
Our Story

"In its moving indictment of the misery wrought by war Across the Black Waters stands with Eric Maria Remarque’s All Quiet on the Western Front and Stephen Crane’s The Red Badge of Courage, as one of the best anti-war novels of all time."
-- Professor Rajender Kaur, William Paterson University, New Jersey

We are excited to invite YOU to join us on our WWI Centenary Journey of Discovery into a world where fiction brings to life the story of over 1 million soldiers from Undivided India, Hindu, Muslim, Sikh and others who left their homes and families over five thousand miles away to fight for Britain with Allied forces in Europe for the first time.  Undivided India under colonial rule included present day Pakistan (1947), Bangladesh (1971) and India (1947).

Our project centres on the WWI Centenary edition of the novel Across the Black Waters by Mulk Raj Anand, which includes an Introduction by Dr Alastair Niven, friend of the author and Man Booker Prize Judge 1994 and 2014:

“It has taken nearly one hundred years for the contribution of Indian sepoys in the First World War to be properly recognised. Even today, it is less well known than it should be. Yet back in 1939 one of India’s greatest novelists, writing in English but forged by a Panjabi sensibility, described their bravery, suffering and bewilderment as they became cannon fodder in the trenches." 

The 1st small print run of the WWI Centenary edition is fast running out.  We need your help to produce a 2nd version in larger numbers, with illustrations, that will help modern readers understand the context of the history behind the story.

This is a story with huge relevance for today’s increasingly divided world.  Soldiers from very different communities and religions, including Hindus, Muslims and Sikhs, fought side by side within a shared culture for a common cause.

Who We Are

We are Dominic Rai and Caroline Goffin. We met and started to work together in London in 1993 and are now co-directors of Salt of the Sarkar, a project of  MánMelá Promotions Ltd.

We were inspired by the story told in the novel by Mulk Raj Anand (1905-2004) - the son of a soldier - about the very first Indian soldiers who arrived in Marseilles in September 1914 and fought in Flanders and France. From page one the characters come alive as we follow them arriving for the first time in Europe, and as they respond to the horrors of war they encounter.

We became the creative team behind Mán Melá Theatre Company and in 1998 we put on a theatre production of Across the Black Waters in 1998 with the author’s encouragement.  The launch, and also a one-day symposium were held at the Imperial War Museum. Mulk Raj Anand wrote to us that he would love to see his novel published in Britain again.

We were keen to see an edition produced which had Indian and not European soldiers on the front cover and we believed that the time for this to happen was October 2014, the centenary of the events in the novel.  

Against the odds we managed to launch a small printing of the novel together with our project Salt of the Sarkar at the House of Commons, London.

Salt of the Sarkar is a project designed to promote the novel and the story behind it during the World War One Centenary years 2014-2018 and beyond. 

The term 'Salt of the Sarkar' is used by the Indian soldiers in the novel Across the Black Waters as well as in their letters home.

"Sarkar" means the ruling authority. "Eating the salt" refers to the oath that binds one to a political superior through obligations of protection and loyalty.

A key strand of our work is to broaden young people’s knowledge of the First World War and the contribution of  the soldiers from what was a culturally and religiously diverse India, but politically undivided prior to Partition in 1947.

Mulk Raj Anand’s novel and writing is also celebrated as a foundation stone of modern and post colonial writing.

We have no huge infrastructure or funding - just our passion, discoveries over the years. and the encouragement and support of a number of friends and supporters we have made along the way.

Our aim during the centenary years and beyond is to reach a new generation of over a million with the story and contribution of Undivided Indian soldiers in The Great War. We are doing this through the novel, soldiers letters home, events, workshops and sharing through social media.

Why this project is important to us

Mulk Raj Anand’s Across the Black Waters was first published simultaneously in London and Toronto in 1940. It is significant this still remains the only major fictional account of over a million soldiers from Undivided India who fought for the British Empire for the first time in Europe.  

We have personally both invested a huge amount of time, energy and resources into promoting this author and novel over more than two decades.  We are continually discovering more hidden depths relating to the author, the fiction and the relevant history that is behind the project.

Since starting our project in 2014 we have received a huge amount of support in kind from amazing friends to enable us to achieve our main objectives in publishing and promoting the novel to the level we have.

At the end of the day though we are basically two individuals working part time on this, based in two different countries - England and Wales - and we need financial support in order to take the project to the next level.

We believe that on many levels, this project has a message that is relevant to today’s divided and war torn world and deserves to be more widely known, especially by young people.

What we have achieved so far

London -October 2014

  • Salt of the Sarkar Project Launch and Commemorative Event at House of Commons, Westminster
  • The publication and Launch of Centenary edition of the novel Across the Black Waters by Mulk Raj Anand at Housmans Bookshop, London

UK 2014-2016

  • Raising the profile of Salt of the Sarkar, the novel and the voices of the soldiers through a programme of presentations, workshops and performances, including participation in a range of major networking events relating to promoting the role of Indian soldiers in World War One

Goals of Salt of the Sarkar

  • to reach a new generation of over a million people with the story of soldiers from Undivided India in World War One
  • to remember the little known contribution of soldiers from Undivided India in the First World War
  • to profile Mulk Raj Anand (1905-2004) as a founder figure of modern Indian literature in English
  • to engage audiences, especially young people with the story of undivided Indian soldiers in World War One
  • to promote social cohesion and an understanding of cultural differences through workshops highlighting shared experience

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking you to donate to enable us to develop our project further, including producing the 2nd print edition of the WW1 Centenary Edition of Across the Black Waters, this classic but little known war novel which is based on the history of a real life regiment in 1914.

A key part of this new print edition will be to add in illustrations including photos by pioneer press photographers of the Daily Mirror, taken at the time and locations of events described during the opening chapters of the book.

 We also plan to use these images in the ebook edition scheduled for Fall release in 2017, and in collaborative activities in the coming years.

£6000  will give us the resources to take our project to the next level with the additional historical material and original photos shot by pioneer Daily Mirror press photographers present in Marseilles and Orleans on 26 September 1914 and then in Orleans in the early part of October.  These are of the Indian soldiers arriving in France exactly as depicted in the early chapters of the novel.  

Any donations in excess of £6000 will also enable us to 

  • reprint a larger number of the books (which will result in more funding for the project)
  • engage some freelance professional help as needed for promotion and to investigate further fundraising
  • help us reach more audiences with events and workshops

Estimated breakdown:

Production & Printing £3500

Research £1000

Project Development £1000

Marketing £500

This funding will also give us a better foundation to respond to the openings for outreach that we are receiving both in the UK and from around the globe.

If we do not reach our funding target, we will still use the funds received in our ongoing effort towards printing the illustrated edition of the novel.  Every bit helps.

In Return

You will not only receive receive our sincere thanks. You will be acknowledged for becoming an important part of our movement to reach a new generation of over a million including young people with this little known story. You will have the gratitude of ourselves; and the soldiers from Undivided India who will be remembered and from their descendants - who are only now in many cases discovering the decisive role played by their ancestors.

When you donate, you will also receive a thank you on our Twitter page. We also have a few perks listed on our Indiegogo page.

You will also be invited to join our Supporters and Advocates Group with regular mailings and information and, depending on the level of success of our campaign, access to additional special offers over the coming months and years.

 

The Impact

The impact of this funding will be HUGE in increasing momentum for this project, during the remaining WW1 centenary years, where there is growing interest in the comparatively little known subject matter. 

Over the centenary years we have built up contacts with a growing network researching the Indian soldiers from Undivided India (as well as other similarly forgotten WW1 soldiers and participants in the War).  Funding at this point in time will enable us to plan how we can cooperate with these groups on collaborative educational projects.

Your donation helps this amazing story reach a wider audience, and makes you part of this incredible Journey of Discovery where literature, history, separation of families, humanity of ordinary people, horror or war and the voices of 100 years ago come to life in a creative way to enable us all to think about our own world in 2017 with new perspective.

 

Risks & Challenges

We've put so much of our time, money and other resources into this project over the last few years that we are concerned about being able to get this little known story out to new generations who can benefit from the knowledge shared.

The main risk if we do not receive this funding is that we will have to pare down the project to the minimum, and miss the opportunity provided by the WW1 Centenary period to reach the wider international audience while the world is focussed on this topic.

We are already half way through the WWI Centenary years 2014-2018 which are the key years to make an impact.  

We are confident that we have created a some real inroads with our past work, and your donations will enable us to continue successfully.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Every little bit helps. If you aren't able to donate, please share our campaign with friends, family and your extended online networks. You can share directly from our Indiegogo page. Thanks again for your interest. We look forward to hearing from you!
story_txt:
Our Story
"In its moving indictment of the misery wrought by war Across the Black Waters stands with Eric Maria Remarque’s All Quiet on the Western Front and Stephen Crane’s The Red Badge of Courage, as one of the best anti-war novels of all time."-- Professor Rajender Kaur, William Paterson University, New Jersey
We are excited to invite YOU to join us on our WWI Centenary Journey of Discovery into a world where fiction brings to life the story of over 1 million soldiers from Undivided India, Hindu, Muslim, Sikh and others who left their homes and families over five thousand miles away to fight for Britain with Allied forces in Europe for the first time.  Undivided India under colonial rule included present day Pakistan (1947), Bangladesh (1971) and India (1947).
Our project centres on the WWI Centenary edition of the novel Across the Black Waters by Mulk Raj Anand, which includes an Introduction by Dr Alastair Niven, friend of the author and Man Booker Prize Judge 1994 and 2014:
“It has taken nearly one hundred years for the contribution of Indian sepoys in the First World War to be properly recognised. Even today, it is less well known than it should be. Yet back in 1939 one of India’s greatest novelists, writing in English but forged by a Panjabi sensibility, described their bravery, suffering and bewilderment as they became cannon fodder in the trenches." 
The 1st small print run of the WWI Centenary edition is fast running out.  We need your help to produce a 2nd version in larger numbers, with illustrations, that will help modern readers understand the context of the history behind the story.

This is a story with huge relevance for today’s increasingly divided world.  Soldiers from very different communities and religions, including Hindus, Muslims and Sikhs, fought side by side within a shared culture for a common cause.

story:
This campaign is launching a fun way to learn the Christmas nativity story. The Nativity Scene activity kit brings together maker principles (being inventive and learning through making) and cultural learning in a single activity.

It depicts the birth of baby Jesus in a barn with Mary, Joseph and the three wise men. 

Made from Baltic birch plywood, this ready-to-paint scene comes with a sturdy base with grooved sidewalls for easy assembly. All the pieces are designed to fit together to create a 3-dimensional display. Paint and embellish the characters, animals and barn to display your artistic skills. Step-by-step instructions with detailed drawing are included in the kits.

WHO IS THIS FOR?

  • Children that are interested in art and craft activities
  • Homeschooled children
  • Parents who want to teach children the value of making things with their hands
  • Parents who are interested in teaching children about significant cultural stories
  • Grandparents looking for a meaningful gift

WHAT’S IN THE ACTIVITY KIT?

 

WHY DOES YOUR CHILD NEED THIS?

The Nativity Scene is based around a powerful cultural story that has universal recognition. Painting the scene gives your child the opportunity to add their personal expression and develop a strong association with the characters and elements.

Mass produced play scenes offer very little room for the child’s artistic expression. They usually come ready-to-assemble with pre-colored pieces or stickers.

On the other hand, entertainment activities that a child experiences are mainly digital. This does not give them the opportunity to work with tactile materials. Research has shown the act of making touchable, 3 dimensional objects with your own hands gives the child confidence and a sense of accomplishment that cannot be matched by a digital activity.

WHAT IS THE MONEY FOR?

The money raised through this campaign will go towards the purchase of a dedicated laser cutter. Right now, all the pieces are manufactured using equipment in a shared makerspace. Availability tends to be limited because of high demand forcing split production runs. This is not only inefficient but also increases quality control problems. Additionally, a dedicated laser cutter will assist in rapid prototyping and allow me to bring products to market faster.

 

TIMELINE

Week starting 24 Oct – currently producing and accepting pre-orders

Week starting 7 Nov – final packaging choices

Week starting 28 Nov – kits ready to ship

 

HELP SPREAD THE WORD

You are the key in helping change how your child learns. Spread the word to other like-minded parents, grandparents and teachers by clicking on the links below.

Instagram | Facebook | Twitter

 

FAQs

Q – What age group is this kit intended for?

A – 7+ years. Not recommended for ages below 3 years of age.

 

Q - Who are the characters in the Nativity scene?

A – There are various versions of the Nativity story. In this version the characters are Baby Jesus, Mary, Joseph, three Wise men from the East.

 

Q – What type of colors are included in this kit?

A – The colors are water based, permanent and non-toxic acrylic paint. These are made in the USA and conform to ASTMD4236 standards

 

Q – What should I do to ensure an enjoyable experience for my child when using this kit?

A – Before your child starts to paint, lay the (included) cardboard piece on the work surface. Ensure that your child is wearing the included artistic apron. Ensure access to clean cups of water to rinse brushes. Ensure access to paper napkins or a cloth rag to mop up any spills.

 

Q – How should my child paint this kit?

A – Individual styles of painting will vary with each child. However, ensuring that the engraved side surface of each wood piece is completely covered in paint is a good rule of thumb. Painting in between the lines and creases will require patience and time. Painting the base display box is optional.

 

Q – How long will it take my child to paint this kit?

A – Time to complete this kit will vary. For reference, our prototype kit was completed by an 8 year old in 4 sessions of about 20 minutes each.  Children seem to want to add more features and details to the scene as they spend more time with the activity kit.

 

Q – How is this kit assembled?

A – The kit is designed to be stored flat. All the pieces fit together for display. For a more permanent display, you can use school glue or wood glue to stick the pieces in place.

 

Q – Is there another way of completing this kit?

A – Some of our kits have been purchased for adult use and have been stained with wood stain instead of paint. 

 

Q – Do any of the pieces in this kit have sharp edges?

A – No, the pieces have smooth edges.

 

Q – What precautions do I need to take when handling the wood pieces?

A – Use common sense precautions when handling the wood pieces. The wood pieces are designed for use in this kit only and should be handled gently. The wooden pieces should not be drilled, sawed, sanded, machined or altered in any way that generates wood dust.

WARNING: Drilling, sawing, sanding or machining wood products generates wood dust and other substances known to the State of California to cause cancer. Avoid inhaling dust generated from wood products or use a dust mask or other safeguards to avoid inhaling dust generated from wood products. Wood products emit chemicals known to the State of California to cause birth defects or other reproductive harm.

 

Q – What type of wood is used in this kit?

A – All the pieces are cut from Baltic birch plywood of 3 mm thickness.

 

Q – Why are there burn marks on some of my pieces?

A – A laser cutter is used to engrave and cut the pieces. Laser cutters work by directing a very powerful laser beam on the wood to cut and engrave. Depending of the closeness of the line designs the laser beam may come in close proximity to the edge of the wooden piece generating a burn mark. This mark will not show once you paint or stain the wood.

 

Q – What is that campfire like smell that I get when I open the box?

A – The laser cutter used to cut the wood pieces generates heat; that’s where the burnt wood smell comes from.

 

Q – What is the size of the completed scene?

A – The approximate size of the assembled kit is 14 x 4 x 14 inches.

 

Q - When will I receive my kit?

A – We intend to start shipping out the first kits in the week starting 14 November 2016. All kits will be dispatched via USPS Priority Mail 2 Day service.

 

Q - Where is this kit manufactured?

A – All the key components of this kit have been hand manufactured in California. Where ever possible, art supplies and packaging materials have been sourced from local small businesses.

 

Q - Do you offer gift wrapping for this kit?

A – No, we do not offer gift wrapping at this time.

 

Q - What if I have other questions?

A – You can send an email to zef@baniyan.com or use 'Ask a question' if you have any other questions.

story:
Who am I?

Hello! I'm Chris Wheeler Ayala, and I'm planning to travel to Korea this summer to join Yonsei University's Summer Abroad program through UCEAP.

I am Mexican American and both through travel and ultimately moving to the United States in 2011, have experienced the culture and day to day life of both of Mexico and the United States from a very young age.

Traveling to Korea would be a dream come true due to a great interest that first started with discovering the pop culture elements of Korean life such as k-pop, dramas, beauty, and of course, Korean food and BBQ! It has been quite a while since then and have developed more reasons and interest beyond that. I have taught myself the Korean Hangul alphabet and am continuously building on my vocabulary, and there is so much more that I'd like to learn, and what better way of doing that than by being in Korea?

I am looking forward to all the adventure that awaits me there - and hoping to see beautiful art and architecture to add to my Art History knowledge!

As a student that depends on Financial Aid to fund my studies, I had thought that studying/traveling abroad was out of my reach. Now, thanks to the UCEAP program and your help I can make this dream come true! I can travel again, and earn credits while I do it! I will be staying in dorms from the 

How you can help & what you get in exchange!

Thank you so much for your consideration!

  • I have been accepted to join Yonsei University for their Summer Program, the cost of it includes, but is not limited to: (as stated on the UCEAP site)
    • UCEAP Fees - $4,450
    • Additional Fees (room/board, supplies, etc) - $3,800
  • I am strongly considering the possibility of extending my stay abroad, if I do, the costs for the Fall Semester would be:
    • UCEAP Fees - $7,000
    • Additional Fees - $6,650

I have applied for scholarships and am counting on FAFSA on providing some Financial Aid, as well as setting up a Depop shop to help fund this big leap, but to this moment have not received much news regarding how much money I can count on. When I receive information regarding this I shall update you guys!

  • The rewards I'm offering in exchange for your support will help me share parts of my experience in Korea with you! They range from:
    • Pictures from my time abroad sent directly to your email
    • postcards, handwritten letters, and personalized emails
    • Souvenirs
    • Mystery Makeup and Skincare products for those interested in              K-Beauty!
    • ... and more to be potentially added!

It would mean the world to me if you contribute to my campaign because you would be directly funding an experience that I had thought to be impossible and had almost given up on that I have been dreaming of for so long. I will use the money received from this campaign wisely and along with financial aid and my savings I accumulate before my departure.

I will be as prompt with distributing the rewards as I am allowed to, time permitting!

I want to share the experience with you as I'm living it and as simultaneously as possible.

Other Ways You Can Help!

If you are not able to donate, I understand! You can still help out by spreading the word and sharing this campaign with your friends and family or the social media of your choice! I would really appreciate it!

(And if you donated and still share this, that would be doubly appreciated!)

Thank you so much for your help!

Yonsei University

- Chris

Who am I?
Hello! I'm Chris Wheeler Ayala, and I'm planning to travel to Korea this summer to join Yonsei University's Summer Abroad program through UCEAP.
I am Mexican American and both through travel and ultimately moving to the United States in 2011, have experienced the culture and day to day life of both of Mexico and the United States from a very young age.
Traveling to Korea would be a dream come true due to a great interest that first started with discovering the pop culture elements of Korean life such as k-pop, dramas, beauty, and of course, Korean food and BBQ! story:
Our Mission and Cause

With fifty-nine percent of the country living in poverty Bolivia stands as one of the poorest countries in Latin America. For the majority of Bolivians, living in such dire conditions restricts their access to educational resources, and in turn has led to low literacy rates through out the country.

Since we began establishing libraries in rural regions of Bolivia - the areas where education is most limited - we have seen an increase in literacy rates by 27%! In addition, high school graduation rates have lifted by 2% in areas where BiblioWorks has opened a library. Such outstanding improvements provide us with proof that we are succeeding at changing the face of literacy in rural regions of Bolivia!

However, although we have done fantastic work over the years, there is still room to improve. This year we want to focus our efforts on updating and improving our first library ever built: La Biblioteca Villa Zamora in Morado K'asa.

Situated in the region of Tarabuco, our library in Morado K'asa has increased literacy rates by 22% since it was first opened it in 2005. While we are proud of its success, we also see areas where extra help could lead to further achievements! La Biblioteca Villa Zamora currently has a limited amount of basic resources such as children's books and educational materials that make promoting literacy very challenging. As the majority of children and families rely on the library in Morado K'asa as their sole provider for literacy tools and resources, it is our goal to ensure that they have access to the most updated and efficient library possible. So help us enable them to become successful learners and readers by making improvements on our library!

Who You Are Helping

  • Children and families living in Morado K'asa who otherwise would have little to no access to literacy tools and resources! 

    What We Need 

    • Books! We want each of our library users to enjoy many different kinds of books in their discovery of reading. Our library in Morado K'asa is especially in need of children's books! A $10 donation covers the cost of two books for children to read and enjoy for years to come.
    • Games! Whether it be a board game or trivia cards, we have found that the key to engaging young children in learning is by having fun! A $25 donation covers the cost of two reading games to make reading an enjoyable habit.
    • Educational materials! To carry out innovative literacy activities to make reading an enjoyable habit. Such materials include: writing utensils, white boards, posters, and more! A $50 donation covers the cost of learning materials for ten children.
    • A rug and pillows where the children can sit comfortably and read or listen to stories. Last year BiblioWorks set up reading corners in many of our libraries to provide children with special spots to read. Let's create a reading corner for our community in Morado K'asa! A $100 donation covers the cost of a rug or pillows for 20 children.

    The Impact

    Your contribution will have a long-lasting impact by:

    • Improving access to literacy and reading in Morado K'asa.
    • Opening new doors for children through literacy and reading.
    • Overcoming the problem of students not having more updated books or educational materials, which limits their ability to work on their studies or continue their education outside of the classroom.
    • Helping our first library reach its goal of 100% self-sustainability by 2018! 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Even if you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help!

    • Contact volunteer@biblioworks.org to find out about volunteering opportunities in Bolivia!
    • You can spread the word about this campaign, and about BiblioWorks and the great work we are doing in Bolivia by using Generosity's sharing tools! Follow us on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter, and share the campaign amongst your followers too!  
    • Check out our website to find out more about the amazing work we have accomplished in Morado K'asa as well as our twelve other libraries!    

    Our Background

    Since 2005, BiblioWorks has been opening libraries in Bolivia, one of the most impoverished areas of South America. Our thirteen libraries bring reading, literacy, and enhanced life opportunities to rural communities, with a positive impact on thousands of children and families. With each new project BiblioWorks strives to embody its main belief, that where there is access to education and knowledge, there is opportunity for cultural, economic and social growth. Keeping this principle in mind, we have found that continual maintenance on our libraries is necessary in order to assure that our libraries are functioning at their maximum potential. We are confident that by making the necessary improvements on our library in Morado K'asa, we will enable it to become fully self-sustainable in the near future while empowering its users with the tool of literacy! 

    BiblioWorks is a 501(c)(3) non-profit based in the US dedicated to promoting education and literacy in communities in need.  We are not a religious or political organization.

    So... are you ready to make change possible?

story:
Hi! My name is Shirley Bond and I've been a flight attendant for almost thirty years. I'm also a semi-professional photographer and have always enjoyed writing poetry. I decided to put my three passions together and write a children's book to educate children and parents about traveling and safety onboard an airplane.  I took my own pictures to make it more realistic for kids to imagine what they will see up in the air and on their travels.  

In the book, Bananas prepares children for their travel journey with tips about passports, packing, going through security and finally boarding an airplane. While onboard, he teaches them about everything from buckling up, to what they can expect when they flush the toilet up in the air :) 

Along with reading and learning from the book, kids will be able to join Bananas' Club where there will be fun videos of Bananas' travels to watch, his very own song the kids will be able to sing along to, and so much more. Kids will also be invited to share photos from their own trips with Bananas and leave him messages. This is the first interactive travel & safety book of its kind anywhere in the world and I'm so proud to share it with you. 

Why This Is So Important to Me

Over the years as a flight attendant, I've seen it all -- nervous flyers, stressed parents, children being afraid to use the bathroom and so much more -- I could write a book just on that :) I want families to come onboard and feel safe and reassured, so there is no fear at all in their travel experiences. Up in the air, we become one family because we are all we have. I want my family to know everything they need to do to feel prepared before they go on a trip. I put together all the things I feel are important, like 20 great tips for parents, a safety demo with Bananas, and some other fun surprises that are in the works.

I also love children and music, so I co-wrote a song about my book called "Up In The Air With Bananas" -- the kids are going to love it! Come take this journey with us -- we can't wait to share it with you.

What We Need & What You Get

Goal - $16,000 CAN

Breakdown of funds needed:

  • Publishing Costs
  • Hard & Soft cover books (first shipment of 1000 books)
  • Website
  • Production & studio time for song 
  • First shipment of "Bananas", knapsacks, luggage tags, charms and pictures

​If we don't reach our goal, I will get a half-shipment of books and it will be in book stores 'Print on Demand'. If we can surpass our goal, I will be translating books into French, Spanish, Italian, German, Japanese, Mandarin and more - we definitely have a global market! Additional funds will also help with my next book "Bananas On Cloud 9" -- where Bananas & I share our experiences with you as we travel the world, and give you lots of traveling tips along the way.

Rewards!

  • First Edition hard & soft cover copies of  "Up In The Air With Bananas- A Guide To Traveling" Book!
  • ​"Bananas" your child's new best friend!
  • Knapsacks & Luggage Tags
  • 5X7 Pictures of Bananas
  • Airplane Charms
  • A website for the kids to join "Bananas Club "and share their travel photos, send messages and more
  • One hour of fun at your child's school or function (airfare  & hotel not included)

  • Most importantly seeing all the smiling kids with Bananas and my book -- feeling great about going on an airplane ride! :)  

The Impact

I feel the impact of my book will be incredible, as this is the first book like it anywhere in the world. That means the sky's the limit! I want this book to go international, to help every child and parent out there, so there will be no more fear in traveling and families will enjoy flying as much as I do.  

Risks & Challenges

As with any publishing project, issues can arise that delay the release. I've tried to manage this by finding an editor and publisher already, and creating a mock-up of the book. My priority is creating a high quality book & "Bananas" so I won't release them until they are as good as they can be.  My focus during the campaign will be finalizing the book & ensuring that "Bananas" and the knapsacks will be ready to go when the campaign is over.

Children's Christmas Gift

If you would like to give your reward as a Christmas gift, there will be a gift certificate with a picture of the book & "Bananas" sent to your email address for you to print and give to the children. They get so many presents during Christmas, that it will be a nice surprise when they receive it in the middle of winter -- something for them to look forward to :) 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to make a financial contribution, don't worry -  that doesn't mean you can't help me. I would really appreciate it if you could spread the word about my campaign to all your family and friends -- it's simple using the Indiegogo share tools!  If you like the idea, please leave a comment here and JUST SHARE SHARE SHARE! :)

This is a mock up of what my book will look like :) The book will be ready soon! I can't wait for you all to have it.

Thank you all for your support - it truly means the world to me! :)

story:
Summary

Help us bring the voices of LGBT+ champions into the American civil rights curriculum for middle school and high school classrooms everywhere! 

When Eric Marcus created his award-winning book, Making History (1992) and its follow-up, Making Gay History (2002), he created a precious audio archive of the voices of 100 LGBT activists and champions, spanning the 1940s - 1990s. Fortunately, what Eric captured is a record of the sacrifices and championship for one of the greatest American civil rights movements. 

Now, Eric Marcus and Sara Burningham have begun the production of "Making Gay History: The Podcast," with History UnErased as its education partner. As a team, we are launching the Give Voice to History project - an LGBT+ academic content series for middle schools and high schools. The series will be freakin' amazing (details below) and FREE for all teachers and students. Everywhere. 

California, Massachusetts and New York Public Schools are clamoring for this content NOW - and you can help us deliver. Schools are ready. Teachers are ready. Students are ready. The time is NOW. 

What We Need

The Arcus Foundation has granted $45,000 to support the first 10 voices of "Making Gay History: The Podcast." We need your donation to make sure that these voices are heard in middle school and high school classrooms. Each "voice" needs:

  • video styling and animation
  • leading-edge content development
  • interactive, online platform
  • gamification
  • never seen (or heard) before primary and secondary sources
  • complementing visual history exhibit
  • interactive assessments
  • extension lessons
  • adaptations to meet the needs of ALL students
  • and more!

The GIVE VOICE TO HISTORY LGBT+ academic content series will be online, FREE and AWESOME!

The more funds we raise, the more voices of champions we can deliver to classrooms across the nation!

What You Get

The perks are unique, fun and HISTORIC! You could receive autographed copies of two bodies of work that pronounce how personal narratives add to the historical record of the struggles and triumphs of the LGBT+ movement. 

  • "Making Gay History: The Half Century Fight for Lesbian and Gay Equal Rights" (2002) by Eric Marcus unerases the voices and stories of LGBT+ champions from the 1940s to 1990s. Eric's audio archive of these stories is the compass for the Give Voice to History Project LGBT+ Academic Content Series. 
  • "Gays in the Military: Photographs and Interviews" (2014) by Vincent Cianni captures the voices and images of men and women who served in silence: pre, during and post "Don't Ask, Don't Tell." Vincent interviewed Deb Fowler (co-founder of History UnErased) in 2013 and her story is included in "Gays in the Military." 

Including LGBT+ history in K-12 classrooms is an idea that can be frightening and mysterious. Most people have never had the opportunity to engage with LGBT+ topics through an academic lens, so introducing this content with personal stories from Eric’s audio archive has the power to dispel myths and misperceptions and shape a richer, more honest historical narrative. This is why the GIVE VOICE TO HISTORY project is so critically important.

“People’s stories change the listener’s frame, their lens, makes them much more open – so when students are engaging with all the accompanying materials, they are tuned in.”

The Impact

Your donation to the GIVE VOICE TO HISTORY project will help unerase LGBT+ history and, quite literally, save lives. Study after study proves that LGBT+ inclusive content in K-12 schools mitigates homelessness, suicidality, substance abuse and dropout rates for LGBT+ youth. The development of the GIVE VOICE TO HISTORY academic content series will reach millions of students across the nation. But only if we raise the funds to make it happen.

HUE is a licensed professional development provider with the MA Department of Education and works closely with national organizations, including the Library of Congress, National Park Service, Smithsonian Institution and ONE Archives Foundation at USC Libraries.

Imagine how different your school experience would have been if you and your classmates had been taught this history.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate to GIVE VOICE TO HISTORY don’t despair. Share!

 

Debra Fowler's story is included in Vincent Cianni's work, and the experience of sharing her story with Vince (for the first time - truthfully) significantly contributed to her decision to leave the classroom and co-found History UnErased. "A nation begins in the classroom, and I now understand that I have had the privilege of serving my country as a boots-on-the-ground, in-the-trenches classroom teacher."

The inclusion of LGBT+ history in K-12 classrooms can be captured in the words of Robert Gates on the repeal of Don't Ask, Don't Tell, "This will not be the wrenching, traumatic change that people expect."

What You Get
The perks are unique, fun and HISTORIC! You could receive autographed copies of two bodies of work that pronounce how personal narratives add to the historical record of the struggles and triumphs of the LGBT+ movement. 

"Making Gay History: The Half Century Fight for Lesbian and Gay Equal Rights" (2002) by Eric Marcus unerases the voices and stories of LGBT+ champions from the 1940s to 1990s. Eric's audio archive of these stories is the compass for the Give Voice to History Project LGBT+ Academic Content Series. 
"Gays in the Military: Photographs and Interviews" (2014) by Vincent Cianni captures the voices and images of men and women who served in silence: pre, during and post "Don't Ask, Don't Tell." Vincent interviewed Deb Fowler (co-founder of History UnErased) in 2013 and her story is included in "Gays in the Military." 

Including LGBT+ history in K-12 classrooms is an idea that can be frightening and mysterious. Most people have never had the opportunity to engage with LGBT+ topics through an academic lens, so introducing this content with personal stories from Eric’s audio archive has the power to dispel myths and misperceptions and shape a richer, more honest historical narrative. This is why the GIVE VOICE TO HISTORY project is so critically important.
“People’s stories change the listener’s frame, their lens, makes them much more open – so when students are engaging with all the accompanying materials, they are tuned in.”

The Impact
Your donation to the GIVE VOICE TO HISTORY project will help unerase LGBT+ history and, quite literally, save lives. Study after study proves that LGBT+ inclusive content in K-12 schools mitigates homelessness, suicidality, substance abuse and dropout rates for LGBT+ youth. The development of the GIVE VOICE TO HISTORY academic content series will reach millions of students across the nation. But only if we raise the funds to make it happen.
HUE is a licensed professional development provider with the MA Department of Education and works closely with national organizations, including the Library of Congress, National Park Service, Smithsonian Institution and ONE Archives Foundation at USC Libraries.
Imagine how different your school experience would have been if you and your classmates had been taught this history.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you are unable to donate to GIVE VOICE TO HISTORY don’t despair. Share!
 
Debra Fowler's story is included in Vincent Cianni's work, and the experience of sharing her story with Vince (for the first time - truthfully) significantly contributed to her decision to leave the classroom and co-found History UnErased. "A nation begins in the classroom, and I now understand that I have had the privilege of serving my country as a boots-on-the-ground, in-the-trenches classroom teacher."
The inclusion of LGBT+ history in K-12 classrooms can be captured in the words of Robert Gates on the repeal of Don't Ask, Don't Tell, "This will not be the wrenching, traumatic change that people expect."

story:
Innovation Team Pro Basketball Team

This is a vision to provide positive entertainment through the journey of basketball. 

  • We have pro and semi pro players looking to beat the NBA stars.
  • This campaign is important to provide positive entertainment to audiences everywhere. This team is full of individuals who have stories that people can connect with.
  • Your contributions give us the opportunity to pursue our goals and at the same time allows your business the opportunities to be seen nationally with NBA athletes.  
  • You can follow our team by looking for our video series online and know you contributed to our success.


Our Needs/What you receive


  • Your contributions would allow these players the opportunity to do what they love and inspire others to do the same. The funds allow our players to compete against the top players in United States and also travel internationally to showcase their talents.
The perks for contributors include:

  • Post/s about your business on social media

  • Thank you cards and E-Thank you cards
  • Hand out your marketing material or business cards at tournaments  
  • Inclusion in online video series 
  • Product placement or mention in interviews with athletes
  • Other perks can be customized upon contact via email or phone
  • If we do not reach our goal the funds would go towards travel expenses and stipends for our players.

The Impact

  • This is our second season and in the past we have provided value for all parties involved. We provide family friendly entertainment and inspiration through our team. 

Risks & Challenges

  • Travel expenses are a challenge and the funding can help us cover those costs. We also want to pay players a stipend for their hard work.

  • We are trying to build upon our previous work.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can not contribute financially:

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.

  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
The luminous glass-holders not only illuminate and make the area more beautiful but also advertise different organizations. 

The new generation improves its surrounding making different things multi functional (comfortable, giving esthetic pleasure, profitable). We want to change all the old holders with the one of the new generation luminous holders. We need 10000 $ financial support to start the huge production. We will give an order to the organizations which produce plastic to produce containers with the specific size and form. 
Then we will buy a big quantity of 1 w power LED lights

and high capacity elements of 3v voltage. 

We will make the glass-holders with these components.

Once the glass-holders be ready, we will contact the leading organizations of the world so that to produce the glass-holders with their advertising. 

If the necessary sum not be gathered, we will start a small production for the small market until we be able to enter international market and the luminous glass-holder will also be accessible to you. The glass-holders cannot only be available at pubs, bars and other places of entertainment but also to be a part of table decoration of family parties and romantic evenings.

In the case of individual orders our glass-holders can match the preferences of the people who order them.

story:
A NEW APPROACH TO EDUCATION

We are opening a new school that aims to redefine learning for Louisville students. Stonecote Sudbury School is based on the educational model of the Sudbury Valley School, founded in 1968 in Framingham, Massachusetts. The fundamental difference between learning at Stonecote and being taught at traditional schools is the level of responsibility students have in their own education. The school will be led by a participatory democracy, the School Meeting, consisting of all enrolled students and staff members. The curriculum is student-led, following the philosophy that motivation follows interest. Stonecote will be the first school in Louisville to follow the Sudbury model of education. The facility is located on a landmark estate at 1005 Alta Vista Road in the heart of Louisville.

Our Founders have been working diligently to open Stonecote this fall. We have received tremendous support from the community, including the pro bono work of a local real estate attorney, tax attorney, film-maker, photographer, and a leading financial consultant. Now we are asking for the help of family, friends, parents, students, anyone who has ever been involved in Sudbury education, and anyone who supports educational freedom for children. Your donation will help build the foundation of this new school.

WHAT MAKES STONECOTE SUDBURY SCHOOL DIFFERENT?

Stonecote Sudbury School’s instructional philosophy is largely based on the Sudbury model of education. The fundamental premises, as defined by Sudbury Valley’s publication Kingdom of Childhood, are as follows: 

  • “that all people are curious by nature; 
  • that the most efficient, long lasting, and profound learning takes place when started and pursued by the learner; 
  • that all people are creative if they are allowed to develop their unique talents; 
  • that age-mixing among students promotes growth in all members of the group;
  • and that freedom is essential to the development of personal responsibility.”

Stonecote Sudbury School is led by the School Meeting; a participatory democracy consisting of all enrolled students and staff members. Each School Meeting member has an equal vote on all concerns. The School Meeting occurs weekly and is responsible for all areas of school governance, e.g., instituting school rules, hiring requisite staff, determining annual budget, maintaining the school building and grounds, and establishing Clerkships, Committees, and School Corporations.

At Stonecote, we begin with the assertion that learning arises from within the student. Passionate interest ignites intrinsic motivation, leading a student to pursue activities, knowledge, skill, and achievements based solely on personal interest and initiative, rather than on the external motivation of earning a reward or avoiding a punishment. The byproducts of such focused pursuits are habits of ingenuity, passion, persistence, and confidence.

Because Stonecote is governed by the School Meeting, a broad range of students and staff is essential to life within the school.  The more diversity present in the members of School Meeting, the richer the discussions surrounding each topic of debate. A participatory democracy thrives on a variety of voices and opinions. The School needs all kinds of students and staff members to give voice to the diverse needs of the school community, and the community outside the school as well.

The curriculum and instruction at Stonecote Sudbury School are also enriched by an increase in student and staff diversity. Students create their own day and follow their interests toward their desired outcomes. A more diverse student population will increase the potential for student exposure to a broad range of interests.

The School’s chosen curriculum, rather than being a tiny subset of skills and knowledge, is divergent, open-ended, and as infinite in variety as the students are. Through observation and experimentation, students test a variety of ideas and behaviors to discover what works and what doesn’t work for them. Adults and other students provide vital examples and possibilities, offer organic feedback as friends and equals, and allow for opportunities to consolidate growth through sharing information, conversation, and experience.

The main goal for the students is to gather the skills they need to become successful adults. These skills are naturally learned through play, self-selected study, conversation, and practical experience in a participatory democracy.

A secondary goal for the students is to become empowered by the School’s structure, governance, and culture. Students are free to pursue self-chosen challenges and opportunities; and through their experiences, they develop new competence and become increasingly self-reliant within a community of support.

WHAT WE NEED:

Our goal of $95,000 will help provide the following:

  • Financial aid for families in need
  • Necessary technology and equipment for the students 
  • Modifications to the property pursuant to code to effectively change the use of the building from residential to educational 
  • A reserve fund for the school's debt service, unforeseen repairs, and operating expenses 
  • Redesigning learning spaces according to student interest and Stonecote's unique approach to educational freedom and responsibility
  • The guarantee that a Stonecote education becomes a reality for the children of Louisville, surrounding counties, and Southern Indiana.

OUR WAY OF SAYING "THANKS!"

When you contribute to Stonecote Sudbury School, you become part of an education revolution. We are a non-profit entity, qualified as an Internal Revenue Code Section 503c3 charitable organization. Upon campaign completion, you will receive a receipt for your tax exempt donation amount.

THE STONECOTE GIVING TREE


We have local artisans in our Founders group who are creating The Stonecote Giving Tree, a monument to our fantastic donors. Made of hand-crafted wooden pieces, each featuring the name of a donor, our tree will be a prominent, artistic focal-point in the main room of Stonecote Sudbury School.

 Each perk level corresponds with an embellishment on the Tree: from having your name on a shared branch of the tree, to a leaf or a blossom; from a delightful butterfly or dragonfly, to a beautiful bird, or an adorable woodland creature. Details on exact donation levels are in the full list of Perks. Check it out to find the Perk that works for you! 

We created the $2016 Perk level to honor our Founding Year. Although the original idea of opening a Sudbury model school in the Louisville/Southern Indiana region began years ago with a couple of our Founders sitting in their kitchen over a cup of coffee, discussing the possibility of a better educational option for their kids, the reality of Stonecote made its debut in the final days of 2015. 


Since January 1, 2016, the Founders have:
  • researched the property to ensure that it meets or exceeds the needs of the school and its students
  • been doing our due diligence to comply with all applicable codes (Fire code, ADA requirements, zoning, building use, planning and design, etc.)
  • filed Articles of Incorporation with the Commonwealth of Kentucky
  • submitted the 501c3 application to the IRS in order to obtain tax-exempt status
  • completed an extensive business plan  as part of our Lender Presentation to illustrate that our model can sufficiently support the project financing
  • created our website
  • held routine Information Meetings to introduce the Sudbury model to families in the community, and to build excitement about our new school
  • negotiated a purchase agreement for Stonecote Estate and announced our expected opening date of September 6, 2016!!
If you want to honor our inaugural year, 2016, a $2,016 gift is the perk level for you! To thank you for your gift, our artists will create a Giving Tree decoration of your choosing! Your name will be emblazoned on your design, and our heartfelt thanks go out to you.

To complement The Stonecote Giving Tree, we will have a page on our website, which will serve as our digital donor tree. To all donors who wish to remain anonymous, your wish will be respected with gratitude. 

Beyond The Giving Tree

For a gift of $5,000, you will be honored by having a room named by you for a period of five years. In order to meet the needs of the students, each room within Stonecote Estate will have redesigned elements. Your gift will make those improvements possible, and the room will bear your name, or the name of a person of your choice, as a monumental Thank You!

At the $10,200 level, your contribution will help a student attend Stonecote Sudbury School who otherwise couldn't. This amount is equivalent to one year's tuition at Stonecote. Donors at this level will receive our tremendous thanks, and will have a scholarship fund named in their honor, or in honor of a person of their choice. 


To all of our supporters, You are helping bring this school into reality! You are creating educational freedom for students in Louisville and beyond, and you have our thanks!


THE IMPACT OF A STONECOTE EDUCATION

Children across the country are giving indicators that their needs are not being met within the world of traditional education. These indicators are becoming more and more pronounced each year. They are evidenced by the dramatic increase in childhood mental health diagnosis. To follow are some staggering statistics as cited in the film, “Schooling the World.” 

  • 16,000,000 U.S. Children suffer from depression and other emotional problems
  • 1,600,000 are currently on 2 or more psychiatric drugs
  • 69,000 girls between 13 and 19 regularly cut themselves
  • 120,000 children have tried to kill themselves in the past 12 months

Additionally, there are many other children who may be thriving academically by common societal measures, but who are exhibiting less obvious, though no less damaging, consequences of a traditional education, e.g., disinterest in learning; general disengagement; loss of wonder; loss of creativity and critical thinking skills; extreme fear of making mistakes; and loss of self. In analysis of conventional education and its present trends, these are profound indicators that signal, culturally, society’s readiness for a change.

The needs and opportunities for learning have changed immensely since the onset of standardized education in the Industrial Age. Critical thinking, creativity, self-initiative, collaboration, effective communication, and technological literacy are absolute necessities in today's world. The adverse effects of our outdated model of education are presenting themselves in greater intensity each day, and educational professionals and psychologists are researching and writing about these issues and what can be done to solve them in abundance. 

The solution Stonecote Sudbury School is offering is to be an educational environment where students are not forced into the box of traditional education, but are free to explore their world and to discover their unique interests, talents, and needs, as well as how to utilize those traits to be successful as adults.

According to extensive studies of Sudbury graduates, alumni excel in customary measures of success; 87% of graduates go on to college, and an astounding 42% are involved in entrepreneurial pursuits. But most importantly, graduates indicate that they see themselves as confident and adept members of society, capable of defining meaningful goals for their lives and finding ways to achieve them.

ADDITIONAL WAYS YOU CAN HELP

  • Share this campaign with family, friends, acquaintances, strangers on the street, anyone at all who is interested in an alternative approach to education. This is not only for children of Louisville, but to help spread educational freedom for children everywhere! Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread this campaign, or share this link:  www.StonecoteSudbury.org. 
  • We are on Facebook and Instagram. Like us. Follow us. Invite your friends to join us too.
  • If you want to be added to our email list, sign up here, and we will send you updates on our progress. Invite your friends to sign up too!

THANK YOU!

A huge "Thank You!" to Louis Bowman for creating our wonderful campaign video, and endless thanks to Hudson Valley Sudbury School for use of your introductory videos.
We can do exponentially more when we come together!
