story:
Created Out of Necessity

The story of VIBE is simple.  Brick Reilly and Jamie Gillem started doing tree work together and were immediately presented with a communication problem.  Brick was born deaf.  He is fitted with a cochlear implant but because the risk of damaging it is so great while working, he takes it off.  His inability to hear doesn't affect his ability to get the job done but it significantly hinders communication.  If anyone needs to get his attention for any reason, they need to wait till he looks at them.  This inability to gain his attention is what brought VIBE to life. 
 
VIBE allows anyone to signal him  when he is needed and has increased his ability to be available, whether it's to send something up into the tree or to say watch out below.
Although he is deaf, the story is no different for those who are not and work in environments where they can't hear due to loud noise.
Vibe increases safety by improving communication on any job-site where there is the inability to hear for any reason.


Availability Is Key


Availability is key!  If you're not available than you are at risk because you're not communicating with those around you.



What Is VIBE

VIBE breaks through the loud environment of a job-site by using a vibration to get a person’s attention.  VIBE is a wireless, compact, and completely self-contained unit which requires no external equipment to make it function.  The entire VIBE unit fits comfortably in or on your hard-hat or helmet, keeping it hidden and out of the way.
 

Whether you are using loud equipment, working out of a bucket, running a machine, or working in any indoor or outdoor situation, VIBE gets the immediate attention of your crew allowing them to stop what they are doing and make eye contact, creating a more relaxed work environment. 

VIBE takes into account all of the rigors and potential hazards caused by ineffective communication.

With VIBE there is no longer a need for ineffective yelling, wild hand motions or dangerous situations caused by trying to get your worker’s attention. 


Where We Are Now
VIBE has been in use by us and the crew for two years and has proven to be invaluable in our daily work.  Beta testing has started and the response from our testers has been more than encouraging.  
We have come a long way and have gone through some easy times and rough times but all good times.  
We have our patent, three generations of prototypes, beta tests in place and significant contacts but we still have a long way to go and with your help we can see our units provide a safer and more stress free work environment for anyone who can benefit from better communication.


Our Needs
Since our first prototype was created we have, for the most part, funded VIBE ourselves .  We have also received help from generous friends and family to meet some of our financial needs.  The costs associated with establishing a new product is substantial and we sincerely appreciate any help you can give.
Some of the substantial costs are:
FCC filing and testing, Products Liability, Trademarks, Marketing, Packaging, Engineering, Website design, Manufacturing.
The dollar amount we are requesting will be able to take care of all these costs and allow us to bring VIBE to market.
If you are unable to financially support us we completely understand and request that you send our link to as many people as you can think of and get the word out about VIBE.
Check out our Perks to receive cool stuff or just hit the "Back It" button if you would like to contribute without receiving anything in return.  We appreciate your help in giving us a spring forward with your financial support.


Thanks to all those who have been a part of this in one way or another:

Mike and Anne Reilly, Dave Salgueiro, Matt Magnifico, Peter Nevill (View Higher Pictures), John Walker, Ryan Keenan, Jeff Cort, Ernie Petti, Rory MacInnis and his crew, Tom Macone, Tim Gibson, Steve Wolosin
story_txt:
Created Out of Necessity






The story of VIBE is simple.  Brick Reilly and Jamie Gillem started doing tree work together and were immediately presented with a communication problem.  Brick was born deaf.  He is fitted with a cochlear implant but because the risk of damaging it is so great while working, he takes it off.  His inability to hear doesn't affect his ability to get the job done but it significantly hinders communication.  If anyone needs to get his attention for any reason, they need to wait till he looks at them.  This inability to gain his attention is what brought VIBE to life. 

 

VIBE allows anyone to signal him  when he is needed and has increased his ability to be available, whether it's to send something up into the tree or to say watch out below.
Although he is deaf, the story is no different for those who are not and work in environments where they can't hear due to loud noise.
Vibe increases safety by improving communication on any job-site where there is the inability to hear for any reason.


Availability Is Key



Availability is key!  If you're not available than you are at risk because you're not communicating with those around you.



What Is VIBE

VIBE breaks through the loud environment of a job-site by using a vibration to get a person’s attention.  VIBE is a wireless, compact, and completely self-contained unit which requires no external equipment to make it function.  The entire VIBE unit fits comfortably in or on your hard-hat or helmet, keeping it hidden and out of the way.

 Whether you are using loud equipment, working out of a bucket, running a machine, or working in any indoor or outdoor situation, VIBE gets the immediate attention of your crew allowing them to stop what they are doing and make eye contact, creating a more relaxed work environment. 

VIBE takes into account all of the rigors and potential hazards caused by ineffective communication.


With VIBE there is no longer a need for ineffective yelling, wild hand motions or dangerous situations caused by trying to get your worker’s attention. 



Where We Are Now

VIBE has been in use by us and the crew for two years and has proven to be invaluable in our daily work.  Beta testing has started and the response from our testers has been more than encouraging.  

We have come a long way and have gone through some easy times and rough times but all good times.  
We have our patent, three generations of prototypes, beta tests in place and significant contacts but we still have a long way to go and with your help we can see our units provide a safer and more stress free work environment for anyone who can benefit from better communication.


Our Needs

Since our first prototype was created we have, for the most part, funded VIBE ourselves .  We have also received help from generous friends and family to meet some of our financial needs.  The costs associated with establishing a new product is substantial and we sincerely appreciate any help you can give.
Some of the substantial costs are:
FCC filing and testing, Products Liability, Trademarks, Marketing, Packaging, Engineering, Website design, Manufacturing.
The dollar amount we are requesting will be able to take care of all these costs and allow us to bring VIBE to market.
If you are unable to financially support us we completely understand and request that you send our link to as many people as you can think of and get the word out about VIBE.Check out our Perks to receive cool stuff or just hit the "Back It" button if you would like to contribute without receiving anything in return.  We appreciate your help in giving us a spring forward with your financial support.Thanks to all those who have been a part of this in one way or another:Mike and Anne Reilly, Dave Salgueiro, Matt Magnifico, Peter Nevill (View Higher Pictures), John Walker, Ryan Keenan, Jeff Cort, Ernie Petti, Rory MacInnis and his crew, Tom Macone, Tim Gibson, Steve Wolosin

story:
Hello, I am happy to greet you with this idea to engage & explore ways to think through & build 3-dimensional spatial (mind, body & spirit) solutions to any conceptual problem; whether you are the parent of a young child; a working person; or a new grandparent (as i am: that's grandson Charlie, above) this 3D puzzle activity will add confidence and joy to your efforts to strengthen your analytical creative decision making process for years to come.

Two of the most influential books I read when I was a very young man were Hopscotch and 62: A Model Kit, by Julio Cortazar. As one of the main characters, the intellectual Juan, puts it: to one person the City might appear as Paris, to another it might be where one goes upon getting out of bed in Barcelona; to another it might appear as a beer hall in Oslo. This cityscape, as Carlos Fuentes describes it, "seems drawn up by the Marx Brothers with an assist from Bela Lugosi!" This book is magic, magic, magic; on every page, in every line, shot through every twistedly long and nearly un-parse-able sentence. One day I will meet someone who loves it as much as I do and we will read it back and forth, bit by bit, over and over every day for the rest our lives. I hope that one day I will be able to share this with Charlie (after we read Goodnight Moon, Curious George & Babar.

This campaign is intended to provide you with a simple and precisely proportional set of building blocks made with a variety of sustainable woods. Whether you are young or old, you will learn something about order & memory of place, mathematics and the sustainable environment; whether it is taking something apart or putting it back together again.


What We Need & What You Get

I am seeking initial funding of $25,000 to develop and make (by hand) up to 100 sets of Golden Section Building Blocks in a variety of sustainable woods in Boxed Sets. The first prototypical set cost ±$200 in materials and provided many hours of thoughtful labor (a labor of love for my first grandchild, certainly.   In exchange for your support, I have conceived a number of perks (or, recognition rewards) for you to consider in your decision to contribute to & join this project in order to advance learning techniques and activities that are beneficial & timeless. 


The Impact

I would like to reach my prototype funding goal so that i may find a way to lower the hand-made labor & materials costs and then take the next steps to provide these block sets to children in early education elementary schools and senior citizen centers on a non-profit basis. If I am able to reach this first phase goal, then I would be able to advance to my second phase goal by providing sets of Golden Section Building Blocks where they are needed most.

Your contribution now will help us get over the very large start-up hurdle; and give greater exposure to implementing healthy mind, body and spirit projects for those who wish to be among the young at heart.


Risks & Challenges

I am always willing to take on the risk of working on projects that have the potential to propose design ideas that will engage and spread awareness of social issues that may lead to creative and mutually beneficial outcomes. I am well acquainted with success and failure; and balanced in my reactions to both.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to make a contribution, please consider sharing this campaign with your friends, family and associates through all of the various social media venues that you belong to. Thank You !

story:
Help us build the first school COMPLETELY funded by crowdfunding.


Just the facts please....

  • non public education for students ages 3 years - 8th grade
  • classes with approximately 6 students
  • serving lower income/underprivileged kids
  • teaching kids at whatever level they are
  • intense academics in the morning and enrichment in the afternoons
  • hot breakfast and lunch provided daily
  • allowing teachers to teach
  • less testing, more learning
  • providing our students with unlimited technological experiences
  • preparing kids to be on a level playing field with their public school peers by the time they enter their local high school
  • giving these kids unique experiences and opportunities to equip them to be able to participate in extracurricular activities once they reach high school
  • quality pay for quality teachers
  • each teacher will have a teaching assistant
  • small schoolhouse located on lots of land in rural Walland, Tennessee
  • cat and dogs in the school to love on the kids
  • adult education room for the moms of our students to learn parenting skills, to further their own education, and to access programs that will help their family
Want to know more? Please read on.  Thanks in advance for your help.

Think back to your elementary school days...

What did you love about them? What did you hate? What made it great? What could have made it better?

Now imagine a day as a student at The Little Red Schoolhouse.....

You arrive at The Little Red Schoolhouse by bus at 8:00 in the morning.  Upon arrival, you head into the cafeteria to eat a hot breakfast that was made for you by a loving cafeteria lady.  Once you are finished with breakfast, you head down to your classroom.  There in your classroom is your teacher and 3-5 other students ready to learn.  You and your classmates spend the morning learning math, science, social studies, and reading.  You love school and you love learning because you are learning at your own level and at your own pace.  You aren't as good at reading so you are using an iPad to practice some important reading skills you missed from previous grades.  Your classmate is an excellent reader so she is in the reading loft reading a book from her favorite series while petting the classroom cat.  You are above grade level in math so during math class you are working with the teacher to learn skills that are two grade levels ahead.  Some of your classmates are just learning their multiplication facts, but you mastered those over a year ago so you practice 3 digit times 3 digit multiplication.  Before you know it, it's lunchtime!  After your lunch with your teacher and friends, your afternoon at "school" is filled with play time and enrichment activities. You can take lessons in dance, piano, karate, violin, cheer, banjo, singing, etc. During recess, you learn how to get along with others while playing.  While participating in an organized sports activity, you learn the rules of the game along with good sportsmanship.  Now your school day is over and it's time to go home.  You can't wait to come back again tomorrow.

Ages 3-4 years...

Our 3-4 year old preschool program will have no more than 5 kids in it.  The young kids in this class will explore learning thru play, exposure to books and nursery rhymes, and learning games.  We believe if we can create these experiences early on, these lower income kids will start kindergarten ready to go.

Kindergarten...

Our kindergarten students will continue to learn thru play.  They will learn their letters and numbers and begin to learn to read and do math.  If they need more than a school year to master kindergarten skills, they may spend more than a year there.  They will not be pushed on just because the school year is up. Our kindergarten class will have approximately 5 students in it.

Grades 1-8...

These grades will be multiage grades 1 & 2, 3 & 4, 5 & 6, 7 & 8.  Each multiage classroom would have about 6 students. Teachers in these grades will give students individualized instruction according to what skill level they are on.  As necessary, students may advance or remain in a grade level.  This will be determined based on the child's ability level. 

Beyond 8th Grade....

Our goal at The Little Red Schoolhouse is to help underprivileged/lower income students have an individualized school experience that will enable them to have a successful future.  We aim to prepare and equip our students to be on a level playing field with their peers by the time they enter their local high school.

Adult/Parent Education and Support Classroom....

We feel that the parent to our kids here is the most influential person in their child's life.  Therefore, we understand how important it is to equip those parents with beneficial skills.  At The Little Red Schoolhouse, we will offer help to the parent with an adult classroom.  This classroom will be equipped with a teacher that will provide educational help so the parent can become more able to help their own child. We will offer parenting classes, opportunities for parents to fill in their own educational gaps, time and resources for them to further their own education, and direction on how to help their child at home.  We will also provide social service opportunities to them that will help their family.  

This IS a focused private school for select underprivileged/lower income kids.

I plan to open a very small school for ages 3 years to 8th grade that will focus on educating underprivileged kids in my local area. Every year I see those students at my school who need a little more individualized help.  Students who may not get support at home because mom and dad just don't have enough education of their own to feel confident to help. Most of these kids don't have someone who can home school them and no one is going to send them to private school, or pay for a tutor. Students will attend without having to pay tuition.

This IS NOT anti public school.

 I love my job and the school district in which I work. I am frustrated with federal and state government control over programs, teacher evaluations, and testing requirements. These decisions are made by many who have never taught in the classroom or who have been out of the classroom for a long time.  There are many great things that happen in public schools and many fabulous teachers there making it happen.  All 3 of my kids attend their local public school and are thriving there. This school is meant to take a few students from public school who need a little more time, love, and attention and help them thrive.  Our goal is to have them ready to return to their local high school at an equal or higher level than their peers and with the skills and confidence to achieve there.

The Impact

With your help, we can make a difference in a child's life. 

  • Giving these kids an advantage like this is priceless.  
  • Helping our little school focus on these handful of kids will change their lives forever.
  • Wouldn't you have loved attending a school like this as a child?

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please help us spread the word about The Little Red Schoolhouse on social media.
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Pray for our project.

Non Profit Status

We have begun the process of applying to become a 501 3 c non profit.  This may take anywhere from 2-8 months to complete and get approved.  Plus it costs $850 to file the paperwork. They suggest paying to have someone knowledgeable of the process to help you fill out the 50-100 pages of paperwork.  Money raised from this campaign will be put toward those fees. Therefore, we are not listed here as a non profit.  Once approved, the status becomes retroactive.  

Flexible Funding

This is a flexible funding campaign.  This dream of mine will become a reality.  IF it is not fully funded from this first campaign, additional campaigns will be conducted.  Whatever is raised in this campaign will be used to start the process.  The first move will be to purchase the land. If you contribute, you will be able to get updates about the progress of The Little Red Schoolhouse. I will continue until I have raised enough money.  This is going to happen.  These kids deserve it.

Funding by the Numbers

Director    Y1 $75,000 Y2 $76,000 Y3 $77,000 Y4 $78,000

3-4 Teacher    Y1 $40,000 Y2 $41,000 Y3 $42,000 Y4 $43,000

K Teacher    Y1 $50,000 Y2 $51,000 Y3 $52,000 Y4 $53,000

Gr. 1-2 Teacher  Y1 $50,000 Y2 $51,000 Y3 $52,000 Y4 $53,000

Gr. 3-4 Teacher  Y1 $40,000 Y2 $41,000 Y3 $42,000 Y4 $43,000

Gr. 5-6 Teacher   Y1 $45,000 Y2 $46,000 Y3 $47,000 Y4 $48,000

Gr. 7-8 Teacher  Y1 N/A Y2 $40,000 Y3 $41,000 Y4 42,000

Total $1,359,000


3-4 TA    Y1 $10,000 Y2 $10,250 Y3 $10,500 Y4 $10,750

K TA    Y1 $10,000 Y2 $10,250 Y3 $10,500 Y4 $10,750

Gr. 1-2 TA  Y1 $10,000 Y2 $10,250 Y3 $10,500 Y4 $10,750

Gr. 3-4 TA  Y1 $10,000 Y2 $10,250 Y3 $10,500 Y4 $10,750 

Gr. 5-6 TA  Y1 $10,000 Y2 $10,250 Y3 $10,500 Y4 $10,750

Gr. 7-8 TA  Y1 N/A Y2 $10,000 Y3 10,250 Y4 $10,500

Total $238,250


Secretary/bookkeeper     Y1 $40,000 Y2 $41,000 Y3 $42,000 Y4 $43,000

Cook          Y1 $30,000 Y2 $31,000 Y3 $32,000 Y4 $33,000

Adult Education      Y1 $40,000 Y2 $41,000 Y3 $42,000 Y4 $43,000

Technology Specialist    Y1 $40,000 Y2 $41,000 Y3 $42,000 Y4 $43,000

Substitutes (180 days@ $80/day)   Y1 $14,400 Y2 $14,400 Y3 $14,400 Y4 $14,400

Total $681,600


*Insurance Coverage for Full Time Employees (11 employees @ $9,000/year) $99,000 x 4 years = $396,000

*Retirement Benefits for Full Time Employees $40,000 x 5% = $2,000 x 11 employees =

$22,000 x 4 years = $88,000

Total Employment 4 Years $2,762,850

Land  $350,000

Unfurnished Building $1,200,000

iPads (30 students, 8 teachers)  38 x $600 = $22,800

Horseshoe table per classroom 6 x $250 = $1,500

Teacher desk per classroom 7 x $500 =3,500

Teacher chair per classroom 7 x $100 = $700

Student chairs $150 x 30 students = $4,500

Student desks $325 x 30 students = $9,750

Teacher and Support Staff Chromebooks 11 x $400 = $4,400

Teacher and Support Staff color printers 11 x $100 = $1,100

Couch per classroom 8 x $500 = $4,000

Smartboard per classroom (plus common area) 9 x $2,500 = $22,500

Playground $25,000

Books for classrooms $1,000 x 7 = $7,000

Fridge $2,000

Freezer $2,000

Stoves 2 x $1,500 = $3,000

Plates $200

Silverware $100

Kitchen hardware (pots, pans, etc.)  $2,000

Copy Machine $1,500

Initial Opening Cost to Build and Furnish School $1,667,550

  • Food Costs $5 per student per day ($5 x 30) = $150 per day x 180 school days = $27,000 per year x 4 years = $108,000

  • Transportation (bus) $150 per day x 180 days = $27,000 per year x 4 years = $108,000

  • Field Trip Expenses $4,500 per year x 4 years = $18,000

  • Classroom supplies Y1 $1,000 x 8 teachers = $8,000 Y2 $500 x 8 teachers= $4,000

Y3 $500 x 8 teachers  = $4,000 Y4 $500 x 8 teachers = $4,000 Total for 4 years = $20,000

  • Testing grades 2-6 ACT Aspire (includes periodic assessment) 15 students x $30 =

$450 x 4 years = $1,800

  grades 7-8 ACT Aspire (includes periodic assessment) 6 students x $30=

$180 x 3 years = $540

  • Facilities Insurance coverage $450 per month x 12 months = $5,400 x 4 years = $21,600

  • Reflex Math $35 x 24 students = $840 x 4 years = $3,360

  • iReady Math $30 x $24 students = $720 x 4 years = $2,880

  • iReady Reading $30 x $24 students = $720 x 4 years = $2,880

  • Reading Eggs $269 per year x 4 years = $1,076

  • Toiletry Supplies $1,000 x 4 years = $4,000

  • Cleaning supplies $1,800 x 4 years = $7,200

  • Internet $50 per month x 12 months = $600 x 4 years = $2,400

  • Utilities $1,500 per month x 12 months = $18,000 x 4 years = $72,000

  • Water $180 per month x 12 months = $2,160 x 4 years =$8,640

  • Grounds maintenance  $500 per month x 12 months = $6,000 x 4 years = $24,000


Operating Costs First 4 years $406,376


Total $4,836,776

Therefore, we are not listed here as a non profit.  Once approved, the status becomes retroactive.  Flexible FundingThis is a flexible funding campaign.  This dream of mine will become a reality.  IF it is not fully funded from this first campaign, additional campaigns will be conducted.  Whatever is raised in this campaign will be used to start the process.  The first move will be to purchase the land. If you contribute, you will be able to get updates about the progress of The Little Red Schoolhouse. I will continue until I have raised enough money.  This is going to happen.  These kids deserve it.

story:
For anyone who would like to help, and has an interest in Star Wars. Scroll down to Perks. You won’t be disappointed.

Meet the Team

Brian Magill:  Brian has been playing and teaching guitar for over thirty years. He helped set up the website 3lmusic.com, which is designed to teach complete beginners to play either the Tin whistle or the flute. Having come up with the idea to add a beginner’s course on the guitar for visually impaired students, he is focused on seeing this project through to completion. 

 

Sean Creaven:  Based in Dublin, Sean has a background in health care, having worked as a mental health nurse for 28 years. He is Dad to 2 wannabe musical sons, and sings with his local community gospel choir. He is now in charge of the thankless job of admin for this project.

We would also like to give a special thank you to the following people who have freely given their time to help us set up this campaign. Ray Fallon, Mike from Sligeach Films, Ben at bensound.com for the background music, Nikki and Nessa.

 

2cMusic is the name of this campaign, which is being run by us here at 3lmusic.com.          

Although based in Ireland, this is truly an international project with a strong social aspect.

Why we are running this Campaign

On a short bus journey this summer in Dublin, Brian, one of the owners of the website 3lmusic.com, sat beside a young lady, they began to talk, and It turned out that she was a tourist from the UK, visiting relatives with a friend for a few days.

During the conversation she asked him what he worked at, he explained that he ran a website which teaches people to play musical instruments online, and he jokingly said she should sign up for one of the online courses.

She simply answered by saying that she would really love to but couldn’t as she was blind and had never learned “Music Braille”, the equivalent of learning music theory in order to read sheet music. It being a sunny day and with her wearing sunglasses he had never noticed.

 

 

Most sighted musicians cannot read sheet music and rely on very simple method of reading chord diagrams and tablature in order to learn to play the guitar, for example. Shown above on the right, tablature or TAB as it is referred to, shows the six strings of the guitar. On these strings are numbers which tell a student which fret to place their finger on. This is not a system which is readily available to visually impaired people.  

We can honestly say that when we initially set up our website it had never even crossed our minds about the problems visually impaired people encounter when accessing almost every website site, things the rest of us simply take for granted.

Since that chance meeting on the bus, we have spent a lot of time investigating the possibility of producing a course which can be used by any visually impaired person with no previous musical knowledge.

Imagine for a moment the way a sighted student learns from a music site at present. They choose a video, for example how to learn the C Chord on the Guitar. This is a simple enough process. They simply follow the information on the video which is a combination of audio, text and images.

For a visually impaired person at present who cant read Music Braille, it is only the audio portion of the lesson they have to follow. Learning by ear alone is quite a difficult process. So we have come up with a method of teaching which should make the process of learning a little easier.

What we need the funding for

With your help we intend to record a twenty lesson  course designed for the complete beginner, on the guitar, as this was the most popular instrument chosen from a survey we carried out with visually impaired people. These lessons will contain much more descriptive audio, and use larger text and images for those that simply find it hard to read regular text.

For those people with a more severe visual impairment, we also intend to prepare Braille cards which will accompany each lesson and come in a booklet format, these cards will contain not only Braille text but also Braille images. These will require quite a lot of time to prepare, but when used along with the more descriptive audio, will now give a visually impaired student, exactly the same chance to learn to play as other sighted students. These booklets will be posted to a student when they join a course.

We realise that this is a big undertaking on our part but again, with your help we are willing to put in the work to complete the project. With each lesson costing an average of $600 to prepare, we need to raise $12000 in total to produce a full twenty lesson course. Any extra money raised will go to producing other courses.

Production time for a full course is estimated to take between ten to twelve weeks

We would like to invite you to contribute to this worthy campaign by choosing from one of the contribution options on our “Perks” menu. If you’re not in a position to help financially, then you can still help us out by simply sharing our campaign link on your social media or by emailing it on to your friends. https://igg.me/at/2cMusic

Our Perks

We are relying on both the visually impaired, and sighted communities to help us raise the funding for this course. As you can see from our perks, we have tried to give something  directly to people purchasing the lower priced perks, while for people or businesses who are in a position to purchase the more expensive perks, will not only be helping a great cause but will have the option of getting some good publicity.

Now for the Star wars fans! 

As you are probably aware, part of the “Force Awakens” was filmed here in Ireland on the mystical Island of Skellig Michael off the Kerry coast. A Christian monastery was founded on the island at some point between the 6th and 8th century and remained continuously occupied until it was abandoned in the late 12th century.

The 600ft high rocky Island and the remains of the ancient monastery, which features in the film, is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and as such visitor numbers are strictly limited.

We were delighted to have been contacted by the owner of the Bridge bar and Moorings restaurant, where many of the actors and crew stayed during filming. Mark Hamill actually learned to pull a pint of Guinness there, watch on this link. http://www.moorings.ie/star-wars-the-force-awakens/. He said he would like to help our project by offering us two tickets which will allow you to land on the island in 2018, and climb to where the filming took place. He also offered us two boat trips, which will travel around the island.

We intend to hold a draw for these tickets on the successful completion of our campaign

How to enter:

1: For the trip around the Island simply Like and Share our facebook page  https://www.facebook.com/2cmusic1/  

2: For the tickets to land on the Island Like and Share our facebook page and purchase any one of our Perks.

  

We really hope you can be part of our project!

Thanks for taking the time to read about our campaign.

story:
My Story:

  •   I'm Yusuf Mohamed from Egypt. I'm an artist who graduated from the High Institute of Cinema in 2015 with a bachelor degree in cinematography. I have also had a bachelor degree in educational art since 2010.
  •   I have a dream to study in one of the most important cinematography schools in the world - until now I have managed to achieve a part of my dream – I want to have a master's degree from Lodz Film School in Poland. It's a five-year-long master’s course. After a year of learning the Polish language in Poland under the care of the school, starting the 1st of October I'll be studying practically.
  •   I tried to find some fund or scholarship to continue my studies but without success. That’s because most scholarships are for science not art (especially cinema!!)
  •   The main obstacle is that I have to pay 11,000 euro per year for my studies. This course takes 5 years. For now, I only have 3600 euros and that is due to the economic conditions in Egypt. Especially after the flotation of the Egyptian currency. It decreased from 7300 euro to 3600 euro. If I can’t solve this problem, I won’t be able to continue my studies and I'll be forced to return to my country because I literally sold everything I had (including my car).
  •   The currency of Egyptian pound in 30th of May 2016 was 1 euro = 9,88 Egyptian pounds and now it's 1 euro = 21,23 Egyptian pounds!!!
  •   I had around 76000 Egyptian pounds which should make 7700 euro. Because of the floating in the Egyptian pound it decreased to 3600!! I didn't exchange the money before going to Poland to study Polish because no one thought such floating will happen.
  •   I hope I will be able to follow and achieve my dream. I believe in knowledge and learning. I'm the first Egyptian in the whole history of the school (which was open in 1948!)
  •   Achieving my goal means that nothing is impossible,
  •   The main reason I’m asking you to join me on my journey is that I have already taken my steps and I can’t stop now!


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sometimes we have the easier way but in fact we like the hardest ways! It makes our life more difficult, different, and also exciting; that's why we always make the hardest choice
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 

 

                      This is my Instagram page - yusuf.yo – you can check some of my works

                                                    https://www.instagram.com/yusuf.yo/     

                                 And

  •  my show-reel from 2012 till 2016     

  • some of my work (GIF) in Poland 2016/2017
 
                                                

                                              

Tuition fees and accommodation expenses:

           5500 Euro for one semester X 10 semesters in 5 years

      +

        500 Euro per month for living expenses (renting a room, food, books, health insurance, transportation)  

*I'm already Student restricted in Lodz film school in Poland cinematography department

 

The Impact:

 This project is very important for me - it's like life or death. I have had this dream for 5 years. I have done everything to gain knowledge and experience to be in this school. All the steps I have taken are connected with my dream.

 During my first year in Poland I did 14 projects as an assistant cameraman in school and outside.
I made 6 short films as a director of photography.
I have already been working very hard to achieve my dream - to be a great director of photography.
Some of the projects I did in Poland as a director of photography are:

       1-Rights of disabled people in Poland

   2-Women's right in Poland

       3- some of the works I made in Egypt 

3- Film The Box

it was accepted at 7 film festivals. It is about the impact of technology and media on children.

 

Challenges:

  •   I have been working in Egypt as a focus puller (1st assistant cameraman). Because of problems with residence card I couldn’t work in Poland for the time I was there. It was very stressful because of my lack of money.
  • Because of the School’s prestige, my experience and my vision I was told I would be able to make good money quite soon. That is because the first years of School are crucial. I need to focus to become one of the best directors of photography. I know I can achieve that.
  • I did everything I could to follow my dream. Because of world politics and national economy I might not be able to achieve it. After all hard work I put to get in and to build my image in School I may fail for reasons that are out of my hands.
  • I believe in myself and other people believe in me too. I was told by school employees a lot of good things about me. I believe in my vision, talent and character.

My vision:

  I am sure that after hard work I will be able to follow in steps of other students of Lodz Film School such as: Hoyte van Hoytema (director of photography of Her, Interstellar, Specter), Sławomir Idziak (Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix, Black Hawk Down), Paweł Edelman (The Ghost Writer, Venus in Fur).
 

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you can’t help with money – that’s OK, there are other ways too :) . Please share my campaign in other social media, ask your friends.

Maybe you happen to know any funds or organizations that could help me? If so, please write to me

             Thank you for making my dream true

                  Thank you. For any inquiries or information, don't hesitate and write to me.

 

***Due to polish currency differences its easier to make my campaign in USD even though I will pay for school in EURO

story:
In our modern digitalized and over stimulating world we tend to stay in our heads a lot, we get far away from our body, far away from our true nature. It is a challenge, for many of us, to experience ourself in fluid, soulful and connected state. It is a challenge for us to share with the world our authenticity, our uniqueness and our undeniable self.

This project is about coming back to the roots of our nature, to the wisdom of our body and our soul.

RETURNING HOME is a project created by Tamara Romaniuk. This practice is based on Open Floor International - school of embodiment. It’s purpose is to awaken the wisdom of the body, heart and mind as well as enrich our capacity to live with more love, health, happiness, and full self-expression. When we use the dance to be fully embodied – physically, emotionally, mindfully – it simply means being home for the beautiful ride of being alive.

 

The purpose of this campaign is to help Tamara finance the Open Floor Teacher teacher training, and by doing so have a part in creating more embodied world.

 

“Open Floor is a practice which helped me to connect and to make new friends on the foreign ground. I have learned how to simply ground myself in my body when in a relationship with others I would be so nervous. I would forget what to say and lose myself in my head, disconnect and feel foreign.  

By practicing being more in my body I have discovered my new home and I have integrated well into society. I have also learned how to trust the unknown, how to face the challenge, how to find the courage to speak for myself, for my kids and for my life.


And now, my wish is to share this gift with you ... when your life seems to be ok but you know there is much more, when you're longing for more connection, compassion and belonging or when you're craving for more passionate creative live.” Tamara Romaniuk

 

With gratitude to all without whom this would be impossible, who have created Open Floor School - experienced teachers, practitioners, friends and to those who want to join in the future or support this project. 

 

By helping me to finance the Open Floor teacher training you will have a part in creating the world with more love, health, happiness, and full self-expression. You support the growth of Open Floor community and you create a place for a refuge in our community. 

As a reward for supporting this project, I'm excited to offer:  

A place for a refugee in Open Floor movement sessions:  by contributing to a session for a refugee you're creating a space for someone who is longing for more connection, belonging and sense of intergration into german society.

Open Floor embodied movement sessions + ART CAFE (in Berlin, Germany).
These sessions are open to all. There are no steps to learn, no way to do it wrong. Anyone is free to drop in, and newcomers are warmly welcomed. Bring your curiosity and desire to move your body. For more information click here.

Fire Starter Sessions (via SKYPE)
this is the essence of my life and business philosophy which I have always confessed, and which I better understood after the discovery of the book of Danielle LaPorte.
The Fire Starter Sessions makes one think very clear: how to expand your creative power.
As a licensed Fire Starter facilitator I'm happy to be able to offer them to you.
For more information click here.

Returning Home postcard is a symbolic, personal gift I designed for you with the gratitude for your support. 

The last and very important! Please share this campaign if you can via social media/email with people you might think would like to contribute or be a part of this project.

Thank you for being here!
Tamara Romaniuk
story_txt: In our modern digitalized and over stimulating world we tend to stay in our heads a lot, we get far away from our body, far away from our true nature. It is a challenge, for many of us, to experience ourself in fluid, soulful and connected state. It is a challenge for us to share with the world our authenticity, our uniqueness and our undeniable self.This project is about coming back to the roots of our nature, to the wisdom of our body and our soul.RETURNING HOME is a project created by Tamara Romaniuk. This practice is based on Open Floor International - school of embodiment. It’s purpose is to awaken the wisdom of the body, heart and mind as well as enrich our capacity to live with more love, health, happiness, and full self-expression. When we use the dance to be fully embodied – physically, emotionally, mindfully – it simply means being home for the beautiful ride of being alive. The purpose of this campaign is to help Tamara finance the Open Floor Teacher teacher training, and by doing so have a part in creating more embodied world. “Open Floor is a practice which helped me to connect and to make new friends on the foreign ground. I have learned how to simply ground myself in my body when in a relationship with others I would be so nervous. I would forget what to say and lose myself in my head, disconnect and feel foreign.  By practicing being more in my body I have discovered my new home and I have integrated well into society. Anyone is free to drop in, and newcomers are warmly welcomed. Bring your curiosity and desire to move your body. Returning Home postcard is a symbolic, personal gift I designed for you with the gratitude for your support. The last and very important! Please share this campaign if you can via social media/email  with people you might think would like to contribute or be a part of this project.Thank you for being here!Tamara Romaniuk

story:
Oak Hill Center for Education and Culture is a school for learning, researching, sharing, and exploring creative strategies and tools for transformative social movement building.  We develop and identify organizers, educators, and artists committed to social and economic justice.

In the fall of 2013, a small group of organizers, artists, and educators came together to discuss the social and economic inequalities facing communities in Baltimore and around the world. At the heart of this conversation lay two questions: What are the forms of organizing needed to build social movements that can address the roots of these inequalities?  And, what role can artists and educators play in helping to organize broad-based social movements?

This conversation resulted in a commitment to creating a school for strategic reflection and the development of  curriculum and cultural tools for transformative change.

Since then, thanks to your support, and entirely on a volunteer basis, we have been able to build out our own meeting space in East Baltimore, coordinate summer long intensives focused on the history of our neighborhood and W.E.B. DuBois’ Black Reconstruction, hosted over two dozen educational community events on topics ranging from cultural organizing strategies to hosting three day strategic planning sessions for the launch of a New Poor People’s Campaign for Today. All while also having twice a month regular community education sessions to reflect on the local, national, and global politics of our current moment. .

...And we have done this, for four years, with zero paid staff.

Which is why we’re bugging you again.  In order to continue providing a space for political education, strategic planning, and cultural production to local residents, community organizers, activists, and artists at low to no cost, we need your help. Please make a donation to sustain and grow Oak Hill’s movement education mission. You can help strengthen our work in this time of renewed social movement activity.

WHAT YOUR CONTRIBUTION WILL SUPPORT?

Your donation will go towards the realization of  ongoing curriculum, projects, and programming we hope to organize in the summer and fall. These include:

1. Lessons from the Movement to end Slavery Workbook Series

2. Ongoing Thursday community study sessions

3. A Baltimore-wide Strategic Dialogue series on gentrification and displacement in Baltimore

4. Pop-up public programing and community events throughout the year (the list is too long)

5. East Baltimore Midway Books and Breakfast Program

6. 2017 Gramsci Study Group

Please donate if you can, and reach out to us if you want to get involved in the collective or use our space for your own efforts to help empower our communities!

story:
The Grow Brains Game is a tabletop board game system and learning platform, specially designed for children and adults with special learning needs. The GBS games are intentionally designed to offer authentically fun and inspiring ways to learn important life skills such as money counting and arithmetic, geography, history, word pronunciation skills and more!

As this project takes on more and more momentum, we wish to make further developments to better help the people and children this game was designed to benefit. Some current ideas and visions we have include a digital app as well as more games in other skills areas, for example Music Skills, Cooking Skills and others!

 

 

:::   Fun & Captivating Way To Learn Everyday Important Life Skills

:::   Innovative Learning Approach Rooted In Scientific Research

:::   Provides Opportunity for Social Interaction & Grow New Friendships!

:::   Measurably Effective At Encouraging Social Skills,  Especially Speech &                          Language & Critical thinking

:::   Abundant Use of Color & Visual Design (Improves Interest & Attention)

 

 

We believe our best learning happens when we are having fun and being in the moment. The GBS games are designed to make learning valuable and challenging skills seamless and effortless. When a person (of any age) truly loves what they are doing, they gain access to intellect and abilities that were previously believed impossible by others.

 

 

GROW BRAINS Money Skills was created and refined by a special education teacher and his students over several years. I have been using this game in my classroom for many years now, teaching students that experts insisted did not posses the intelligence to master money skills. Over the years what has been developed is a game that is both incredibly fun and superbly effective at building counting and money decision skills.

Note: For students who are unsure of the value of the coins, they have an opportunity to get to know the realistic size and design of the real coins, thereby training their mind to recognize and use real money and coins!

 

 

 

1. The player closest to the GO icon shakes first & moves the correct number of spaces in a clockwise motion.

2. Next, the player then takes a TASK CARD and follows the instructions. 

 

EXAMPLE: "Count 27¢ with 3 Coins"

The player would take a quarter and place it in the circle and announce “25 cents”.

Next, the player is tasked with locating and adding two pennies in addition to the previous quarter.

If a player has a problem completing the task, the player may turn the TASK CARD over (showing the answer) and place the correct coin over the correct coin on the TASK CARD. 

 

3. If a player is able to SOLVE THE TASK CARD, they get to KEEP THE TASK CARD. 

4. Then they can GO AGAIN :)

or...

5. However, if a player is NOT able to solve the task card, they must RETURN THE TASK CARD to the pile and pass the dice to the the next player.

*** The player with the most SOLVED/COLLECTED CARDS at the end WINS! ***

 

 

 

My students call me "Teacher Bruce" because one of my primary passions in life is promoting the joy and thrill of learning. I think that the power of inspired and joyful learning is truly unlimited. Throughout my experience as a special education teacher for multiple decades, I have seen first hand, just how vital inspired attention is to learning.

I think that whenever we do something we genuinely love and in a positive, supportive environment, it becomes quite easy to be attentive and alert. Scientific studies show that our brain is most receptive and malleable when we are feeling relaxed and having fun!

As I discovered the power of a fun, joyful learning environment, I began to change my classroom schedule and teaching tools to better match what my students were excited about in their everyday lives. The result was truly extraordinary! My students were drawn to our lessons like it was free play time. Because it is true... we are playing, but we are also learning. Each lesson came with its own fun adventure.

With the Grow Brains System games, I have sought to share this invaluable experience with others around the world! We have created a one of kind game platform that empowers parents and educators to offer their children a way to learn or rehabilitate important, necessary life skills. Yet still maintain a playful and fun mood throughout each lesson and learning session.

story:
Survive the New World

I struggled, but you don't have to

 

If you believe me, you will be rewarded. If you don't believe me, I will make it worth your while to change your mind. Let me explain.

 

When the entire world runs on tech, programming is high in demand. Every business has a website, shops go online, games are popular and smart devices need custom apps to function.

 

I've been introduced to programming in my early teenage years. I followed many tutorials, but struggled to learn because I kept falling into the same trap; the same one that stops you from learning a foreign language. You can repeat premade sentences many times and understand them well, but when you need to say something else you fall flat. One solution is to start learning everything, eventually connecting the dots and understanding how to read, write and speak. However, you don't have the time for that. And where would you even start?

 

In programming, I had the same experience. I followed the code-along tutorials on the internet, but I was lost when working on my own. I spent so much time on programming that eventually I learned it and could write my own apps. Entering university, I was well ahead on everyone else so I could just focus on the theory and algorithms. As a bonus, I had a job as a programmer to pay my tuition fees.

 

I finished my education but it didn’t feel right. The knowledge I gained was mainly from my job and other personal projects. What was learned in school felt almost useless. Some of you who were in university are probably not surprised.

 

Even if you don't become a programmer, there are hidden benefits. I personally made apps to help me study, avoided a lot of manual work, calculated complex probabilities and made many tools for myself. Not to mention that programming teaches you how to deconstruct problems and organize your thoughts. Do it for your brain!

 

So how do you learn programming efficiently? From my experience as both a self-learner and student, you need to learn three things: the fundamentals of programming, the ability to search online, and the techniques to find bugs in your code because you will waste several hours on them.

 

I am making a course that is effective for both adults and teenagers. A course divided in small chunks for busy people but also fun and interactive for better understanding. The goal is to get you from a total beginner to a university level coder.

 

I will show you how to tackle problems and think on your own. How to learn what you need for your own projects and how to find those annoying bugs quickly. And on top of that, I will teach you the fundamental algorithms of Computer Science.

 

But instead of telling you how great it will be, I would rather show you. You can try my first demo lesson. My hope is that you will see how far this project can go. Follow the link and give it a try: https://codefarmonline.com/lessons/intro/lesson1/

 

As I build the course, I am asking for a $50 or more donation to get complete access for life. When the first version is completed, I will release it, but I will keep improving every lesson until I am satisfied with the result.

 

When completed, this course will be sold for up to $500, so get in now for $50! I will even give you the option to change your mind. When this campaign ends, there will be a 30-day grace period to get your money back if you are unhappy with your investment.

 

For a course that aims to replace university, I am comfortable with this project.

story:
ABOUT FLYQUEST

FlyQuest is a non-profit 501(c)(3) organization based in Huntsville, Alabama with a vision to awaken dreams and to provide opportunities for young people to pursue aerospace education and aviation careers. We want as many young people as possible to experience the joy of flight. 

FlyQuest was recently featured in our local news. Please enjoy our video at http://whnt.com/2015/11/16/aviation-is-fun-and-maybe-a-career-too/


FlyQuest conducts its Aviation Fundamentals programs for schools and home school students, covering topics such as aerodynamics, aircraft systems, maintenance, airport operations, weather, crew resource management, and decision making. Our unique approach includes offering scholarships, which require the students to perform community service in exchange for aviation coursework or flight experience. Our one-day Aviation Overview programs also benefit community organizations such as the Girls Scouts and Boy Scouts and schools. Our field trips to local airports inspire young minds to pursue their aviation dreams.

FlyQuest has installed the first 6 Degrees of Freedom flight simulator in North Alabama available to the public, which enhances the our education programs and provides hands-on experience for young people interested in pursuing aerospace education and aviation careers.

The DCX MAX FM simulator can be easily configured for 25 single engine and 10 multi-engine aircraft and includes a full metal cockpit enclosure, dynamic control loading, modern avionics and a 225 degree visual system. FlyQuest’s primary use of the aircraft simulator is to teach its students in a safe environment while providing cost-effective, realistic flight training.

FUNDRAISING CAMPAIGN

FlyQuest has designed a comprehensive Aviation Fundamentals course, which is taught by FlyQuest personnel to public and homeschool high school students, from freshmen to seniors. The unique five-day program is spread over a semester and provides students with first-hand exposure to aerodynamic principles and aircraft components, as well as the requirements needed to pursue one of four aviation career fields: piloting, aircraft maintenance, air traffic control, and airport operations. The class involves several tours and field trips. For example, students visit Huntsville International’s air traffic control tower and experience flight with an instructor in FlyQuest’s unique 6 Degrees of Freedom flight simulator.  Our students have also met with TSA agents, baggage handlers, FBO line personnel, and airport public safety officers.

FlyQuest is currently teaching Aviation Fundamentals in one Huntsville City High School and hopes to raise enough funds to expand the course to all the high schools and middle schools in North Alabama. Along with expanding to more schools, funds will be used to help underserved students fulfill their dreams of achieving an Aviation career through scholarships and internships.

FlyQuest often identifies young people who have an aptitude for aviation through our education programs. Our team understands that not everyone can afford to pursue their dreams to achieve a career that meets their skills. For example, our first scholarship winner, Brandon Schrader, attended our Aviation Fundamentals home school course in 2014 and, through a generous scholarship donation,  he is now attending private pilot ground school training at the University of Alabama Huntsville.

Scholarship awardees are required to perform community service which is a unique way FlyQuest gives back to our community. Hours required are determined by the level of scholarship access received and agreed upon by all parties when the scholarship is presented.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

FlyQuest depends on the generosity of volunteers who donate their time for flight instruction, administration, and facilities maintenance. We also are looking for donations of flight training materials, computers, aircraft, and other supplies.

Please visit our website www.flyquest.net or our Facebook page for more information

story:
"There are always reasons not to do things but at least one major reason to do things: The responsibility for our Earth, for the clean prosperity of all people, for our children and grandchildren."

 22  May 2015, Roland Berger, Chairman of the Board of Trustees

The non-profit DESERTEC Foundation raises awareness for the chances connected with desert power: Water, food and jobs in desert countries. DESERTEC is more than energy! The aim is to create prosperity for all people worldwide based on renewable energy sources - because energy equals development.

We believe that empowerment and education go hand in hand with other DESERTEC activities and that’s where we need you:

Currently we are building DESERTEC Academies all around the globe. In DESERTEC Academies young people empower each other to multiply the DESERTEC Vision in their countries.



WE NEED YOUR HELP TO REALIZE DESERTEC ACADEMIES ALL OVER THE WORLD!

The participants of this one-day workshop get trained to give DESERTEC presentations, to promote the benefits of clean energy and to show the advantages and chances of renewable energy in their respective countries. Each participant will be equipped with DESERTEC-slides, videos and other informative materials, such as the book "DESERTEC Atlas" that can be used and distributed while acting as a multiplier. The DESERTEC Foundation further provides long-term support to the young people in their activities as official "ambassadors".

Part of what they learn is that all types of renewable energies are challenged to contribute to the DESERTEC Concept. DESERTEC only uses proven technologies that are able to substitute fossil fuels and nuclear power: Photovoltaic (PV) or wind power, combined with storage of electric power or concentrated solar power (CSP) with heat storage, may all deliver clean and variable power on demand for local consumption. At the same time energy projects in desert countries generate more than energy: Water, food and jobs. The aim is to create prosperity for all people worldwide based on renewable energy sources - because energy equals development.

We are operating globally with young and committed people. One of them is David from Kenya. He presents DESERTEC and the great possibilities for renewable energies in Kenya. This way, he allows children and young adults to get in touch with the concept of sustainability and empowers them to spread this knowledge themselves.


                                                


We must not destroy our future with technology from yesterday. Help David and us to make our dream come true – a sustainable future with the help of DESERTEC!

The DESERTEC Foundation supports itself from the commitment of its fellow campaigners. All actors of the team are currently working voluntarily. The previous successes have only been possible due to a lot of commitment and passion for the work at hand. This is why a lot could already be achieved, despite the limited financial means. The existing monetary resources are used efficiently and in a targeted manner, expensive working processes like expensive overnight stays, flights etc. are avoided if possible. Nevertheless there are still costs to bear and it is only through your help that we can make this vision a reality!

story:
“Jumped” means beat-up by 25 other peers. The youths said, “They deserved to be kicked in their face and head,” cause they always in people’s business. Read more below... Oh, what a frightening world we live in!

Solid Rock Enterprise, Inc. passion to “EMPOWER & EQUIP THE CHILDREN & YOUTH became more vivid after I, Arnetha Thomas/CEO, made the decision to retired in 2005 to devote full-time work in making a difference in the lives of student victims; teaching students about the juvenile justice system; and how to avoid becoming entangled. This work began without funding of any source, serving in Brownsville Middle urban school. The project later received a small grant and more grants that expanded services in helping to date over 1500 victim, delinquent, and disadvantage students and families. 

We intervene in bullying situations, peacefully resolve school & community fights, rumors, disruptive classroom behaviors, stealing, graffiti, academic failure, and more. Currently, we provide limited program services, due to the lack of funding. Project utilizes graduate and undergraduate Social Work Interns. My background includes expertise in conflict resolution and reconciliation, program management, training, crisis intervention, and more. Administration and supported staff are trained experts in conflict resolution and reconciliation. Their experience also includes serving student victims, disadvantage youths, and families. The Board of Directors is comprised of professional to youth advocate of diverse disciplines.

The ability to empower and equip the children and youth is very important to Solid Rock, the team, collaborative partners, and other stakeholders.  Unfortunately, fighting has become a way of life,  escalating to little and no empathy for their peers; “Jumped” by 25 other youths. The teens said, “They deserved to be kicked in their face and head, cause they always in people’s business." The question was asked, “even if they died?’ The response was “Yes.” Oh, what a frightening world we live in! So, this is the driving force motivating us to help rid the violence. These youngsters must internalize and understand life has more to offer in positive ways.

To help Solid Rock in this initiative, I, Arnetha Thomas/CEO have published a children’s and Christian book titled: Beautiful As A Butterfly (hardcover), for young and elementary age children. This book teaches responsibility, decision making, and tells the child why they are beautiful as a butterfly. Beautiful As A Butterfly retails for $24.99, but sale price $19.00. This includes shipping and tax. The Power of the Blood at Work-Broken Veil (paperback) is for young to seasoned adults; and provides spiritual, professional, and self-help development. Workbook included in the back. This book retails for $14.95, but sale price $9.00. This includes shipping and tax. Other ways to support this campaign is through personal contributions of any amount, such as $1 - $5. We will accept more. We’re also asking that you share this campaign with your family, friends, associates, business partners, social media friends, and church members/affiliates. At the end of this campaign from March 15-31, 2015, Beautiful As A Butterfly ebook and Power of the Blood at Work Broken Veil ebook will be available for $1.00 each. Visit http:// www.arnethathomas.com and purchase your Ebook for $1.00 dollar.   


What We Need & What You Get

To introduce and sustain empathy, children/youth must learn how to get along. They must understand “TRADING PLACES” means pretending to be their peer and their peer pretending to be them to understand each others feelings; then to respect themselves and others. The empathy curriculum is based on Restorative Justice, Kingian Nonviolence, and mediation all evidence based models or best practices. The participant’s real life, day to day experiences that include rumors, ranking, bullying, fighting, and not being soft will be used to successfully engage their participation and internalize the importance of empathy. This initiative also helps to build and mend relationships. The targeted 200 participants will initially receive 12 hours of training by April 2015; and an additional 8 training hours throughout the 10-12 month period. During the initial phase they will be certified as Peer Circle Gatekeepers (Facilitators). They will be responsible for facilitating circles with their peers to help them understand the importance of empathy and to put what they learned into practice. The Gatekeepers will participate in empathy  projects and benefit from cultural/educational field trips.

We need $120,000 to support the “Trading Places” Kids Helping Kids-Empathy Project. As the founder/CEO, my credentials include Master’s in Social Work, National Restorative Justice, Kingian Nonviolence, and Peer Mediation Trainer; and Family Mediator.

  1. The CEO will receive $50,000 to continue overseeing and serving victim and disadvantage students and families in the Restorative Justice Academy; oversee the Empathy Project; train and serve as the lead facilitator in the workshops/training; provide the curriculum that’s evidence based or best practices; and help publish the “Optimal Peer Mediation" book.

  2. $46, 000 will support two (2) 30 hours per/week staff that will preferably have a Bachelor’s degree in Social Work or related field. This staff will work with the training initiative, serving the targeted 200 disadvantage children and youth for a period of 10-12 months; along with support from the board, team, collaborative partners, other stakeholders, and trained volunteers.

  3. $20,000 will be used for advertisement that includes social networks, radio, television, and flyer dissemination for sustainability and expansion of Solid Rock’s initiatives that include the Empathy project.

  4. $4,000 will support cultural and educational field trips.

Again for helping us, at the end of this campaign from March 15-31, 2015, Beautiful As A Butterfly ebook and Power of the Blood at Work Broken Veil ebook will be available for $1.00 each. Visit http:// www.arnethathomas.com and purchase your Ebook for $1.00 dollar. 

In case we fail to receive all of the funding requested, Solid Rock is in the process of requesting financial contributions and sponsorship from the Children’s Trust, Miami Dade County, Longshoreman’s Association, Florida Department of Juvenile Justice, Publix’s, Pizza Hut, churches and more. The Empathy Project will continue as our primary focus. If we must, the number of trained participants may be reduced by 25-100 participants. The CEO is expected to receive approximately 25% of these funds to support the training, curriculum, and curriculum tools. Instead of hiring 2 staff may hire only one. Will have to rely more on volunteers. The youth will continue to participate in projects, but field trips maybe reduced.

Never-the-less, we believe the Empathy Project Campaign will exceed our funding expectations. If so, we look forward to expanding this initiative. Please contact us at restorativejusticetraining@yahoo.com if interested in participating in the Empathy Project. 

The Impact

"Bullying is everyone’s concern," says the Center for Disease Control (2009). Everyone should care about the Empathy Project, because we all have been hurt directly or indirectly by the epidemic in youth violence to include: homicide, injuries, bullying, and fighting behaviors among our school age children/youth.  Research shows crime and violence tend to be high in areas in which at least 20% of the residents are poor. See the poverty and economic chart below.

This Empathy Project will primarily target the Brownsville and surrounding communities. Brownsville (33142) ranks as one of the poorest neighborhoods in the nation (U.S. Census, 2010). Poverty is associated to violence. According to Goldstein and Glick (1987), children and youth are de-sensitized to the daily community violence of fighting and deaths resulting from drive by shootings and stray bullets. Further indicated, “results of deficiencies in emotional self-regulation caused by excessive exposure to social, family, and individual risks lead to participation in delinquency activities, verbal, physical aggression, victimization, and the internalization of antisocial value system.

On a national level, gun violence is the second leading cause of death for children ages 1-19, but the leading cause of death for black American children (Children’s Defense Fund, 2010). Black children and teens are twice as likely to be killed by guns as by cars; the report notes, while white children and teens are nearly three times more likely to die in car accidents instead of gun violence. Then 30% of U.S. students in grades 6th -10th are involved in moderate or frequent bullying as the bully, victim, or both. 8% of students miss 1 day of class per month for fear of bullies (Department of Health & Human Services; Center for Disease Control & Prevention; Safe & Drug Free Schools; the Secret Service; and Bureau of Justice Statistics & School Crime & Safety).

In regard to Cyberbullying, 1,000,000 children reported being harassed, threatened or victims of internet bullying on Facebook alone-over the past year. Bullying is increasingly viewed as an important contributor to youth violence, including homicide and suicide. Cyberbullying gets worse as the internet grows (Consumer Reports Survey, The American Justice Department & wherepeacelives.org).

Not only is youth violence a national problem, but a global public health problem. It includes a range of acts from bullying and physical fighting, through more severe sexual and physical assault to homicide. Worldwide some 250, 000 homicides occur among youth 10–29 years of age each year, which is 43% of the total number of homicides globally each year. For each young person killed, 20–40 more sustain injuries requiring hospital treatment. Youth violence has a serious, often lifelong, impact on a person's psychological and social functioning. Youth violence greatly increases the costs of health, welfare and criminal justice services; reduces productivity; decreases the value of property; and generally undermines the fabric of society (World Health Youth Violence Fact Sheet, 2014).

Solid Rock’s record of success includes a 98% “win/win” resolutions in Peer Mediation; 96% success in the disputants completing togetherness projects to build and mend relationships; and over 90% success rate in achieving caring and cooperative behavior among program participants. Testimonies from the students, parents, and administration are: “The program has kept me out of plenty of fights; I was ready to fight after peer mediation, but I didn’t have to; the program really helped my daughter last year and I want her back in this year; and if it wasn’t for the program, I don’t know what we would do.”

Risks & Challenges

The risks and challenges are: to sustain change requires more than 10-12 months of serving the targeted population. Once the project ends and without support, especially in a community tormented with violence the children and youth will normally return to the lack of empathy for their peers.

The plan to overcome this hurdle consists of training other organizations, schools, and churches on the empathy curriculum. As a result, those trained will duplicate and continue to work with the disadvantage children and youth to increase empathy among their peers. Also, Solid Rock will organize a network to facilitate the importance of this project and sustainability. This campaign includes 20% or we will dedicate a reduced amount toward sustainability to increase funding and expansion. Solid Rock and its support systems are committed and will continue to seek grants, foundations, and private contributions; as well as, sponsorships to increase empathy among our children and youth. Finally, once the 45 day campaign has ended those interested can continue to purchase the sale products for a limited period of time, but can always make monetary contributions.

What makes Solid Rock Enterprise, Inc. qualified to overcome these challenge are: as the CEO and trained in the areas of conflict resolution and reconciliation; serving in this capacity for over 20 years which overlaps tenure of more than 29 years with the County and State government; and with over a total of 40 years in public service. Moreover, Solid Rock Enterprise, Inc. collectively has over 100 years of professional services to the community at large. The professional disciplines include program evaluator, mental health, social work, certified teachers, and parent education/training. Supported professional and Para-professional staff experience and expertise include working with disadvantage children and youth; as well as, trained and expertise in Restorative Justice, Kingian Nonviolence, and Peer Mediation.

Others Ways You Can Help

Your help will be greatly appreciated by:

  1. Sharing this campaign with your family, friends, and social networks
  2. Placing this link http://igg.me/at/arnethathomas on your social network page & ask your friends to do the same, including purchasing the book or giving a donation
  3. Asking your church members and associations to support this campaign by purchasing Power of the Blood at Work-Broken Veil 
  4. AskIng your book club to read Power of the Blood at Work-Broken Veil
  5. Asking every parent to purchase the Beautiful As A Butterfly for their young or elementary school age child
  6. Available for workshops, training, conference speaking, storytelling, and more. 
  7. Any ideas or initiatives for the success of this campaign please feel free to contact Arnetha at 1 786 488-4792

Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it!
