story:
Overview

Faith Baptist School is a K-12 Christian school in Belleville, IL.  We aim to provide excellent education from a Christian perspective and to "Train Worthy Ambassadors for Jesus Christ."  We're raising funds to improve the quality of education in grades 7-12.  Here are some details: 

  • Who is raising the funds? Faith Baptist School
  • What are the funds for? Building a Virtual Learning Center for grades 7-12
  • What is a Virtual Learning Center? We provide excellent educational opportunities to our students by streaming instruction from master teachers at Pensacola Christian Academy.  In essence, we bring the excellent academics from PCA (open since 1954 with an enrollment of 2,000 students) to our school through the use of technology.  Our student's benefit from the best teachers in Christian education.
  • When will the project be complete? No Later than August 10, 2015
  • Where will the project take place?  The second floor of Faith Baptist School, 415 E. Main St., Belleville, IL
  • How much money is to be raised? Our estimated building cost is $25,000-30,000
Thank you for considering giving to our campaign!  The money you give will greatly increase our ability to "Train Worthy Ambassadors for Jesus Christ."


What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise $25,000 as our estimated build cost is $25,000-30,000.  Need more details?  Here is a break down of how we'll use these funds:

  • Remodel of existing upstairs to include: expanded boys and girls restroom,
    acoustical drop ceiling and lighting, new flooring, dry walling/paint, and structural work - $20,000
  • Upgraded electronics to include: 6 new media centers with flat screen TVs and DVD players, Microsoft Office suite and Internet filtering software for computer lab, and other learning resources - $5,000-6,000
  • New learning resources to include: library expansion, storage, and organization, and classroom dividers - $2,000-4,000
Below is an artist's rendition of and overhead view of the finished project.


The Impact

Currently we have the space to teach and train 20 students in 7-12 grade.  They are using outdated equipment and are in a space that is not conducive to proper supervision or classroom control.  The area is cramped and learning suffers because of it.  This project will improve the quality of the education we provide in several ways:

  1. We will double our classroom space for 7-12 grade.  This upgrade will allow us to teach and train an estimated 40 students.
  2. We will upgrade the equipment being used in order to minimize technical difficulties and maximize the classroom experience for the learner.
  3. We will increase the level of classroom supervision, control, and tutoring assistance by placing our supervisors directly with the students.
  4. We will ultimately be better able to equip, train, and prepare our students to go and be living examples of Christ wherever God would call them to be and in whatever God would call them to do.


Risks & Challenges

This project will not be an easy one.  Like anything worth doing, there will be many obstacles to overcome.  Here are a few we face:

  • Deadline: Once work begins we must have the project completed in time for the start of school on August 11, 2015.
  • Limited work hours: In order to complete the project by our deadline we must begin work during the current school year.  We will not be able to do much during the school day to avoid interfering with current classes.
  • Labor: While we have capable supervisors and workers lined up, we are relying primarily on volunteer help.  There are some limitations here that can potentially delay the work.
Despite these obstacles, we are confident we will be able to accomplish the task for several reasons.  First and foremost, we believe this is something God would have us do and as such we believe God will bring it to pass.  Additionally, we have a Pastor with 30 years of construction experience to oversee the project.  This will enable us to stay on task and on budget in order to meet our goal.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you'd like to help but are unable to give, please consider helping in another way:

  • Pray for the work to get accomplished.
  • Share our campaign and spread the word with everyone you know through social media and Indiegogo's share tools.
  • Volunteer to help us build our center.

Thanks in advance!
story_txt:
Overview Faith Baptist School is a K-12 Christian school in Belleville, IL.  We aim to provide excellent education from a Christian perspective and to "Train Worthy Ambassadors for Jesus Christ."  We're raising funds to improve the quality of education in grades 7-12.  Here are some details:   
Who is raising the funds? Faith Baptist School

What are the funds for? Building a Virtual Learning Center for grades 7-12


What is a Virtual Learning Center? We provide excellent educational opportunities to our students by streaming instruction from master teachers at Pensacola Christian Academy.  In essence, we bring the excellent academics from PCA (open since 1954 with an enrollment of 2,000 students) to our school through the use of technology.  Our student's benefit from the best teachers in Christian education. 
When will the project be complete? No Later than August 10, 2015

Where will the project take place?  The second floor of Faith Baptist School, 415 E. Main St., Belleville, IL

How much money is to be raised? Our estimated building cost is $25,000-30,000

Thank you for considering giving to our campaign!  The money you give will greatly increase our ability to "Train Worthy Ambassadors for Jesus Christ."   
What We Need & What You Get We are looking to raise $25,000 as our estimated build cost is $25,000-30,000.  Need more details?  Here is a break down of how we'll use these funds:


  
Remodel of existing upstairs to include: expanded boys and girls restroom,acoustical drop ceiling and lighting, new flooring, dry walling/paint, and structural work - $20,000

Upgraded electronics to include: 6 new media centers with flat screen TVs and DVD players, Microsoft Office suite and Internet filtering software for computer lab, and other learning resources - $5,000-6,000

New learning resources to include: library expansion, storage, and organization, and classroom dividers - $2,000-4,000

story:
I am Nishyirembere Donat and I am passionate about girls' education in Rwanda. Through Startoday Ltd, a registered consultancy firm , Visit  https://twitter.com/startodayltd or https://www.facebook.com/StartodayLtd or http://www.ikaziwacu.blogspot.com  in collaboration with schools, NGOs and Parents , we identified 200 poor young ladies who dropped out before they finish high school education due to poverty or inability of their families to meet the cost of education. The living conditions of these girls are very critical. Some of them have got children before they got married, others are domestic workers while others are underemployed.

These girls are aged between 14 and 24 years from poor backgrounds that are more brilliants and want to join existing Vocational Training Centers in Networking, Multimedia and Software.

We are now coming to you to seek your donation of any amount. We need to raise  $124,200 USD. These funds will cover fees for vocational training per 1 year, school materials and basic living conditions of selected 200 young ladies. The following is the break down for fees for vocational training per trainee per year.


Type of fees

Cost(USD)/trainee/12months

Registration fee

$14

ID Card

  $3

Tuition fee

  $300

Insurance for accident

  $2

Overalls

$15

Caution money

$15

Medical insurance

  $5

Total

  $354

The program will start with March 2015. In addition to the vocational skills, young ladies will gain hand-on-skills and the Startoday Ltd will provide them with coaching and networking opportunity when at school and after graduation.

Join us in this campaign. Help us meet the target and to spread out this campaign! We do love to partner with you. Support and/or invite others to know and contribute to the success of this initiative. Share this campaign to your network.

Donate Now!

Would you like to contact us:

Tel:+250783060187

Email: nidonati@yahoo.com/ ikaziwacu@gmail.com

Link: http://t.co/VvwAY0jaAD

story:
Bringing Chris Hedges to Montana's Capital

We have a great opportunity to bring Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist and author Chris Hedges to Helena, Montana for a speaking engagement on March 11. His talk will be titled "Wages of Rebellion: The Moral Imperative of Revolt."

Hedges is widely seen as a thorn in the side of both political parties and the American elite, a deeply moral writer and activist whose works consistently peel back the veil of popular myth and illusion and expose our nation and culture for what they really are. Many see him as an iconoclast, a luminary. It is a great honor to bring such a speaker to Montana's capital and we don't aim to let the opportunity slip through our fingers.

He is a senior fellow at the Nation Institute and a regular columnist for the website Truthdig.com. He spent nearly two decades as a foreign correspondent, with 15 years at the New York Times before he was pressured to resign for publicly denouncing the Iraq invasion. His recent books include "The World as It Is: Dispatches on the Myth of Human Progress," "Days of Destruction, Days of Revolt," and "Empire of Illusion: The End of Literacy and the Triumph of Spectacle."

The event will be at 7 pm on March 11 at the Holter Museum of Art in Helena. It was organized by Big Sky Investigative Reporting (mtvigilante.org) and Helena Service for Peace and Justice/SERPAJ with additional financial support from the following organizations:

  • 350 Missoula
  • Montana Environmental Information Center
  • Montana Immigration Justice Alliance
  • Montana Women For
  • Taking Action for Peaceful Solutions (Butte)

What We Need

Over the past weeks, the organizers have been hard at work behind the scenes gathering sponsors and raising funds to cover event costs as well as Hedges' speaking fee, travel costs, food and lodging.

So far, we have received about $2,500 in pledges and organization sponsorships. But we need a total of at least $3,500. That means we still need $1,000. But Indiegogo takes a percentage of contributions, so we are asking for $1,100 to make sure we hit our target.

  • This money will go entirely to funding the event, including covering Hedges' speaking fee, travel costs, food and lodging. The organizers are not taking a cut and have personally already chipped in significant amounts of money and time to make this event happen.
  • We received donations of artwork from a great local painter named Robin Maynard. Those donating $20 or more will qualify for great incentives ranging from handmade postcards to full-size acrylic paintings. There are also a couple remaining sponsorship-level opportunities that will include 20 of Maynard's post cards and a signed copy of one of Hedges' books.
  • We don't anticipate having trouble raising these funds, but in the event we do not raise the full amount, we will simply seek a benefactor to cover the remaining costs or the organizers will pay out of pocket.

The Impact

Many in Montana are frustrated by the hollowness of electoral politics. Voting and being involved in campaigning isn't enough because, in a system dominated by corporate cash, incumbents' interests inevitably fail to align with those of common folk. What suffers? The earth. Its inhabitants.

In his 2013 Truthdog.com essay "We Are All Aboard the Pequod," Chris Hedges likened Captain Ahab's self-destructive obsession with the white whale Moby Dick to America's hubristic obsession with endless material progress and our inability to effectively challenge what amounts to madness in our supposed leaders.

"And so we plunge forward in our doomed quest to master the forces that will finally smite us," Hedges wrote. "Those who see where we are going lack the fortitude to rebel. Mutiny was the only salvation for the Pequod’s crew. It is our only salvation. But moral cowardice turns us into hostages."

Such statements are obviously not for the faint of heart. But Hedges is at his best when he's challenging status-quo thinking and cutting through the shallow campaign slogans and empty platitudes of both parties. He's a galvanizing figure, a rare and eloquent writer-activist who isn't afraid to speak about the grave societal need for radical change.

At a time when more and more Montanans' ideas about the world run afoul of party lines and illusory groupthink, the value of bringing a galvanizing speaker to the state's capital should not be underestimated.

    Risks & Challenges

    Is it possible something could happen? That Chris Hedges could get sick and not be able to speak? Of course. Anything is possible. But in the event Hedges is unable to attend at the last moment, we will try to schedule him for another date in the near future. In the event that doesn't work out, we will use the money to bring another speaker who stokes a lot of local interest.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    The best way to help if you can't contribute money is simply to come to the event. Seating will be limited to the first 175-200 attendees. So arrive early or you may be left out.

story:
Einstein said it best,

The definition of insanity is doing the same thing in the same way and expecting different results.

It’s Thanksgiving day 2010 and while you ate your traditional dinner, I buried my brother Thomas Scimone. He was killed at the hands of Suffolk County New York Police. Shot at more than 50 times. Killed while on the ground, according to the coroner’s report. Killed out of ignorance and lack of training.  BUT it doesn’t have to continue. We can make changes, all of us, white, black, wealthy, struggling, no matter where you live in the world, we can make the change, not by spitting, cursing or throwing things at them with wild looting protests but by showing solidarity!

BUY the hat Larry is wearing on the video and wear it! Show your support of (CIT) Crisis Intervention Team training for police.  It is a new line of fashion forward clothing but this first item made by the John and Thomas Company (named after both my brothers)is made for a very specific purpose, to FUND CIT FOR POLICE.   

In addition to lethal weapons, you can give them a SECRET weapon. KNOWLEDGE.  The men & women in uniforms are dealing with something they know little about , how could they, they haven’t been trained! 

1 in 4 families are affected by mental illness. So get them trained in programs such as CIT ---Crisis Intervention Team. It’s been in existence since 1988. This training has proven to save lives, not only for the people on the streets but people in uniforms on the street. It’s a win, win!

These individuals that are hired to protect us are mad they don’t have enough of an understanding to properly handle a society riddled with homelessness, drug and alcohol abuse, violence, crimes and suicide, mostly stemming from brain disorders. 70% of the police shootings involve a person living with a brain disorder. They are killing our homeless, our veterans who fought for our country and young people with toys guns playing in the park. Let’s stop the insanity and come together now!

You must donate at least $25.00 to receive a hat but please give generously for the silence needs to be broken and the price of a lost life is too high to pay. 

ALL OF THE MONEY RAISED FROM THIS CAMPAIGN minus the costs of fees and hats and tees WILL BE GIVEN TO A POLICE DEPT. FOR CIT TRAINING  AND FOR MENTAL HEALTH FIRST AID TRAINING. It will be done through a lottery system so please indicate what police dept you would like to see this much needed training for.

story:
Short Summary

Hi there! My name is Josh Blake 

and I'm the Show Manager of a singing & dancing group called The New Dawn Singers Inc. We're a non-profit organization that was started in the 1960's by my father, John S. Blake, Jr. He had a vision to create a singing group made of young adults that could use their talents to reach the world. Over the years, the group has evolved into creating shows with costumes, dances, and lights/special effects. We have the opportunity of going into the elementary and middle schools across the country, bringing the students a 55-minute show that teaches them all about how to better themselves. The shows include high energy routines, colorful costumes and characters, skits, audience participation, and a fantastic message teaching them topics such as how important they are, how to become the best that they can be, and how to work together to achieve their goals. 

This year, we're creating an assembly on the subject of bullying. These students need someone there in front of them letting them know it's going to be okay and that they are able to make it!  As I search the topic online, I've noticed that there's a need for a school assembly like this that gives them role models to look up to. It's an assembly they can relax and feel safe at and have fun while learning as well.

We need support in order to create the script, costumes, soundtrack, room and board for performers, and travel costs. The show is entitled, "Exploring the C's" and we'll be taking the students across the sea through the songs and skits, while trying to make it fun for them and still learn at the same time!

There are three "C's" that will divide the show into sections....Challenge, Connect, and Contribute. In which we'll relate the topics to their every day lives!

What We Need & What You Get

We need to create the soundtrack for this show, so we'll be needing to hire a song writer/sound engineer to create quality audio tracks and performance rights. That is not a cheap process. We'll also be needing to create new costumes for the cast as well as rent a towing van to drive the trailer and equipment to the schools. 

Most of these kids have never seen a live show before usually because they can't afford to go to anything like this outside of what their school provides for them as an assembly. 

It's an eye opening, jaw dropping, and loud cheering experience for them! I can attest to it, having experienced their reactions to it personally. It really DOES change their lives. I remember coming back into town years after the kids grew up and they saw us at Walmart and the cashier noticed us and said she remembered us from 8 years earlier and that it was her favorite day of the year. She said the kids in her class looked forward to the "New Dawn Singers' Day" all year!!! So I know that we're making a positive impact on them. That's why I'm excited about this! We had taken a couple years off because we couldn't afford to keep backing ourselves like we had been trying to, so we decided to take a break, but the schools are calling us and asking for another show. That's why we've decided to tour again. We knew it was the right thing to do. They need positive influence and encouragement. 

We LOVE performing for these kids and getting to play a part in their lives. Please help us make this show the right way! If we reach the goal or even beyond it, I'll personally add a section into the show promoting this and letting the kids know that YOU helped make this show a reality and how it was all of you, working together to make something great happen! I think it would be a super way to show them how the world can all do something together! 

Even if we don't reach the full goal, whatever funds are raised will still go towards the show and to the rental of the vehicle to bring the equipment to the performances because that's very necessary. 

The Impact

Like I said previously, the proof of impact is in how it shows in the students afterwards. They send us thank you letters in the mail, ask for autographs, want hugs or a high five, they walk through the halls singing the songs from the show, some go on the website and become fans, and they write us years later and tell us that they still remember the message and lessons that we taught and how they've applied it to their lives. Like I mentioned in the video, it just amazes me that we only perform 55 minutes out of the whole year.....yet they remember every minute of it. THAT says something to me and makes me proud to be a part of, not only the show itself, but the making and creation of it as well! :) 

Risks & Challenges

The challenge that we'll be facing is creating the script  that'll deliver a strong enough message in dealing with bullying and how to overcome it.  I think that's the hardest part of the show each year when we create it. It's not only got to teach the students a good life lesson, but it's got to be fun and creative at the same time in order to keep their attention and allow them to remember it. We're doing this so that kids' lives can be changed.....so of course we're up for the challenge! :)

Other Ways You Can Help

There are TONS of ways you can help. If you know anyone who is college age, can sing and dance really well, works well with others on the team, and has a positive personality that enjoys kids, please tell them about us and have them audition. (www.newdawnsingers.com) We'll be casting for the tour very soon. 

I feel like some people might even be able to help by: 

• If you have hotel chain connections, we need to house up to 10 performers/tech on tour for 2 months. You can guess how much that costs. We could use a discount or even donation just for that!

• If you are involved in audio sound equipment or even stage lighting companies, we are always in need of wireless headset microphones and LED stage lighting..all types. The kids LOVE anything that moves and looks cool. It's an instant "Wow!" reaction from the entire audience!!!

• If you have fabric connections, we go through theatrical fabrics like crazy. Sequins and heavy duty fabric doesn't come cheap, but is needed for the amount of wear and "tear" throughout the shows.

• Like I mentioned above, we need a quality van that tows. We've been using a family owned vehicle to pull the trailer but it's on its last wheel. (see what I did there!?) :) It'll drive the cast members to the show as well as tow our trailer.

• We wear through dance sneakers like crazy if any of you have any connections there as well. 

• We always thought it would be neat for the students' sake if we could give a free poster to every student that comes to the performance as a momento.  I'm not sure if anyone has a way of printing large productions of posters that maybe they could donate the printing of? We can't afford it ourselves.

• Bulk bottled water and/or powerade would be appreciated as well for the performers. There is a lot of dancing involved and they work hard. 

I'm just trying to think of ways people could help that's not exactly "money" involved. We could definitely use word of mouth to get the name out there and help book future tours. We also perform regular entertainment shows as well for amusement parks and a few other styles of performances like Holiday shows and Gospel concerts in churches. We go where ever we are needed and try to make people happy at each place we perform. 

Please check out our website at: newdawnsingers.com and use the indiegogo share tools to help spread the word! We also ask that you'll post a photo saying "#SupportNDS" on your social media to help spread the word!


Thank you for your time and all your consideration for this event! :) Let's change some lives!

Blake, Jr. He had a vision to create a singing group made of young adults that could use their talents to reach the world. Over the years, the group has evolved into creating shows with costumes, dances, and lights/special effects. We have the opportunity of going into the elementary and middle schools across the country, bringing the students a 55-minute show that teaches them all about how to better themselves. The shows include high energy routines, colorful costumes and characters, skits, audience participation, and a fantastic message teaching them topics such as how important they are, how to become the best that they can be, and how to work together to achieve their goals. 
This year, we're creating an assembly on the subject of bullying. These students need someone there in front of them letting them know it's going to be okay and that they are able to make it!  As I search the topic online, I've noticed that there's a need for a school assembly like this that gives them role models to look up to. It's an assembly they can relax and feel safe at and have fun while learning as well.
We need support in order to create the script, costumes, soundtrack, room and board for performers, and travel costs. The show is entitled, "Exploring the C's" and we'll be taking the students across the sea through the songs and skits, while trying to make it fun for them and still learn at the same time!

There are three "C's" that will divide the show into sections....Challenge, Connect, and Contribute. In which we'll relate the topics to their every day lives!   What We Need & What You Get We need to create the soundtrack for this show, so we'll be needing to hire a song writer/sound engineer to create quality audio tracks and performance rights. That is not a cheap process. We'll also be needing to create new costumes for the cast as well as rent a towing van to drive the trailer and equipment to the schools. 
Most of these kids have never seen a live show before usually because they can't afford to go to anything like this outside of what their school provides for them as an assembly. 

It's an eye opening, jaw dropping, and loud cheering experience for them! I can attest to it, having experienced their reactions to it personally. It really DOES change their lives. I remember coming back into town years after the kids grew up and they saw us at Walmart and the cashier noticed us and said she remembered us from 8 years earlier and that it was her favorite day of the year. She said the kids in her class looked forward to the "New Dawn Singers' Day" all year!!! So I know that we're making a positive impact on them. That's why I'm excited about this! We had taken a couple years off because we couldn't afford to keep backing ourselves like we had been trying to, so we decided to take a break, but the schools are calling us and asking for another show. That's why we've decided to tour again. We knew it was the right thing to do. They need positive influence and encouragement. 

We LOVE performing for these kids and getting to play a part in their lives. Please help us make this show the right way! If we reach the goal or even beyond it, I'll personally add a section into the show promoting this and letting the kids know that YOU helped make this show a reality and how it was all of you, working together to make something great happen! I think it would be a super way to show them how the world can all do something together! 
Even if we don't reach the full goal, whatever funds are raised will still go towards the show and to the rental of the vehicle to bring the equipment to the performances because that's very necessary.    The Impact Like I said previously, the proof of impact is in how it shows in the students afterwards. They send us thank you letters in the mail, ask for autographs, want hugs or a high five, they walk through the halls singing the songs from the show, some go on the website and become fans, and they write us years later and tell us that they still remember the message and lessons that we taught and how they've applied it to their lives. Like I mentioned in the video, it just amazes me that we only perform 55 minutes out of the whole year.....yet they remember every minute of it. THAT says something to me and makes me proud to be a part of, not only the show itself, but the making and creation of it as well! :) 
    Risks & Challenges The challenge that we'll be facing is creating the script  that'll deliver a strong enough message in dealing with bullying and how to overcome it.  I think that's the hardest part of the show each year when we create it. It's not only got to teach the students a good life lesson, but it's got to be fun and creative at the same time in order to keep their attention and allow them to remember it. We're doing this so that kids' lives can be changed.....so of course we're up for the challenge! :)
Other Ways You Can Help
 There are TONS of ways you can help. If you know anyone who is college age, can sing and dance really well, works well with others on the team, and has a positive personality that enjoys kids, please tell them about us and have them audition. (www.newdawnsingers.com) We'll be casting for the tour very soon. 
I feel like some people might even be able to help by: 
• If you have hotel chain connections, we need to house up to 10 performers/tech on tour for 2 months. You can guess how much that costs. We could use a discount or even donation just for that!
• If you are involved in audio sound equipment or even stage lighting companies, we are always in need of wireless headset microphones and LED stage lighting..all types. The kids LOVE anything that moves and looks cool. It's an instant "Wow!" reaction from the entire audience!!!
• If you have fabric connections, we go through theatrical fabrics like crazy. Sequins and heavy duty fabric doesn't come cheap, but is needed for the amount of wear and "tear" throughout the shows.
• Like I mentioned above, we need a quality van that tows. We've been using a family owned vehicle to pull the trailer but it's on its last wheel. (see what I did there!?) :) It'll drive the cast members to the show as well as tow our trailer.
• We wear through dance sneakers like crazy if any of you have any connections there as well. 
• We always thought it would be neat for the students' sake if we could give a free poster to every student that comes to the performance as a momento.  I'm not sure if anyone has a way of printing large productions of posters that maybe they could donate the printing of? We can't afford it ourselves.
• Bulk bottled water and/or powerade would be appreciated as well for the performers. There is a lot of dancing involved and they work hard. 
I'm just trying to think of ways people could help that's not exactly "money" involved. We could definitely use word of mouth to get the name out there and help book future tours. We also perform regular entertainment shows as well for amusement parks and a few other styles of performances like Holiday shows and Gospel concerts in churches. We go where ever we are needed and try to make people happy at each place we perform. 
Please check out our website at: newdawnsingers.com and use the indiegogo share tools to help spread the word! We also ask that you'll post a photo saying "#SupportNDS" on your social media to help spread the word!



Thank you for your time and all your consideration for this event! :) Let's change some lives!

story:
... for the first time ever!

To do so, the travel costs for each of these competitive, female, 30-somethings will be astronomical. Any support you might provide to make this happen, would be so loved.

Your support would also mean that the best players could represent Atlantic Canada in the 2015 Canadian Ultimate Championships (CUC) in Winnipeg, Manitoba (and not just the ones who have the financial resources to do so).

I chose Moncton as our location for this campaign, because the system made me chose one location and I figured Moncton is pretty central. Our roster does contain players who live in communities throughout the Atlantic provinces and will be announced soon, so please stay tuned.

For more info on THE COLLECTIVE, visit: https://www.facebook.com/groups/193548364081069/

For more info on CUC in Winnipeg: https://canadianultimate.com/p/winnipeg-to-host...

story:
I am organizing a project to bring students from Folkwang University in Germany  to Palestine to give music workshops. The idea came after I had been there for a month, volunteering as a music teacher. When I got back to Germany, to continue my studies, I realized that I wanted to do something else to support the development of classical music education in Palestine, as well as to share my experiences with my fellow students.
After I talked to several students, I found a group of seven, that shared my enthusiasm. The group consists of two violinists, two violists, two cellists and myself as a double bassist. We want to give individual lessons and play together in groups with the students of the music institutes in Palestine. At the end of our 10-day stay, the children will give a concert for family, friends, neighbors, etc.
The money that will be raised with the campaign will be used for travel costs, accommodation and insurances. In case we raise more money than we need for our project, it will be donated to support the music education in Palestine. We are happy with every contribution supporting our campaign. If you are not able to support financially, you could still help by sharing this campaign with friends and family.

As an alternative option to donate, you can also transfer directly to my bankaccount and I will transfer it to this website. If you do, please send me a message as well.
IBAN: NL43 RABO 0102 6604 92
BIC: RABONL2U

Images in de video are from Sounds of Palestine (www.soundsofpalestine.org), Edward Said National Conservatory of Music (http://ncm.birzeit.edu/en) and the Evenos Quartett (https://www.facebook.com/pages/Evenos-Quartett/689411897791267?sk=info&tab=page_info)

story:
Ayahuasca Reader Book - Worldwide Launch Campaign

Join us in the global launch of the Ayahuasca Reader. This beautiful book is the most comprehensive and authoritative source of information about ayahuasca, the extraordinary vine from the Amazon that is finding more widespread use for healing, spiritual awakening and a new ecological awareness. Edited by two renowned experts in the field, Luis Eduardo Luna and Steven F. White, this book provides a vital and timely transmission of knowledge, including contributions from Amazonian shamans, scientific researchers, visionary artists, primary historical sources, and other experts who have had significant experience of the wisdom of ayahuasca. Given the importance of this knowledge, we have committed to spreading this message far beyond standard publishing scenarios.

"The Ayahuasca Reader explains the necessity of integrating ayahuasca into Western culture, and educated its readers to do their part to facilitate that process." - Rick Doblin, Founder, Executive Director, MAPS

Synergetic Press is mounting a global publishing and educational outreach campaign about ayahuasca. With growing interest in this plant medicine, more people are discovering the many health benefits of this potent brew, including the treatment of conditions ranging from Alzheimer’s and Parkinson’s to PTSD and depression.

But at the same time that Western doctors and researchers are taking note of its potential for humanity, the very cultures and rainforest environment where it came from continue to be threatened and we risk losing irreplaceable knowledge, as well as the healing plants themselves. 

The Ayahuasca Reader Campaign aims to shine a bright light on this relatively unknown plant and the cultures who have used ayahuasca for thousands of years. Our goal is to inform people across all sectors – from environmentalists to psychologists, from entertainers to philanthropists, from anthropologists to corporate leaders – about the healing benefits of ayahuasca, the "vine of the soul," its transformative powers and potential to promote well-being for people and planet. 

"... An interdisciplinary cornucopia, a comprehensive volume overflowing with valuable insights, paradigm-shifting discoveries, and a bounty of rare knowledge. A wide variety of perspectives are expressed, and a broad range of disciplines are utilized, in this extraordinary collection of essays, written by a stellar cast of contributors.  David Jay Brown, author of Dreaming Wide Awake

 

Why Is The Information In This Book So Important Now?

The Ayahuasca Reader tells the story of ayahuasca from many perspectives. The book explores the many aspects of this healing brew, providing cultural context from Amazonian shamans, offering a wealth of scientific and medical understanding, detailing its spiritual and religious use, as well as illustrating its role in both literary and artistic expression.

The book includes contributions from over forty of the most respected authorities such as Richard Spruce, Gerardo Reichel-Dolmatoff, Ralph Metzner, Dennis McKenna, Wade Davis, Graham Hancock, Susana Bustos, Luis Eduardo Luna, Alex Grey, Allyson Grey, Martina Hoffmann and many others, whose work, when taken as a whole, is indeed potent medicine itself.

Why We Are Launching This Campaign & Use of Raised Funds

Synergetic Press does more than just publish books. We promote evolutionary ideas through books, both print and digital, as well as holding symposiums and salons, producing webinars and podcasts. The money generated through this campaign helps us to pay for costs of printing and permission fees for this quality anthology, international marketing efforts, educational outreach and distribution to non-traditional outlets. As a small, independent publisher, our team is composed of a few passionate individuals who are dedicated to spreading these ideas at this vital moment in time.

The funds raised will get enable us to get the book to leaders of influential organizations around the world, developing partnerships with groups working in both consciousness and environmentalism, extending the book’s content through social media channels, and organizing interdisciplinary symposiums (with three initial events already planned for New York, London and San Francisco). It will help us to launch an online quarterly Synergy Journal to circulate news, events and informative content related to this and our other titles.

Earth Consciousness event in Santa Fe, April 2016

Thanks in Advance for Your Support!

We can’t do it alone. We’re counting on you to share this knowledge and experience presented in this exceptional book. Get your own copy of the Ayahuasca Reader, explore our other incentives, and find the level of support that works for you! And please share this with any friends or colleagues who you feel will also appreciate this initiative.

Click on the cover to view excerpt from the book: 

 

"This book is a classic in the ayahuasca literature. Even if you already have the first edition on your shelf, you will want to add a copy of the second edition to your collection (and you’ll want to tell your friends too!)" –Dennis J. McKenna, PhD, ethnopharmacologist, Director of Ethnopharmacology, Heffter Research Institute

 

Praise for Ayahuasca Reader

"A wonderful book of vivid reports, illuminating every aspect of Ayahuasca‘s own world, covering all that matters about these plant spirits and their worldwide impact. This book’s poetry and scope led me to honor, as never before, the gifts we are offered from the proper use of these plants."
    –James Fadiman, PhD, psychologist, researcher and author, The Psychedelic Explorer’s Guide

“An invaluable resource and a must-read for anyone interested in ayahuasca." 
    –Jeremy Narby, PhD, Amazonian Project Director, Nouvelle Planete 

“Given the plethora of publications on ayahuasca, it is sometimes difficult to know which are the worthiest. That being said, the Ayahuasca Reader is a classic.”
                        –Mark Plotkin, PhD, ethnobotanist, Founder & Director Amazon Conservation Team

“Gives scholarly, acute, practical takes on one of the most remarkable substances any shaman has ever mastered.”—John Allen FLS, Inventor of Biosphere 2, Pioneer of Biospheric Science.

“It’s a book that’s a keeper for the spirited and for the mind, and an antidote for anyone who’s sensing her/his brain is half dead from pop culture or the corporate news. Enjoy."  —Jay Levin, Founder and former Editor-     in Chief, LA Weekly newspaper

“...the curanderos, daring scientists, and visionary artists represented here are voices in the vanguard helping us to understand what it will really mean to be an Earthling in the years to come.” —Michael Garfield, Artist/Futurist, Global Communities Director of Symbio Life Sciences

(Painting "La Chacruna" by Martina Hoffmann)

Editors

LUIS EDUARDO LUNA (pictured left) holds a PhD from the Department of Comparative Religion Stockholm University (1989) and an honorary doctoral degree from St. Lawrence, Canton, New York (2002).  He retired in 2011 from the Department of Modern Language and Communication at the Hanken School of Economics, Helsinki. He was an Assistant Professor in Anthropology (1994-1998) at the Department of Anthropology of Santa Catarina Federal University (UFSC) in Florianópolis, Brazil. Dr. Luna is the author of Vegetalismo: Shamanism among the Mestizo
Population of the Peruvian Amazon (1986), a co-author with Pablo Amaringo of Ayahuasca Visions: The Religious Iconography of a Peruvian Shaman (1991), and co-author with Slawek Wojtowicz, Rick Strassman and Ede Frecska of Inner Paths to Outer Space: Journeys Through Psychedelics and Other Spiritual Technologies (2008).  Dr. Luna is the Director of the Research Center for the Study of Psychointegrator Plants, Visionary Art and Consciousness, Florianópolis, Brazil.

STEVEN F. WHITE (pictured right) received a BA in English from Williams College, MA and PhD degrees in Spanish from the University of Oregon. He has lived and worked in many Latin American countries, an opportunity that enabled him to edit bilingual anthologies of poetry from Nicaragua, Chile and Brazil as well as to study candomblé, South American shamanism and Santo Daime. His research in recent years has focused on the environment and ecocriticism in publications that include El mundo más que humano en la poesía de Pablo Antonio Cuadra: un estudio ecocrítico, Arando el aire: la ecología en la poesía y la música de Nicaragua and El consumo de lo que somos: muestra de poesía ecológica hispánica contemporánea. He was guest editor of a special edition of Review: Literature and Arts of the Americas on Eco-Literature and Arts in Latin America. His article “Shamanic Ayahuasca Narratives and the Production of Neo-Indigenista Literature” appeared in Latin American Indian Literatures Journal. He also co-translated Federico García Lorca’s, Poet in New York and The Angel of Rain, by Gastón Baquero. His published poetry includes Escanciador de pócimas and Bajo la palabra de las plantas (poesía selecta: 1979-2009), which has a series of poems based on paintings by Pablo Amaringo. He has been teaching at St. Lawrence University since 1987, and is one of the co-founders of its Caribbean and Latin American Studies program.

Alex Grey, Net of Being

(poster)

 

 

 

 

Some of the contributors include:

RALPH METZNER PhD, is a recognized pioneer in psychological and cross-cultural studies of consciousness and its transformations. He is a psychotherapist and Professor Emeritus at the California Institute of Integral Studies. His books include The Unfolding Self; The Well of Remembrance; Green Psychology; The Expansion of Consciousness; Worlds Within and Worlds Beyond; and Mind Space and Time Stream. He is the editor of two collections of essays on ayahuasca and of psilocybin mushrooms and is coauthor with Ram Dass of Birth of a Psychedelic Culture: Conversations about Leary, the Harvard Experiments, Millbrook and the Sixties.

ALEX GREY, artist, poet, author, minister, is best loved for his paintings portraying multiple dimensions of reality, interweaving biological anatomy with psychic and spiritual energies. His books, Sacred Mirrors, The Mission of Art, Transfigurations, Art Psalms and Net of Being, trace the visions and mystical experiences that shaped his spiritual creative life and address how art can evolve the cultural body through icons of interconnectedness. Co-founded with his wife, the artist Allyson Grey, Chapel of Sacred Mirrors, CoSM is an interfaith church celebrating creativity as a spiritual path. Alex has long been a practitioner of Buddhism and has taken a stand for cognitive liberty. More at www.alexgrey.com

DENNIS J. MCKENNA was born in 1950 and has pursued the interdisciplinary study of ethnomedicine and plant hallucinogens for the last forty-five years. He received his doctorate in 1984 from the University of British Columbia and subsequently obtained a fellowship at the National Institute of Mental Health, where he conducted research that he continued at Stanford University in the Department of Neurology. He has worked for Shaman Pharmaceuticals and the Aveda Corporation, and currently is a scientific consultant for clients in the herbal, nutritional, and pharmaceutical industries. He is an Assistant Professor in the Center for Spirituality and Healing at the University of Minnesota, and teaches courses in Ethnopharmacology and Botanical Medicines. He is a founding board member of the Heffter Research Institute, a non-profit institution dedicated to the development of therapeutic applications for psychedelic medicines. He co-edited (with his brother Terence) The Invisible Landscape: Mind, Hallucinogens and the I Ching and is the author or co-author of over 50 peer-reviewed scientific papers. His memoir, The Brotherhood of the Screaming Abyss: My Life with Terence McKenna, was published in 2012. He lives in St. Paul, Minnesota with his wife Sheila.

GRAHAM HANCOCK is the author of the non-fiction bestsellers The Sign and The Seal, Fingerprints of the Gods, The Message of the Sphinx, Heaven’s Mirror, Underworld and Supernatural, and of the novels Entangled: The Eater of Souls, War God: Nights of the Witch, and War God: Return of the Plumed Serpent. His nonfiction books have been translated into thirty languages and have sold more than seven million copies worldwide.

 

WADE DAVIS is Professor of Anthropology and the BC Leadership Chair in Cultures and Ecosystems at Risk at the University of British Columbia. Between 1999 and 2013 he served as Explorer-in-Residence at the National Geographic Society and is currently a member of the NGS Explorers Council. Author of 17 books, including The Serpent and the Rainbow, One River, The Wayfinders and The Sacred Headwaters, he holds degrees in anthropology and biology and received his PhD in ethnobotany, all from Harvard University. His many film credits include Light at the Edge of the World, an eight-hour documentary series written and produced for the National Geographic. Davis is the recipient of 11 honorary degrees, as well as the 2009 Gold Medal from the Royal Canadian Geographical Society for his contributions to anthropology and conservation, the 2011 Explorers Medal, the highest award of the Explorers Club, the 2012 David Fairchild Medal for botanical exploration, and the 2013 Ness Medal for geography education from the Royal Geographical Society. His recent book, Into the Silence, received the 2012 Samuel Johnson prize, the top award for literary nonfiction in the English language.

MARTINA HOFFMANN has spoken about visionary art and culture at the “International Symposium on Altered States of Consciousness,” University of Cuernavaca, the “Promethean Impulse: Consciousness & Art,” Museum HR Giger in Gruyeres, Switzerland, “Chimeria” in France, “All Chemical Conference” in Kona, HI, “Mindstates Conference” in Berkeley, the “Prophets Conference” in Santa Fe, NM, “Women’s Visionary Congress at IONS,” CA, “Alchemeyez,“ HI, the “International Amazonian Shamanism Conference” in Iquitos, Peru, “Burning Man,” (USA) and the “Boom Festival” in Portugal. Her work has been published in books such as Albert Hofmann und Sein LSD (2011), The Visionary World of Hansruedi Giger by Stanislav Grof (2009), Be the Change by Ed and Deb Shapiro (2009), Inner Paths To Outer Space (2008), Metamorphosis (2007), True Visions (2006), and others. Currently, she works primarily at her Colorado studio. She has exhibited her work worldwide since 1985 and also designs “Urban Shaman” empowering yoga and street wear.

Thanks for the Video Soundtrack: Xavante by Govinda, Creation Matrix by Kalpaturu Tree from Critical Beats for Gaia (Earthdance Music)

Please note: Supporter Recognition with links on our website and social media is subject to review for safe and appropriate content.

He was an Assistant Professor in Anthropology (1994-1998) at the Department of Anthropology of Santa Catarina Federal University (UFSC) in Florianópolis, Brazil. Dr. Luna is the author of Vegetalismo: Shamanism among the MestizoPopulation of the Peruvian Amazon (1986), a co-author with Pablo Amaringo of Ayahuasca Visions: The Religious Iconography of a Peruvian Shaman (1991), and co-author with Slawek Wojtowicz, Rick Strassman and Ede Frecska of Inner Paths to Outer Space: Journeys Through Psychedelics and Other Spiritual Technologies (2008).  Dr. Luna is the Director of the Research Center for the Study of Psychointegrator Plants, Visionary Art and Consciousness, Florianópolis, Brazil.STEVEN F. WHITE (pictured right) received a BA in English from Williams College, MA and PhD degrees in Spanish from the University of Oregon. He has lived and worked in many Latin American countries, an opportunity that enabled him to edit bilingual anthologies of poetry from Nicaragua, Chile and Brazil as well as to study candomblé, South American shamanism and Santo Daime. His research in recent years has focused on the environment and ecocriticism in publications that include El mundo más que humano en la poesía de Pablo Antonio Cuadra: un estudio ecocrítico, Arando el aire: la ecología en la poesía y la música de Nicaragua and El consumo de lo que somos: muestra de poesía ecológica hispánica contemporánea. He was guest editor of a special edition of Review: Literature and Arts of the Americas on Eco-Literature and Arts in Latin America. His article “Shamanic Ayahuasca Narratives and the Production of Neo-Indigenista Literature” appeared in Latin American Indian Literatures Journal. He also co-translated Federico García Lorca’s, Poet in New York and The Angel of Rain, by Gastón Baquero. His published poetry includes Escanciador de pócimas and Bajo la palabra de las plantas (poesía selecta: 1979-2009), which has a series of poems based on paintings by Pablo Amaringo. He has been teaching at St. Lawrence University since 1987, and is one of the co-founders of its Caribbean and Latin American Studies program.Alex Grey, Net of Being(poster)    Some of the contributors include:RALPH METZNER PhD, is a recognized pioneer in psychological and cross-cultural studies of consciousness and its transformations. He is a psychotherapist and Professor Emeritus at the California Institute of Integral Studies. His books include The Unfolding Self; The Well of Remembrance; Green Psychology; The Expansion of Consciousness; Worlds Within and Worlds Beyond; and Mind Space and Time Stream. He is the editor of two collections of essays on ayahuasca and of psilocybin mushrooms and is coauthor with Ram Dass of Birth of a Psychedelic Culture: Conversations about Leary, the Harvard Experiments, Millbrook and the Sixties.ALEX GREY, artist, poet, author, minister, is best loved for his paintings portraying multiple dimensions of reality, interweaving biological anatomy with psychic and spiritual energies. His books, Sacred Mirrors, The Mission of Art, Transfigurations, Art Psalms and Net of Being, trace the visions and mystical experiences that shaped his spiritual creative life and address how art can evolve the cultural body through icons of interconnectedness. Co-founded with his wife, the artist Allyson Grey, Chapel of Sacred Mirrors, CoSM is an interfaith church celebrating creativity as a spiritual path. Alex has long been a practitioner of Buddhism and has taken a stand for cognitive liberty. More at www.alexgrey.comDENNIS J. MCKENNA was born in 1950 and has pursued the interdisciplinary study of ethnomedicine and plant hallucinogens for the last forty-five years. He received his doctorate in 1984 from the University of British Columbia and subsequently obtained a fellowship at the National Institute of Mental Health, where he conducted research that he continued at Stanford University in the Department of Neurology. He has worked for Shaman Pharmaceuticals and the Aveda Corporation, and currently is a scientific consultant for clients in the herbal, nutritional, and pharmaceutical industries. He is an Assistant Professor in the Center for Spirituality and Healing at the University of Minnesota, and teaches courses in Ethnopharmacology and Botanical Medicines. He is a founding board member of the Heffter Research Institute, a non-profit institution dedicated to the development of therapeutic applications for psychedelic medicines. He co-edited (with his brother Terence) The Invisible Landscape: Mind, Hallucinogens and the I Ching and is the author or co-author of over 50 peer-reviewed scientific papers. His memoir, The Brotherhood of the Screaming Abyss: My Life with Terence McKenna, was published in 2012. He lives in St. Paul, Minnesota with his wife Sheila.GRAHAM HANCOCK is the author of the non-fiction bestsellers The Sign and The Seal, Fingerprints of the Gods, The Message of the Sphinx, Heaven’s Mirror, Underworld and Supernatural, and of the novels Entangled: The Eater of Souls, War God: Nights of the Witch, and War God: Return of the Plumed Serpent. His nonfiction books have been translated into thirty languages and have sold more than seven million copies worldwide. WADE DAVIS is Professor of Anthropology and the BC Leadership Chair in Cultures and Ecosystems at Risk at the University of British Columbia. Between 1999 and 2013 he served as Explorer-in-Residence at the National Geographic Society and is currently a member of the NGS Explorers Council. Author of 17 books, including The Serpent and the Rainbow, One River, The Wayfinders and The Sacred Headwaters, he holds degrees in anthropology and biology and received his PhD in ethnobotany, all from Harvard University. His many film credits include Light at the Edge of the World, an eight-hour documentary series written and produced for the National Geographic. Davis is the recipient of 11 honorary degrees, as well as the 2009 Gold Medal from the Royal Canadian Geographical Society for his contributions to anthropology and conservation, the 2011 Explorers Medal, the highest award of the Explorers Club, the 2012 David Fairchild Medal for botanical exploration, and the 2013 Ness Medal for geography education from the Royal Geographical Society. His recent book, Into the Silence, received the 2012 Samuel Johnson prize, the top award for literary nonfiction in the English language.MARTINA HOFFMANN has spoken about visionary art and culture at the “International Symposium on Altered States of Consciousness,” University of Cuernavaca, the “Promethean Impulse: Consciousness & Art,” Museum HR Giger in Gruyeres, Switzerland, “Chimeria” in France, “All Chemical Conference” in Kona, HI, “Mindstates Conference” in Berkeley, the “Prophets Conference” in Santa Fe, NM, “Women’s Visionary Congress at IONS,” CA, “Alchemeyez,“ HI, the “International Amazonian Shamanism Conference” in Iquitos, Peru, “Burning Man,” (USA) and the “Boom Festival” in Portugal. Her work has been published in books such as Albert Hofmann und Sein LSD (2011), The Visionary World of Hansruedi Giger by Stanislav Grof (2009), Be the Change by Ed and Deb Shapiro (2009), Inner Paths To Outer Space (2008), Metamorphosis (2007), True Visions (2006), and others. Currently, she works primarily at her Colorado studio. She has exhibited her work worldwide since 1985 and also designs “Urban Shaman” empowering yoga and street wear.Thanks for the Video Soundtrack: Xavante by Govinda, Creation Matrix by Kalpaturu Tree from Critical Beats for Gaia (Earthdance Music)Please note: Supporter Recognition with links on our website and social media is subject to review for safe and appropriate content.

story:
My Story

My name is Logan Tyler Nelson, I am a Junior at Northern Illinois University. I consider myself very independent. My mother passed away when I was eleven and my Father, although a hard working, loving, and by far my number one fan is in no place to help me finance my college. My closest family and my utlimate support system includes my Aunt Jeanice, Aunt Jenette, Aunt Rhonda, and my Sister. The people who took me in when I was without a Mom and in need of some love and assurance that life goes on even when we lose our parents. 

I am the first person in my family to go to a four year college. I have paid for my own car, I have my own phone plan, car insurance, and have paid other expenses on my own since high school. With no savings or a college fund, I've been working my butt off to stay in school. 

All I want to do is be an example to people that no matter what your past is, where you come from, or obstacles you have in front of you; if you really want something, you can make it happen. Most importantly, I want to finish what I started and set out the goal that I WILL graduate from a four- year university. 


The Impact

MY ulitmate goal is to become so good at what I do I can't be denied. 

    • With this program and how well it prepares you as an actor; the people who graduate from there are so incredible in their craft that they become hard to deny. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate I totally understand, but if you could at the very least share my story that would mean the world to me. 


Thank you for taking the time out of your day to read and view this profile,


Best regards (С наилучшими пожеланиями),

Logan Nelson

story:
There are better ways to treat disease, to improve quality of life, and for everyone to live longer and healthier. Regenerative medicine holds the promise of that life by revolutionizing how we practice medicine. I want to learn how to work in regenerative medicine to bring these innovations to patients who need it. I want to bring this skill set back to Canada, and to Saskatchewan especially. In order to do this, I am taking a year to do research in regenerative medicine. I have two offers from leading researchers at world-renowned research institutes, but I need your help to pay for these opportunities. Please join with me so that together we can work to help bring regenerative medicine to people who need it.

What is regenerative medicine?
Regenerative medicine is a fascinating field that makes use of stem cells, tissue engineering, gene therapy, cellular communication, and even bionic devices to develop new medical treatments, and has the potential to revolutionize the practice of medicine. Two researchers in Canada, Doctors James Till and Ernest McCulloch, were the first to demonstrate the existence of stem cells in 1961 (Dr. Till was born in Lloydminster and attended the University of Saskatchewan). Since that time, there have been many advances in the field, and there have already been several examples of treatment successes with regenerative medicine.

As the research continues to push forward, the successes grow every year. In centres around the world, research continues to develop many other treatments, including cartilage to treat arthritis, blood vessels for by-pass surgeries, growing heart valves, repairing the heart after a heart attack, repairing spinal cord injuries to allow paraplegics and quadriplegics to walk again, stem cell transplants to treat blindness, therapies to treat genetic diseases, new ways to test pharmaceuticals, and even printing and growing complex organs. The revolutionary potential of regenerative medicine is awe inspiring.

Some of this research has already begun to be used to treat patients. In 2006, researchers at the Wake Forest Institute for Regenerative Medicine reported on their success in creating new bladders for patients with a severe form of spina bifida that also affects the bladder. Last year (2014), using a combination of off-the-shelf biological scaffold materials and targeted physiotherapy, researchers at the McGowan Institute for Regenerative Medicine were able to help trauma victims and veterans wounded in combat to regrow new muscle and tendon tissue, and gain a much-improved quality of life. In April 2013, a 2 ½-year-old girl from Korea was given a trachea grown using stem cells and a plastic scaffold after she was born without a trachea, and this technique has also been used in cancer treatments. Scientists and doctors have developed technology to treat burn patients, including growing skin for skin grafts and spray guns to deposit skin stem cells on burns. Researchers here in Canada, including physician scientists here in Saskatchewan, have played a pioneering role in the use of stem cell transplants for treatment of Parkinson's Disease. There are many others therapies that have been and are being proven in clinical trials. People are already benefiting from regenerative medicine treatments, and there is potential for so much more.

Why am I doing this?
I recently graduated from the University of Saskatchewan College of Medicine in Saskatoon, SK, Canada, and I have decided to take a year off between medical school and residency training to do research in regenerative medicine. Regenerative medicine has been an interest of mine since I was 12 when saw the tissue engineering proof-of-concept Vacanti mouse on a TV show. Seeing how they grew this surgically-implanted ear using tissue engineering, I was inspired, and I knew there was so many more possibilities in this area. When I decided to become a medical doctor, I knew regenerative medicine was an area that I wanted to work in; there is so much potential to help people  by providing better treatments than what we have now. I have made efforts to learn about regenerative medicine during my education: I participated in a tissue engineering research project trying to develop a way to repair damaged nerves using stem cells, and I attended two week-long courses in the US on regenerative medicine. But there are few physicians working in regenerative medicine, so I have not had experience with regenerative medicine in a clinical setting. My career goal is to focus on regenerative medicine so I can help bring this exciting field to the bedside. Some day, I would like to see a centre for regenerative medicine research here in Saskatoon. However, regenerative medicine is not a clinical specialty, meaning that I will need to find my own way into this field from the clinical side. From my experiences over the next year, I hope to learn more about my career options, and I will use that to guide my training towards a medical career in regenerative medicine.

What am I going to be doing?
Over the next year, I have two offers from researchers at world-leading research institutes to come do research under their guidance. I have an offer for three months at the Medical Research Council Centre for Regenerative Medicine in Edinburgh, UK with Dr. Pierre Bagnaninchi and Dr. Leonard Nelson. In the new year, I have another offer for four months at the University of Pittsburgh McGowan Institute for Regenerative Medicine with Dr. Stephen Badylak. For the purpose of these two research observerships, I will be considered a visiting scholar.

There are also a series of major conferences that have been organized in the next academic year that I am going to attend. I attended the TERMIS World Congress 2015 in Boston, MA; this was the Tissue Engineering and Regenerative Medicine International Society's major conference that is held every three years. The World Conference on Regenerative Medicine being held in Leipzig, DE is a major interdisciplinary conference held in Europe. The Till & McCulloch Meetings are being held in Toronto, ON this year, and feature the major players in regenerative medicine here in Canada. These conferences are holding panels to discuss career prospects and planning in regenerative medicine that would really help me to decide on a career path for medical specialty training.

Why am I doing crowdfunding?
I am very excited to take part in these learning opportunities, and to find my career in regenerative medicine, but I have hit a few roadblocks. I need to come up with enough funding to cover minimum wage in these countries before they will officially offer me the positions. However, there are also a lot of other expenses that I will encounter over the next year, including travel expenses, conference fees, work visas, etc. Unfortunately, I am falling between the cracks for funding. I am no longer a student and I have not started residency, which means that I do not qualify for scholarships and student loans. I am also not an employed faculty member, researcher, nor licenced physician, meaning I do not have a salary nor can I apply for research grants that would normally fund my research work. There appears to be no funding for endeavours like what I am doing, so I have to go this alone. I have been trying to find funding for several months, but everything has come up empty, which is why I have decided to try crowdfunding.

I need your help to do this, so please contribute to my fund, and please share my request with everyone you know. Together we can make this amazing learning opportunity happen. Thank you for your support!

If you would like more information about either research institutions, here are the links to their websites:
MRC Centre for Regenerative Medicine http://www.crm.ed.ac.uk/
McGowan Institute for Regenerative Medicine http://www.mirm.pitt.edu/

P.S. If you donate, but do not wish to receive your perk or parts of your perk (e.g. being mentioned publicly), please let me know.

story:
UPDATE :
BORG Beta is available from gautamji.com/borg


This campaign was not successful so I could not add all the features planned. The core features (downloader, videoplayer, notes, library) are all ready, but utilities like TODO and calendar are not.

Anybody interested in supporting BORG can do so here


What is BORG?

BORG is a Free to use, Study companion and downloader, enabling you to download videos, PDFs, and other course materials from coursera, edx and NPTEL in a very organized and efficient way. 

Each course gets downloaded in its folder, with each subsection in its own folder.
It has a very easy to use interface and you can select individual resources, weeks/sections, and even the whole course for download.

Downloads never break in Borg. It resumes every download from where the connection broke.

Borg also has speed management features. You can set a download at low speed and let it run in the background without it interfering with you work.

 

it has a video player to watch online as well as downloaded course videos

You can take notes while watching, it pauses the video automatically while you write, and it saves the notes according to the video time-stamp.

Feel like doodling while watching videos? It has a drawing pad too.

It has time tracking features, it logs events and gives you the summary of which videos you have watched and how much time you have spent on what.
You can add your own events to the logger too.

If you are like me and keep forgetting to take a break, Borg has a break reminder too. You can set the time and duration of breaks.

I am also bundling many helpful utilities in Borg, which will help you in your studies.

  • ToDo List
  • Calculator
  • Countdown Timer
  • Event Logger
  • Flash cards
  • Drawing Pad

Its not just all work though, it will also have some games to help you unwind.

The best thing about BORG? It will be free for personal use.

Borg will be available for Windows and Mac OS.
And if there is enough funding and interest, I plan to launch it for Linux, Android and iOS too.

Please donate towards its maintenance and development.

My goal with Borg is for students to benefit from this. As many students as possible.

 

Why is it needed?
The free education provided by MOOCs is most needed in third world countries, where bandwidth available during day time is low and watching all videos online is a difficult task.

Generally ISPs offer higher speeds at lower costs only at night.
Because of that it makes it difficult for students to study, and in the process missing the world class education provided.

Some allow you to download videos one at a time. The problem with that is that you have to download a video, rename it, organize it in the course folder. And you have to repeat this process for each video and resource that you want. This makes the process even more tedious.

A tool like BORG was badly missed when I started studying, as my inability to study during the day, due to low bandwidth, led me to study late at night, resulting in bad health.

 

 

 

How can you help?

 

By spreading the message, and making more students aware of BORG. In the process making their online education easier.

Funding me on indiegogo. - A lot of thought, time and effort has gone in to make this product easy to use for a non technical person. I want to keep this product absolutely free of cost for all MOOCers. And your contribution will go a long way in achieving that.

 

 

Some screen shots and features -

Select course from user's course list, on demand courses too!

Download what you want

 


Full featured download manager with bandwidth management

 

 


Organized courses and subsections.

 

Auto Resume downloads in case you lose internet connection.

In the process making their online education easier.Funding me on indiegogo. - A lot of thought, time and effort has gone in to make this product easy to use for a non technical person. I want to keep this product absolutely free of cost for all MOOCers. And your contribution will go a long way in achieving that.  Some screen shots and features - Select course from user's course list, on demand courses too!Download what you want Full featured download manager with bandwidth management  Organized courses and subsections. Auto Resume downloads in case you lose internet connection.

story:
How We Help Children

SCHOOL brings heart-centered mindfulness programs to Pre-K through 5th grade students and their dedicated educators in LA County public schools. Our weekly SCHOOL Kids Yoga & Mindfulness Classes for children ages 4-11 include storytelling, yoga-based movement, meditation, breathing techniques, and positive affirmations. 

Through simple, age-appropriate mindfulness techniques, students practice and develop essential skills -- listening, concentration, positive self-regulation and social/emotional skills -- at a critical stage in their development. SCHOOL programs encourage and reinforce beneficial qualities like patience, generosity, and empathy. We help increase academics and heartful attitudes within public school classrooms.

“Students use SCHOOL strategies to stay focused, to control impulses, and to resolve conflicts in socially appropriate ways.” - Nidia P., LAUSD Teacher

How We Help Public School Teachers

We are equally dedicated to serving public school teachers, who frequently report high levels of stress and burn-out. According to LA Unified School District, elementary school teachers spend at least 25% of their time addressing behavioral problems in the classroom. 

SCHOOL offers public school teachers much-needed support through our quarterly SCHOOL Kids Yoga & Mindfulness Teacher Trainings and monthly Professional Development Courses. We provide teachers and therapists with practical tools for integrating mindfulness in the classroom to create harmonious learning environments. Teachers consistently report improvements in student behavior, focus and listening, as well as improved discipline and communication in the classroom, as a result. 

"In the SCHOOL Teacher Training, I not only learned how to practice a daily routine with my students, it was also an eye-opener for me as a person. I have noticed a change in the way I take on daily challenges. It has impacted my students in their education and personal life, just as it supports me as a person and as a teacher." --Edith L., Mixed-Grade Special Needs Teacher

Why We're Raising Funds

Thanks to your generous support of our Indiegogo campaign last year, we were able to provide SCHOOL Kids Yoga & Mindfulness programs in 40 classrooms at 7 LA County public schools in the 2014-15 academic year (see map below). We reached 1,000 students and 50 teachers on a weekly basis throughout the entire school year, with limited staff and funding.   

The word is spreading about our positive impact in classrooms, and four more public schools are now requesting our services (see map below). 

Our goal is to raise $10,000 to support: 

  • Program expenses to sustain SCHOOL classes in current schools (reaching 1,000 students and 50 teachers)
  • Program expenses to expand SCHOOL classes to 4 additional public schools on a waiting list
  • Stipends for additional certified yoga teachers to teach SCHOOL classes ($20/class)
  • Partial scholarships for public school teachers to attend the SCHOOL Kids Yoga & Mindfulness Teacher Training
  • Program expenses for monthly professional development courses (ongoing support and refresher courses for teachers) 
Will you help us continue and expand our programs for children and teachers in the 2015-16 school year? No matter the amount, your gift will help ensure that we meet the growing demand for our services in LA public schools. 

Check out our Perks for more details on the impact of your contribution. The map below shows the LA County public schools YOUR donation will support! The yellow hearts represent schools with existing programs, while the red diamonds are waiting list schools.

How You Can Help! 

SCHOOL is a small nonprofit that relies on contributions from individuals and businesses in the community to provide our services. Please consider making a gift of any amount to help us bring the benefits of yoga and meditation into our public school system. We're offering great perks, like a set of 8 notecards with 4 calm heart drawings created by little yogis! 

You can also join us by spreading the word to family, friends & social networks: 

Facebook / Instagram: 

Support kids yoga & mindfulness programs in LA public schools! Join SCHOOL's Indiegogo campaign and get online yoga classes or notecards with "calm heart" designs drawn by little yogis. Perfect for sending to loved ones! bit.ly/calmhearts15

Twitter: 

Support kids yoga & mindfulness in LA public schools & get notecards w/"calm heart" designs drawn by little yogis! bit.ly/calmhearts15



More About SCHOOL, Inc. 

SCHOOL, Inc. (Smiling Calm Hearts Open Our Learning) is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit founded in 2012 by yoga teacher trainer and former studio owner Kelly Wood (E-RYT 200, RCYT, RPYT). In 2002, parents attending Kelly's Los Feliz yoga studio asked if she would teach their children yoga in their classrooms during the school day. Kelly began volunteering weekly in LA public schools, and has been working with children and teachers ever since. 

Drawing from more than 13 years experience teaching over 220,000 elementary school children, Kelly developed one of the first children's yoga programs accredited by Yoga Alliance (Hi Yoga). She then adapted this work for the public school setting, creating SCHOOL Kids Yoga & Mindfulness Classes and Teacher Trainings.

In 2013, Kelly was selected from over 1,800 yoga teachers to receive the Yoga Activist Award from the Moksha Festival of Los Angeles. And last year, the 45-hour SCHOOL Kids Yoga & Mindfulness Teacher Training was approved by the LAUSD Salary Point Committee for public school teachers and therapists. 

With your help, SCHOOL will continue to grow and serve even more children and teachers in Los Angeles schools.

story:
I am trying to raise money to fund my gymnastic apprenticeship. I am doing the best to raise what i can on my own but I need your help. Over the past years this training has changed my life and allowed me to do things I never could before. All I want is to be able to give back by teaching others and this is my way of getting the education to do that.

I am currently studying for my personal trainer and gym instructor cert. Also I have a varied martial arts background in BJJ, boxing, muay thai, MMA and stick fighting. In which I run a group and am Ireland first member of the dog brothers tribe. So if fitness or martial arts interest you please donate and I will do all I can to help.

story:
Short Summary

We have been communicating with Aron Ra and he is interested in speaking to the Chattanooga community. What we need to do is raise funds for venue, travel costs, and his modest honorarium request. If you've heard him speak or read his blog, you know that Aron Ra is a well-reasoned freethinker with a nearly encyclopedic knowledge on a number of issues.


What We Need & What You Get

Aron Ra has asked for a very modest honorarium of $250 and some assistance with travel expenses. Additionally, we would like to host this at a venue that will allow for folks from Chattanooga and the surrounding area to sit comfortably, hear him clearly, and have an opportunity to easily interact with him. In total, we think we can provide all this at a cost of about $2,000.

There will be guaranteed admission for those who contribute $10 or more towards  the campaign.

By contributing $50 or more, you will have an additional opportunity to join Aron Ra at a dinner following the lecture for a more intimate discussion. (Food and beverage costs not included)



The Impact

Chattanooga rarely hosts such high profile speakers on the subject of freethought/non-religion. This is an amazing opportunity to have one of the leading thinkers on this subject in this traditionally bible-minded region of the country. We realistically think we have the opportunity to reach as many as 200 people in the region.


Risks & Challenges

We know there's a lot of interest in the IDEA of Aron Ra speaking, but we need YOUR support to make it a REALITY. If we can't get close to our goal, the entire event will suffer from lack of comfort, ability to host a good crowd, and difficulty in hearing the lecture. Let's make sure we show Aron that freethought is alive and well in Chattanooga!

Other Ways You Can Help

Let your friends know about this fundraiser! With your support we'll have a fantastic event with lively discussion.
