story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
The International College of Thelema is searching for a new home!

And we need your help!  Ideally, we would love to own our headquarters building.  In such a case, this would be the first headquarters building to be wholly owned by a major Thelemic organization in the modern era.  At the very least, we need an easily accessible, full-time leased space to house our library and archives, perform our rituals and initiations, and host our classes.

Now is your chance to be a part of this historic step in Thelemic history!  We plan to engage Thelemites and the public alike in promulgation of the New Aeon, providing educational and social opportunities, and space to host a variety of ritual and recreational events for our initiates, other Thelemites, and community groups. It's time to move Thelema out of the chambers of our houses and into the marketplaces!

Since ICOT is a non-profit organization, your donations may be tax-deductible under applicable laws.

ICOT Headquarters and Event Space

The site will be used:

  • To support the ongoing work of the International College of Thelema, a tax-exempt 501(c)(3) non-profit organization
  • To house the offices, library and archives of ICOT, facilitating public access for browsing and research
  • To serve as classroom and lecture space for ICOT events
  • To serve as ritual space for Temple of the Silver Star events
  • To host other community organizations for their own events, rituals, etc.
  • To serve as a community center for cultural events, including art shows, music, lectures, etc. (Any rental/leasing fees or proceeds from such events will support the non-profit mission of ICOT.)

Our Inspiration:  The Eastern Star Temple

We were inspired to kick-off this campaign when we discovered that one particularly beautiful property was coming up for public auction:  The Eastern Star Temple at 2719 K Street in Sacramento, California.  Located in the vibrant midtown area of Sacramento, this 31,000 square foot historic building was home to the Order of the Eastern Star since it was built in 1928.  It is one of four buildings constructed for this purpose, and the only one still standing today.  The building is listed in the National Register of Historic Places as a "fine example of Romanesque Revival architecture."  

Click here for images of the building.

This is an amazing building with a lot of history, and plenty of space for multiple groups to hold ritual, lectures, meetings, parties, events, as well as full-scale dramatic productions and concerts (the building has two stages!). The starting bid on the auction is $750K--amazingly low when you consider the property, its history, and its prime location.  It is NOT likely that we'll be able to acquire this specific property, but it should give you an idea of the sort of space we are looking for. All donations will be used exclusively for property acquisition or full-time lease (after we cover the costs of manufacturing and shipping the perks).

We have set our fundraising goal at $10,000 due to the favorable terms Indiegogo offers when the goal is met--including the ability to continue using their site for fundraising even after the 60-day campaign ends.  This is designed to be a long-term, ongoing fundraising campaign, so naturally, we hope to receive much more than $10K over time.  Accordingly, it may be many months before a suitable property is identified and acquired.  But of course, the more you donate, the faster that day will come.

Join us as we make Thelemic history, and ensure that our tradition has a beautiful home for generations to come!


About Us

The International College of Thelema is a non-profit religious and educational organization based on the principles of Thelema.  It was founded in service to the A∴A∴, under warrant from Phyllis Seckler (Soror Meral), to provide preparatory training in ceremonial magick, Raja Yoga, Qabalah, Tarot, Astrology, and much more. Using these foundational tools, we seek to guide the student toward a deeper apprehension of the True Will, the Law of Thelema, and his or her own psychological and spiritual nature.


To learn more about our work, please visit our website.

story:
Hey everyone! My name is Joy and I am the founder of the sustainable non-profit organization Pendo Kenia e. V. I started in 2011 with a vision to create safe spaces for Kenyan children to gain education while contributing to the surrounding community. In partnership with Forum for Orphans in Malindi (FOM), my father’s organization, we set out to build a better future by building schools for orphans and needy children in the rural area, and giving sustainable knowledge to the surrounding community. Fast forward 4 years, 9 schools, and nearly 1,000 students later, it is safe to say that we are headed in the right direction.



We are here today to share a special project with you, constructing a sanitation system in Mgandini, the very first school we built. Currently students are using the surrounding grounds of the school as a restroom, which results in many illnesses among the children. Many of them have contracted illnesses from the Tunga penet rans (Jigger) parasitic flea, which lives in soil and sand, and feeds intermittently on warm-blo oded hosts, such as humans and cattle. The children do not have shoes, so when walking in the sand, the parasites penetrate through the skin on their feet. We are doing a health-care prog ram with each school that provides a nurse on a monthly basis to take care of the health of the children, but without a sanitation system it is hard to tackle this problem.


The School Mgandini is located in a rural area about 80 km from Malindi, a town on the coast of Kenya.The school has four teachers, rotating volunteers, and 126 children aged from 3 to 11 years. Mgandini is dear to us because it was the first opportunity to put our passion and experience to work for the benefit of the Malindi community. The impact on the community has been overwhelming. Originally built in 2003, we were finally able to rebuild it in 2014.

Mgandini 2008

Mgandini 2014


With the construction of the new building we included a water pump, but we were unable to build a sanitation system. On the property the children still need a dedicated lavatory space. Without the system in place our students are contracting otherwise avoidable illnesses that threaten the social, educational, and environmentalprogress we have made in the area. Despite outside support, we lack funding to complete this project and are reaching out to other like-minded supporters to participate in funding this campaign.With your help we can finally build the toilts and washing rooms to give the kids and the community a better environment. If we should get more donations than we are asking for in this campaign, it will automatically go to our next school building.



Pendo Kenia is a registere non-profit based in Germany. To learn more about ourorganization, Forum for Orphans in Malindi (FOM), and our other projects visit us online at www.pendo-kenia.org or on facebook www.facebook.de/pendo.kenia. If you have any questions about us and our projects you can also send us an email to j.reiche@pendo-kenia.org. We are more that happy to get in contact with you. (Over the announcmentbar on our german website you get to the english site of Pendo Kenia!)

Thank you so much for reading and being part of the Pendo Kenia story. With your help you are changing lives!



Feel free to get in contact with us to talk about support options. We are happy about people who want to visit us in Kenya and share their knowledge with us.

We are happy if you tell your family and friends about us and our projects. You can share our website, like us on facebook and share our links.

We are happy for everyone who can spread our word Pendo.

With the construction of the new building we included a water pump, but we were unable to build a sanitation system. On the property the children still need a dedicated lavatory space. Without the system in place our students are contracting otherwise avoidable illnesses that threaten the social, educational, and environmentalprogress we have made in the area. Despite outside support, we lack funding to complete this project and are reaching out to other like-minded supporters to participate in funding this campaign.With your help we can finally build the toilts and washing rooms to give the kids and the community a better environment. If we should get more donations than we are asking for in this campaign, it will automatically go to our next school building.


Pendo Kenia is a registere non-profit based in Germany. To learn more about ourorganization, Forum for Orphans in Malindi (FOM), and our other projects visit us online at www.pendo-kenia.org or on facebook www.facebook.de/pendo.kenia. If you have any questions about us and our projects you can also send us an email to j.reiche@pendo-kenia.org. We are more that happy to get in contact with you. (Over the announcmentbar on our german website you get to the english site of Pendo Kenia!)
Thank you so much for reading and being part of the Pendo Kenia story. With your help you are changing lives!
Feel free to get in contact with us to talk about support options. We are happy about people who want to visit us in Kenya and share their knowledge with us.We are happy if you tell your family and friends about us and our projects. You can share our website, like us on facebook and share our links.We are happy for everyone who can spread our word Pendo.

story: Hi All! Kaenin is a great basketball player moreover he is an intelligent young man. He loves History and has earned the right to go on a trip, to see the East Coast with fellow History B+ students! We have his trip confirmed and deposit made, (Thank you to those who helped) Now all we need to do is raise enough funds to pay for the rest of the trip and some funds for him to have while visiting. Please view the Itinerary that is attached, the slide show (for your viewing pleasures:), and then please donate to keep his seat on this plane. ( Anything is appreciated) This trip will fill his brain with tons of knowledge and his eyes with tons of experiences. This trip is earned and not given therefore Kaenin will have to remain  a B+ History student his first half of his 8th grade school year and he will sign a behavior contract that will be tracked by the school themselves. Kaenin will do his part and we are hoping you all, will help with the financial part! The trip is approximately $2400 and as of right now we need about $2100 more. Please Help! Yes, Kaenin loves basketball however, son has more interests and potential than sports alone! Let's show our children they can be both athletic and smart!! Thank you for your time and attention. Sincerely, Kaenin and Tara

story:
My Story

Hello!

My name is Bettina Kaiping and I am an International Relations student at UC Davis. I absolutely love languages and I have dreams of becoming an translator after college. That's why I'm currently working toward studying abroad in France for the Fall of 2015 which is, as it turns out, pretty expensive.

A little bit about me, if you were interested. I am from Southern California, where I live with my two parents and older brother. My family is very important to me and they have always been there for me in every way that matters, even when they can't support me financially. My desire to go abroad is definitely something that scares them – me being that far away for so long isn't really a dream for any of them – but they have always supported my decisions and done their best to help me achieve my goals.

My dad and me last winter break

I am very active here on campus at UC Davis as well. It's about a 7 hour drive away from my family, so I live in Davis during the school year. I've had three different jobs on campus, which help me pay the rent and groceries, and I've really come to love it here. Since I've been here, I have been studying International Relations as well as French and Russian. I've been studying Russian for several years now and I just started French. I honestly adore languages and I really want to be a translator after college (it's probably embarrassing how much I like languages; my roommates can attest to it, particularly given the amount I talk at them in languages they don't actually know).

Me and my friends/coworkers at UC Davis Orientation

My Goal

The goal is, as you might imagine, to pay for me to study abroad.

The flight alone will cost about $1500 and that's not even to mention tuition and fees which will end up costing around $13,000 (that's a whole year of tuition at UC Davis, yikes). Just thinking about the cost is pretty terrifying, but I am very determined to make it work. Some help funding this would change everything!

If you have a few dollars that you're willing to part with to send a broke college student abroad, please do. Whether or not you can, spreading the word to any of your friends or family is also very helpful.

Thank you in advance!

-Bettina :)

P.S. You may have noticed that I didn't set the goal amount at the full cost of the program. I did this on purpose because I know how daunting $13,000 is. Just paying for the flight would be a tremendous help and if I get a bit more than that, I'd be pretty happy too.

story:
Are you interested in helping children and their families learn the skills they need to lead healthier lives?

Yes? Then sponsoring a child with Coqui the Chef is a great way to start! 

Coqui the Chef teaches young people and their families in the South Bronx how to cook healthier meals with ingredients right from their kitchen. Inspired from Dora the Explorer and Barney and friends, Coqui the Chef uses a fun, friendly mascot to teach children the importance of building healthy habits through cooking and nutrition classes.

With YOUR SUPPORT Coqui the Chef can teach more kids in New York City!

 

 

What we need & What you get

 

 

What we need is to raise $10, 000 for in-person and online cooking and nutrition classes for kids and their families. Your dollars will help fund for recipe ingredients, kitchen tools, chef clothing, educational materials, trips to farms, and professional filming of all classes so for online sharing on social media!

What you get...Every PERK is unique! Not only do you receive a gift for your donation and the feel good vibes of knowing you are a child’s culinary hero!Your name or organization will also be displayed on our online “Culinary Hero Wall.”

What YOU get from the foodie club and surprise gift by mail?

Coqui the Chef foodie club...YOU ARE THE FIRST TO KNOW!
You get VIP access to all events, printable/downloadable copies of Coqui the Chef the new recipes, discounts for products and workshops, and behind the scenes look at our cooking show. 

 

Surprise by Mail...Well what is that?
It wouldn't be a surprise if I tell you, but I promise you are going to love it! The junior chef you sponsor will pick out the gift they want to give you PLUS they will send you a personal thank you letter. How sweet is that? 

 

 

 

 

The Impact

 

The cooking classes...More than 1 in 6 children and adolescents ages 6 to 19 are considered to be overweight or obese.  Obese children, moreover, are more likely to become obese adults with serious health complications.  Your support and Coqui the Chef can save the lives of many children who need a new and fun perspective on food and health.

The cooking show... "Cooking with Coqui the Chef" is for kids who can't come to our class but want to be part of experience and/or need to refresh their culinary skills.

Organizations like the American Heart Association, Citizens Committee for New York City (CCNYC), City Harvest and South Bronx Police Athletic League have collaborated with our mission. We recently were given CCNYC "The Osborn Elliott Award for Community Service." The media; TV Networks, newspapers and radio stations have spoken of our social work giving us credit for the wonderful work we have done with the kids in the South Bronx.

Our media highlights include...Bronx News Channel 12, WPIX Channel 11, the Daily News, ABC’s “The Chew," TLC’s “What Not to Wear,” and WNYC Radio

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word about this campaign on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram @coquithechef #coquithechef
  • Get a group of friends together at home and cook along with Coqui the Chef and his junior chefs on YouTube
  • Stay connected. Follow Coqui the Chef on Facebook and on Twitter to stay up-to-date on all of his favorite recipes!

Muchas gracias! Thank you!

~Tania Lopez, Chris Ackerman, Coqui the Chef and our amazing team

 

PRESS Do you want to write about our fundraising campaign or social mission? Email coquithechef[at]gmail.com 

 

 

PRESS Do you want to write about our fundraising campaign or social mission? Write to coquithechef[at]gmail.com
